Reviews.Title: “Does what is says 'on the tin'”
Reviews.Author: T&NBristol
Reviews.Content: We (family of 3) stayed over the Easter weekend. The location for getting out and about is great and ideal for using the Park and Ride at the fashion centre which was just a short tram trip away. Room good size, clean and well presented. Staff very approachable and friendly. HOWEVER as mentioned in some other posts beware of the outside noise. We were given a room overlooking the rear street and the noise from drunken revellers until 3-4am was very bad. Worse is the taxi drivers who just sit outside blaring their horns in a random manner and just as you get off to sleep the trams start up at 6! - think the hotel should mention this in their literature and fit double glazing. We spoke to reception and without question moved us to a quieter room overlooking the canal - this side of the hotel was in complete contrast to where we had been (even double glazing fitted !), almost as if two hotels were operating in the same location. Finally on checking out beware of the city tax despite having booked through hotels.com and having an invoice saying all taxes etc included you will be expected to pay a further (5%) when you check out. Overall the hotel is fine but nothing out of the ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Littlebody
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amsterdam American Hotel (Hampshire Eden) from 31st March until 3rd April. Unfortunately (due to a delayed flight) we arrived at the hotel late (9.30 pm) but check in went smoothly and quickly and in fact we were given an upgraded room! We were on the 6th floor with great views from a lovely sitting area of Amsterdam and one of its canals. The hotel was spotlessly clean with a lovely bar area and a separate restaurant. All the staff members we met were very friendly and could not do enough for us. We had lunch and one breakfast in the art dÃ©cor restaurant and both times it was wonderful. The bar was a lovely haven to enjoy a drink or two and a bar snack after a busy day sightseeing in Amsterdam. The hotel itself is in a lovely area (The Leidseplein) close to lots of shops, restaurants and bars. Although a busy area we felt safe wandering at night and enjoying a meal in a restaurant and a drink in the open air bars. Overall we had a very relaxing 4 night stay and will definitely be using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, big welcoming rooms and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Santino D
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful, professional and informative. Hotel was located near shopping, food and sights. Hotel had coupons that provided discount towards attraction purchases. Just an FYI, the minibar is monitored by computer and anything that is removed is assumed to have been used. We informed staff that we had purchased some food and drink which were placed into fridge. We had taken out a few items to make some room. I spoke to one of the reception personnell and reversed the charges without delay. You can get the cooler emptied too if you wish to place your own food and drink into it. Great staff, great room, great location. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: norfolk23
Reviews.Content: For a week-end away, I booked a junior suite at the American Hotel in Amsterdam. It was a fairly flat experience, the staff are perfectly nice but let down by circumstances out of their control. The American is part of a chain of hotels that appear to have no style or positioning. What is a very grand location is supported by a bland could be anywhere approach - it could have been any charmless provincial hotel. I was very disappointed to find the junior suite doubled up as a conference room and therefore had all the charm and ambience of an insurance office. Even the bed (reasonably comfortable) was a fold up - one picture on the wall and no mirror in the room. For the money I could have done better. To be fair at check-out when I told them I was disappointed, they were at pains to say I should have told them but - who needs the hassle on a 2 night break? The American Bar and the American Cafe which are within the hotel ooze period style but the hotel itself is totally forgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in strategic location”
Reviews.Author: lisatgg
Reviews.Content: Hotel is strategically located in leidseplein, close to vondelpark and museumplein, while dam square is abt 10-15mins walk. It's facing a canal. Plenty of comedy shows, restaurants, bars including hard rock cafe etc after sunset. Hotel building is art deco & the restaurant, Cafe American are also mentioned as a place to be seen in a guidebook which features the most amazing decor and great lemon pie. Stayed for 3 nights & was upgraded to deluxe room with leidseplein view. Room and bathroom was spacious. Sleep was very comfortable with firm mattress, soft blankets and pillows except that the walls are thin so noisy if u have neighbours. Toiletries offered are "ritual" brand which smells amazing. The hotel offers free business centre which is convenient to print out online check in boarding pass or online tickets etc.Overall service is good with prompt attention to requests. Overall, great stay & would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing standard of hospitality and help”
Reviews.Author: pmonk476
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend - March 31 to April 4 to visit our son and celebrate his birthday.The room was on the canal side as requested, a good size, very clean and comfortable. On the Sunday night my husband, who is diabetic, had a very severe hypo - very low blood sugars with fitting. Help arrived as soon as I rang down. Two very well trained members of staff, Paul and Ribiqa, helped me with my husband until the paramedics arrived, and saw us out to the ambulance. They dealt with the drama of a guest going out of the 4th floor window calmly and efficiently - it couldn't have been smoother. Ribiqa packed a bag for us, and all staff facilitated our exit well. The hotel rang the hospital to see how we were, paid for our taxi and welcomed us back even though it was gone midnight.Food and drink was provided free of charge, and all night staff showed a huge degree of concern. The follow up was amazing too. We saw managers and general managers who knew all about it, asked after my husband's progress, and took the time to sit with us and chat. The kindness and care shown was completely genuine. I can't thank all those involved enough. Paul took especial care to make sure the rest of our trip was good. I feel like we have made friends through this somewhat traumatic experience. We plan to stay at the hotel whenever we go to Holland now. We travel there a number of times a year to see our son, and really appreciate the good choice we made. The hotel is so central, and you can get a bus to the airport for only 4 Euros from just outside. We had no problems with noise, and slept very well. The room was always cleaned, no matter what time of day we left it. And a tip for those who thought it was a bit 'tired'. Marcel, one of the general managers, said the same himself, and told us that a sympathetic and floor by floor renovation is to take place soon, so all the more reason to stay there! Thanks again, everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, if you plan carefully”
Reviews.Author: Castorp
Reviews.Content: We booked a large room at the Amsterdam American, and it was quite nice -- on a corner overlooking the square, with plenty of room for a roll-away bed. The hotel itself is a landmark, and it is really well located -- we easily walked to everything we wanted to see and do in Amsterdam. There was some noise in the afternoon from the tram, cars, and people. But then came Friday night, and our nice corner perch over the Leidseplein became very, very noisy with the sounds of traffic, clubs, and partiers. If you are planning on staying out late to party in Amsterdam, none of this will be a problem. We weren't, and it was. But, this was not the hotel's fault, and they moved us to a different room for our second night. The second room was on the canal side of the hotel and, while not as interesting, was also very large, with two queen beds. We slept wonderfully. Breakfast in the beautiful dining room was expensive, but there was a lot of very good food to choose from. The room service continental breakfast for 1 could easily feed 2 people. Our bottom line: if you are there over the weekend and want to sleep, ask for a canal side room. If you are partying or it is during the week, don't worry too much about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: clare_rohan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in August 2012 and really enjoyed our stay. Biggest plus is the great location, close to public transport, Vondelpark, music venues, canals. The room was large and clean and comfortable. We slept well in the comfortable bed. The staff were helpful, though reception was quite busy at times, possibly could do with more staff. Amsterdam is expensive, and we found this place a bit dear, but reasonable in comparison to others. We'd stay here again if we needed a hotel in Amsterdam. As an aside, we also stayed with friends in Amsterdam, who said "wow, that's where the rock stars stay!"... Evidenced by the autograph book opened to the page of Amy Winehouse during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Suman T
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our vacation in Amsterdam and our stay in the American Hotel. The location of this beautiful building was perfect! We had a deluxe room with a canal view. The room was very clean and comfortable with everything you need. The bathroom was small but a full size shower and terry robes.

Reviews.Title: “good location, poor experience”
Reviews.Author: Zol
Reviews.Content: The location is great. Still the overall experience is below a 4 stars expectation as the hotel needs some in depth renovation. The check in at 15 o'clock is a bit unusual .The tram is a bit disturbing due to the noise If you buy the trip with a promotion it worth. Decent overall.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the weekend with affordable price”
Reviews.Author: JLOHolland
Reviews.Content: The rooms are basic but you will have a nice place to stay almost at the Leidseplein. Breakfast room is nice although tables could be tidied up faster so one does not have to look for a clean table. But price quality wise not a bad hotel at a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive faÃ§ade & great location”
Reviews.Author: Bollebop
Reviews.Content: When arriving at the hotel, the faÃ§ade & location of the hotel are pretty impressive, but what a dissapointment when entering... The interior of the hotel lacks all the grandeur of this magnificent art-deco building, which is a pitty. The room itself is a bit outdated, but overall clean and pretty large to be in the centre of a city. Service is what you expect in these kind of hotels : great! Be carefull to go to the restaurant which is in the same building : although the food is OK, the waiters & service isn't.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hubresident
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, clean and quiet. They have computer for anyone needing to check in. Had problems with the mini bar constanitly putting charges on our bill (so make sure you check this) but the hotel easily took the charges off. Dining room is BEAUTIFUL and the bar was also nice and had a great view of all the street activity. Great value for the price.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Trip”
Reviews.Author: Boley G
Reviews.Content: I flew solo into Amsterdam for the express purpose of seeing a concert at the Paradiso. This Hotel had a fantastic location within a few blocks of the venue. I was travelling solo and American Hotel had everything I needed. Clean, efficient, great service, great bar and food at the adjacent Bar American. I walked the entire city, and had a fantastic time. The location and services at this hotel made it a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Good rate, good location, old rooms”
Reviews.Author: Timootje81
Reviews.Content: We had a good rate for a double room for 60 euro per room per night on a friday! The location is great, close by all the tourist attractions. The rooms are very old and need some renovation but if that means the price will be higher they should not renovate it. The bathroom was very old and also the bed was not modern. Staff was not good but also not bad. The size and interior of the rooms are more like a three star hotel. The building itself looks amazing. If you keep this rates we will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a bite to eat in a relaxing atmosphere. Great chef.”
Reviews.Author: BigJohnDeere
Reviews.Content: We only had lunch, but enjoyed the overall experience so much we came again the following day. The Cod was amazing. Good sized portion cooked to total perfection, lovely and juicy. Congrats to the chef. Day two was the homemade burger, again real beef, no fat and cooked to your liking. Well done to all concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Redjovie
Reviews.Content: Another fantastic stay in the Amsterdam American Hotel, Hampshire Eden. The staff are very friendly and very helpful and I want to give a special mention to Jermain, who is always smiling, very happy and very very helpful. I would also like to congratulate the concierge service who are second to none when it comes to information about Amsterdam, the are a credit to the hotel. The hotel is very clean and fresh and a beautiful building with lots of information about its history. We will be visiting again very soon

Reviews.Title: “Slow service, Well cooked food, Wonderful Interior”
Reviews.Author: Lilypad_hopper
Reviews.Content: Ate lunch here after a trip to the Van Gogh Museum. It took an hour for our food to arrive. Fairly standard fare but well cooked. Art Deco Interior is worth the pain of the hunger pangs. Newspapers available to while away the wait. Waiters friendly but soooo slow!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: sinderella3
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The central location is great as most sites were in walking distance. The interior lacks a little charm as I usually prefer boutique hotels, but for the much more reasonable price tag the room and especially beds were super comfortable. I would recommend however to book a deluxe room for the extra space. And should you order room service breakfast, you really only need to order one breakfast for 2 people as it is massive. I would book again

Reviews.Title: “Close but not there yet.”
Reviews.Author: Woollybear
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent. Reception is helpful and courteous. The rooms are first class. You could not wish for a better bar. The Cafe is a superb Art Nouveau spectacular - when it is open - and therein lies the problem. During our stay it was closed for a private function without residents being informed. The weather outside was a blizzard and the only offering was a limited menu in the bar which is notbreally adequate - great bard - dinner, no!!! Communication is the big problem. Information in the room was wrong about quite a few things. That said, they are going through change at present and it may all settle down. The enthusiasm of the staff will show through.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location staff has an attitude”
Reviews.Author: Hogan224
Reviews.Content: for not sleeping but just have a bite and some coffee and drinks in the Cafe , i felt that the staff has a big attitude towards their guests. Its a pitty beceause its a nice hotel on a beautifull central location. But because off the staff my experience is not good and I dont like to come back any more. Fifteen minutes wait to get your drinks (coffee and wine) is way to long!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, small, but well-appointed room”
Reviews.Author: S_C_Barnes
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel located on the edge of the center of Amsterdam. It's located right outside of the Leidseplein. The staff was very polite and helped us out several times. The hotel is easy walking distance to much of the old city. It's also right by a Canal Bus stop and a tram stop. Our room was small, but very well appointed. It was also very clean. We lacked much of a view, but since we didn't spend much time in the room, that was not a big deal. The onsite restaurant, the CafÃ© Americain, was very good as well. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: thedipstick
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel to stay , very close to some good bars and the tram stops right outside. American bar is lively and the restaurant food is very good but the waiters are a bit rude. Reception staff were very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Greeny777
Reviews.Content: I have visited Amsterdam 13times in last 9 years and this was by far the best hotel I have stayed in whilst visiting this wonderfull city. Location is fantastic. The building itself is very grand an I have seen the exterior refurbs during my previous visit. Breakfast is great I recommend ordering the waffles and omelette breakfast is 15euro if you order in advance at reception also prosecco for breakfast Our room was lovely bed was comfy Staff were also great an hotel bar great.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of somewhere”
Reviews.Author: HerbertvonCarryOn
Reviews.Content: At first I thought I was put in this hotel because I am an American. But I later found out through my wanderings that it is because it is close to everywhere in central Amsterdam, in particular the Leidseplein and all the hoopla that surrounds it, especially in the evenings. But I liked the proximity to the tram stops and its location right on a beautiful canal. You are also close to the launch points of the canal cruise boats and walking distance to the Jordaan and some really cool shops. In the other direction is Paradiso, the temple of rock music, and a groovy noodle joint, Wagamama. Not too far from that is the land of Bflat restaurants catering to the tourists, mostly the ones who have taken advantage of the local brews and herbs. Caution is advised at night in this area. The Hotel itself has become somewhat battered over the years although the restaurant is grand in design and nice to look at. The rooms are mixed between the standard Euro neutered hotel room and the "wear your shoes all the time" dirty carpet room. our first room had a window overlooking the AC condensers. We did afterwards get a pretty nice "suite" overlooking the Lplein, which was lively theatre in itself. The breakfast has a lot of food, but not of very good quality. Ask for a room on the canal and not on the Lplein or the back, when you can hear the serenade of the trams going by all night. In the end it was a decent place to stay, but you can certainly do better to stay in a nicer spot away from the crowds and take the tram to the Lplein when you feel being in a crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Location location”
Reviews.Author: Julia75
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a work conference, so may be judging the hotel harshly, but I wouldnt choose to stay here if i went to Amsterdam again Pros: good location, reception staff were lovely, very helpful Cons: room was so dark i couldnt find anything (take a torch). It was also the smallest room ive ever had - just enough room to walk around the bed, but nowhere to put suitcase Noisy - because of location, my colleagues and i were woken by drunk people yelling alot through the night, and trams/ buses early in morning (take earplugs) Food hit and miss - i had a delicious sandwich on last day, but my colleagues had a really bad meal one night that saw them all in burger king afterwards

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel... Rude reception staff!”
Reviews.Author: Jennylee2011
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel last minute for New Years Eve, after recommendation from a friend, for myself, a friend and my sister and her partner. The hotel reception was beautifully decorated so i had high expectations for the room. When checking in we found the receptionist (female) to be very dismissive and actually quite rude. We enquired about local parking facilities as we had drove (8 hours!) and wanted to move the car from outside the building. The man on reception was trying to help and the female member of staff kept interrupting him as he was explaining where to go. When filling in all the paperwork the female receptionist was very condescending and looked like she really couldnt be bothered speaking to us. I had booked one double room (for my sister) and one twin room (for myself) online but upon arrival was told that it was 2 twin rooms. When i informed her that one room should be a double she waved her hand at me to stop me from talking so she could continue her conversation with the man behind the desk. We decided to take a look at the rooms as we were all tired from a long day of travelling. Our room was nice and clean although in need of some restoration but it was comfortable. The room was very hot during our stay and we were disappointed to find that the window did not open. I know its winter but it can get quite stuffy when there is heating on. The was a thermostat on the wall which we lowered but it didnt seem to make a difference. The amenities were good, coffee and tea making facilities were in the room as well as a hairdryer, TV (with quite a few english speaking channels), mini bar (over priced but arent they all!) and iron and ironing board. My sister returned to reception to enquire about getting a double room which they still had available. When they went to view the room, the standard wasnt as good as the twin so they decided to keep the original. The staff in the restaurant/bar were very friendly and attentive. When checking out, a different receptionist dealt with us and she was polite and efficient. The porter, who help us with our bags at check out was also very nice. It was a shame that the first night tainted our experience with the hotel, i hope it was an isolated incident.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Chris C
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and the room is in a relatively good condition considering it's a historic building. Walking distance to everywhere but make sure you have a good pair of shoe as the sidewalk in Europe is bumpy!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place to stay at christmas”
Reviews.Author: sally t
Reviews.Content: Hotel was amazing art deco monument with an american twist. Room was great and big, the staff could not do enough fo us when we asked for extra hangers and also directions to tourist places and also where the best night clubs were. They made phone calls and went on the internet on our behalf. Got the room we requested over looking canal and the reception was very intersting with pictures and paintings of American rock stars! The ajoining restaurant looked fantastic but was unfortunately booked up Christmas day, it also was a tadge too expensive for our budget. The bar in the hotel was funky with good atmosphere. So glad we found this hotel as it was such an excellent location with bars, clubs and restaurants on the door step. Also a much more up market location and nicer place to stay than if we had picked somewhere in central amsterdam. Having said that central Amsterdam was still only 15 mins walk away and that was where the red light district was, thats if you wanted to have a look and a laugh! Or even quicker by trams which were convieniently located directly outside the hotel - numbers 1, 2 and 5 would get you there. There were some of the main museums very close by including the Van Gough and also there was an area near by that had a comedy cafe and a Hard Rock cafe. The other places of interest to myself like the Anne Frank house were still all within walking distance. In fact no where is really too far to walk, and the walks themselves are very pleasant admiring the different architcture of the buildings, churches and houses. Just watch out for the bikes, they come flying around every corner and everyone seems to own one young and old! Would definately stay at this hotel again, loved it and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sara M
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for New Years Eve as the balconies have a great view for the fireworks that go off all across the city. Our room was an OK size but on the small side. The bed was super comfy and everything was perfectly clean. I didn't have breakfast there this year but I have had it there quite a few times and it is always nice. The champagne is always an added bonus. Reception staff were very friendly. We ordered a taxi as we were leaving one arrive within 5 minutes. There is a taxi rank about 5 minutes walk away which I think is cheaper than getting one from the hotel but as the weather was so awful we decided to get one from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mark A
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the property for 9 days. This was at least my sixth stay here. The location was great. The staff was extremely friendly. In one incident I had hurt my back (off property) and the staff was very efficient that I got the right medical attention and followed up during the next couple of days to see how I was doing or if I needed anything. There were two aspects I didn't quite understand. While I realize the hotels often change their brand affinity, I can't understand why there have been so many. It was Intercontinental during my first stay, Summit for the next three, Eden for one or two and when I got there this time it wa a Hampshire property. I would also strongly recommend that the hotel change it's internet provider. Right now they are using a company called Wentzo which gave me nothing but problems (I even purchased their highest end product). I would think that a hotel of this category should use a better provider with faster speeds such as Swisscom. Despite the above, I would have no problemstaying at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Hazel1978
Reviews.Content: Just walked through the door back home, from a great trip to Amsterdam. This hotel was amazing amazing. I mainly attribute this to the superb wonderful hospitality of the staff. I'm the fussiest person when it comes to hotels and in particular customer service. They would go above and beyond for any request. They were super friendly, professional and made anything possible. The hotel location is perfect, the building beautiful -always people taking photos while we were on our great spacious balcony. The rooms were great - we chose a smaller room due to huge balcony although we were offered a much bigger room. Unknown to me this was my boyfriend's choice as he later proposed on it on new years eve! Due to minor room dysfunction few days later they immediately moved us to a very nice room minus the large balcony. Overall fantastic - particularly Mathilda, salmi, pavan, Abdul ( And 2 tall Dutch slim blonde males - sorry didn't get names!) who were all super wonderful. Hope the hotel manager gets to see this as he/she should be very proud of their hotel's very high level of professionalism, customer care and generally very nice people. Ok, that's enough gushing from me. Go and stay there you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable with tons of Character”
Reviews.Author: TheRupes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a family Christmas Holiday and could not have asked for more. The staff were friendly at reception and breakfast and the Bar is as good a Hotel bar I have ever been in due to it's atmosphere and good service. The room was large with all expected amenities and the Leidesplein is a great location near all the Amsterdam attractions without it being in some of the dodgier parts of town. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: WDxDangermouse
Reviews.Content: For Amsterdam this hotel is better than some of the 5 stars we stayed at. They had a very helpful reception, who helped us with a couple of simple requests. Room as located in the middle so the view was poor, which was a shame. Bed was a little weird, lumpy in places, pillows are Tiny!... please change them management!.. Also something which is always annoying me, but a little personnal!.. The toilet tissue.. ok guys.. you are a 4 star hotel.. please buy toilet paper which reflects this, not cheap and nasty.. its makes a diffrence! Bathroom was almost clean, few dirty tiles, shower was difficult to use as tubing was twisted. Overall the room was not bad for Amsterdam. Amstercan bar was great! if a little exspensive, but its famous!.. what did we expect ;) Prepurchased breakfast was a plus at 15 Euros each. Bacon was terrible for me, too burnt, and stood there too long. Everything else was nice. Overall nice hotel, nice staff, alittle dirty in places, and some cheap corner cutting, for the price. Well done guys, keep up the good work, and please change those pillows!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed twice now & would not stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: rebeccaeady
Reviews.Content: As stated in the title, we have stayed at this hotel before. When we first started travelling to Amsterdam we always admired this hotel, honestly, it is a beautiful building and right on the doorstep of Leidesplein. We stayed on the 9th December 2011 for 3 nights. There is not alot more I can add to this review as I have previously stated all the benefits of staying at this hotel already. The history of this hotel is fascinating & if you are interested in it, the lobby has a huge wall dedicated to what the hotel was used for, has been, the construction etc. Worth a read. The room we were given was a little smaller than our previous stay, however, as a travel agent I did request a room overlooking the canal/any room upgrades, we received a balcony room overlooking the canal which was beautiful! It is very quiet & peaceful, somewhat cold however in the month of December. Our room was cleaned daily by maid service, everything restocked & replenished in the bathroom. There is tea/coffee making facilities in the room, after a long day walking and exploring this is welcome! As always the beds are just to die for, we always end up sleeping most of the time we are here as the beds are just so comfy & inviting! See my last review for more details, you will not be dissapointed with these beds I can assure you. We were only on a Room only basis, as breakfast is extortinately priced we feel. It is about 20 Euros per person, per day to do so, we were quite happy to hop over the Sports Cafe (formally a Pancake corner) to eat a full english or local pancakes for about & Euros each. We paid the local tax on arrival which was about 20 Euros. They do try and take a deposit of about 100 Euros a day to cover ''incidentals'' off some form of credit/debit card - we always have argued this with them on arrival as neither time have we booked this hotel has it stated it in the contract that this is to be exepcted (as a travel agent I am pretty firmed up on things like this!) nor do we ever use things such as the mini bar etc. We politely refused and the receptionist locked the mini bar so we were not able to use this. You do need to be firm with them to make them realise you do not wish to have a ''hold deposit'' on your card details though. This year Amsterdam have really gone to town with Christmas, in previous years we have always had an ice skating rink just a few 100 metres from the hotel, this year it was like a full-on Christmas market on Leidesplein, it did seem a lot busier attracting alot of tourists! We always enjoy staying at this hotel, paticularly for the area. Our favourite coffeeshop is The Bulldog and the hotel is a stones throw away, plus there are so many bars and restaraunts you really have a choice! We paticularly like to visit the Thai, Mai Thai everytime we travel here as the food is good & reasonably priced. Overall, as stated before we would have absolutley no hesitation in staying at this hotel & will ALWAYS be our first choice for accommodation in this delightful city. We would like to thank the hotel for such an enjoyable second stay and we hope they have a lovely new year!

Reviews.Title: “Some good and some bad”
Reviews.Author: Amber L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel over the Christmas period and there was much to recommend the hotel. The location is excellent, easy to get to all of the major tourist attractions and with plenty of bars, restaurants etc... nearby. We would highly recommend the Christmas day dinner, both the food and service were excellent - a lovely atmosphere for the evening. We had a drink every night in the bar and again the service and atmosphere were great. On the less positive side we had only booked a standard room but it was not even 4 star standard, very dark, cramped and noisy which others have mentioned in their reviews. The breakfast was taken for two days in a meeting room which was odd and very unattractive whilst the main dining room was being prepared for Christmas day. The brunch on 26 December was very poor - food had been kept barely warm and without heated plates it was soon cold. We did mention this to the waiter who charmingly brought me a lovely dessert plate but the main courses were very disappointing. Overall would we stay again - probably but I should like to see a much better room, more service from reception staff and I wouldn't pay to eat their 'famous' christmas buffet.

Reviews.Title: “A classic”
Reviews.Author: Lozio
Reviews.Content: Elegant, cozy hotel. Staff a little bit rude, but they were under pressure with a lot of people there in the small hall. Rooms are nice but maybe not classy like the prestigious name of the property. And too small. A junior suite is like a superior in other hotels in the heart of Amsterdam. Location could not be better.

Reviews.Title: “Large room”
Reviews.Author: monaguiar
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay in large room with much comfort. Service in restaurant a little deficient. Not many choices in restaurant either but the hotel is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JapanTravelExplorer
Reviews.Content: Nice art deco hotel with the best location in town!

Reviews.Title: “great location, comfortable short stay”
Reviews.Author: makeittso
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on my way out of the netherlands. Very good location -- walking distance to a number of museums, sights, and restaurant areas, and near a number of tram lines (including one that goes straight to the train station). Room was average sized for European city hotels (read: small-ish) and comfortable enough for a short stay, especially if traveling alone and you don't plan to spend all your time in your hotel. Wi-fi and breakfast were extra, which is a downside. My room had a balcony, which was nice, though too cold to use.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: benedetta73
Reviews.Content: I have just spent a very pleasant weekend in Amsterdam where I stayed at the Eden Amsterdam American Hotel. The hotel is charming and, at the same time, efficient. It is an a strategic location to visit the city and it has a good business center, where, unfortunately, I had to spend a few hours workingâ€¦ Our room was comfortable and very big, the bathroom average, but clean. The room had a beautiful view on the canal. Plus, I found the personnel quite helpful. The hotel also offers an ok American bar and a very charming restaurant. Very good value for money. I recommend it

Reviews.Title: “a bit of a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Dale S
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in September, and were disappointed in the feel and ambience of this hotel. It gave no special feel for being in Amsterdam or The Netherlands, but felt like a tired, barely trying, business hotel. The location is central to a lot of the city's main attractions but is also located at the end of the city's most unpleasant tourist strip. When we revisit Amsterdam we will stay somewhere smaller,with more charm, and away from the main street, in one of the numerous very beautiful backstreets.

Reviews.Title: “Returning again for New Year at The American Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BmthTraveller
Reviews.Content: Booked for the third time for New Year in Amsterdam.... it's a great place to be on 31st December.. the party goes on and on. As regular visitors to Amsterdam over the years, we treated ourselves to this hotel a few years' ago for our wedding anniversary. We'd often taken cocktails in the fabulous cocktail lounge but never stayed until then. Now, we can't bring ourselves to stay anywhere else. It's location is spot on and the hotel is just lovely. Rather like my view for Iberostar Punta Cana, we find that if you return to a hotel you like, they tend to look after you! Treat yourself - even if you're not staying there - to the Sunday Jazz Brunch. Be hungry when you get there! If you book early enough, check this hotel out through one of the on-line agencies like booking.com.... you can often find a bargain. Can't recommend this highly enough and so looking forward to our New Year visit!

Reviews.Title: “great vieuw”
Reviews.Author: Alex D
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the middle of the city (building wise), front desk staff seems to be stressed out and fake friendly and one get the feeling to enter a bed factory instead of a hotel. Rooms are clean and large.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with some great rooms”
Reviews.Author: BrentMeersman
Reviews.Content: Well located friendly and functional place with a great presence If you lucky you get a room with balcony outside Some rooms are rather eccentric Have stayed here three times On the most recent trip though (11/2011) the restaurant had gone down very much Food was franky terrible Ate there twice and both times bad Hope the hotel pulls up the socks of the restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Hotel America does not like Americans.”
Reviews.Author: BenandBeck
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel and prices appeared affordable when booking online. Breakfast is not included and is E20 per person for a standard European continental breakfast. Parking is E36 per day but close. No smoking rooms smell of weed but are otherwise nice. Receptionist people are friendly but unhelpful. Our biggest problem was being refused service (a simple cup of cappuccino) 'because they did not have the room'. There were 5-10 people being served and the bar was completely empty. We will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic short break”
Reviews.Author: wirralian2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for only one night, but it was just ideal. The location is perfect and easy walking distance for most of the museums and other sights. We travelled to the hotel from Schiphol by taking the number 197 bus from outside the airport which stopped right outside the hotel at a cost of 4 euros each. Trams 1, 2 and 5 also run from outside the hotel which take you up to Dam Square and Central Station if you don't fancy the 20 min or so walk. We booked a standard room a couple of days before visiting at a very reasonable price and were pleased to find on arrival that we had been upgraded to what I think was a junior suite overlooking the fountain at the front of the hotel on the 4th floor. Room 426. There was some noise late at night from the outside, but nothing that disturbed a good night's sleep. King size bed, beautifully clean, large room and bathroom. Excellent. A visit to the American bar attached to the hotel is a must, the decor is stunning and the service excellent. The breakfast was also very good, with freshly made omelettes cooked on demand as part of the buffet. Cereal, yoghurt, fresh fruit salad, breads, eggs and much more. However, at 18 euros each, this is very expensive and as there are many cafe bars very close by, we would not have eaten there had we been staying more than one night. Staff helpful and polite. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location great hotel great service”
Reviews.Author: PBWV
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel,friendly staff. The building itself is a monument therefore they cannot make any improvements like isolating the walls in a better way.If you have a room with a view on the Leidseplein then earpieces are a necessary item. This because of the taxi's who use their horn for everything and the people shouting on the streets.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small room without a view”
Reviews.Author: Wimster
Reviews.Content: Great location, small room without a view. Small basic bathroom. No parking (and expensive) Not really value for money. But love the restaurant and the bar. Nice helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel. Not your usual corporate clone!”
Reviews.Author: Superspikes
Reviews.Content: We've recently returned from a fantastic autumn break in Amsterdam. This hotel suited our needs exactly. Excellent location. Lovely room. Very clean. It could have done with being a bit more spacious and the king size bed was actually two singles pushed together.... Something that caused much hilarity during the night when they split apart! The bar was nice but didn't stay open late for guests returning from a night out...we were pretty late getting in though! We didn't use the hotel restaurant as there were so many places to eat nearby - it looked gorgeous though! Staff were friendly & helpful! We'd definitely go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Americain - Finely situated and fun!”
Reviews.Author: azure_blue_sea&sky
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the Eden Amsterdam American Hotel in May of 2011. This is a fantastic hotel as it is ideally situated in a bustling quarter of the city; leidseplein. If your a young couple that like to experience restaurants, bars and nightlife..this is coming highly recommended. You will have access not only to the hub, but literally outside its doors you can cross the street and board a canal cruise as a dock is right there. Next door, around the corner is also a tourist office and in addition; access to the tram is steps away. If your in the moos for walking - fantastic. Can easily walk to the museums, shops, heiniken experience and Volker Park (very nice experience after winding down status-post a hard night out. A bit a ways from the red light district and anne frank house, but those places are quite easy to get to as well. Gotta recommend not only for the location but it also definately an architectural jewel, with an interesting history. We were lucky enough to get a really sweet room with a small balcony that overlooks the canal.Not all rooms have it; and not all rooms have a canal view. Most with larger balconies are located at the front of the hotel overlooking their fabulous fountain. The rooms themselves are perfect for those not going to be spending a great deal in them. No real bells and whistles, but clean and spacious enough with a large comfy soft king bed and sitting area. Bathrooms are small, but serve their purpose. There is a small sitting area with a small upholstered couch/chairs and coffee table. Ice/water machines are available in the halls. Internet access however is $$; which was our only real gripe. Large enough flat screen tv. They have a computer area in the hotel and of course that gorgeous well-known art noveau cafe at the 1st level. The Cafe Americain; known for their breakfast/brunches. Concierge very helpful. This hotel is coming highly recommended for young couples looking for a fun amsterdam experience. Would not hestitate to stay here again! Miss you, Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing break in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Willow_1974
Reviews.Content: The Eden American is a great hotel. The reception staff are friendly, efficient and relaxed. Our room was on the 5th floor (541) and had its own balcony which I would imagine would be great during the summer. The bed was lovely and comfortable with great pillows which is always an important factor for me. There was an in-room electronic safe and access to wifi via a voucher which you got from reception. The bathroom was on the snug side but the bath was perfect for a relaxing dip and they had lovely Rituals toiletries. We didn't use the wifi in the room but used the free - yes free - internet access downstairs to sort out our flights. We stayed for 2 nights but it felt like it was for longer and came home feeling totally refreshed. I would have no hesitation in booking this hotel and would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel. Great location. Easy access to many attractions.”
Reviews.Author: dfndr90
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week's stay at the Eden Amsterdam American Hotel. This is a very nice hotel. I was upgraded to canal view room 111 which was very nice. Spacious, clean, and comfortable. The bathroom is quite small, but then again, how much time do you really spend in the loo. The bed was comfortable, great work space, and free wi-fi was a plus. Nice large flat screen TV. I would suggest they add a separate fridge for storing water, snacks, etc. and maybe a microwave. The staff at the front desk is first rate. They were very attentive to my many questions about the area and how to get to places. They are very knowledgeable, and spoke very good English. If they did not know the answer, they were quick to find somebody who did. Great location on the Leidesplein, which is close to many shops, restaurants, and museums. The tram is the easiest and most economical way to move about the city. The people are very friendly and willing to help and give directions. Overall, a wonderful stay. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Amsterdam. Will stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: SkiMonsterNYC
Reviews.Content: I might do a good vs bad here, but honestly i cant remember anything bad in this hotel. The good: -very clean -good location (a bit far from RLD if you are checking that out, 30-40m walk i guess, but stil nice area) -nice modern decor -wifi works in your room -we got a balcony (i think all rooms have them...?) overlooking a canal and the city. very nice... -helpful polite staff -clean bathroom

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location”
Reviews.Author: naiswaku
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this delightful hotel and were never disappointed by their service and friendlineoss. Located by the Leidesplein area there is much to see and do the moment you walk out the door. Located close to the Museum area we were able to take advantage of the magnificent art the city has to offer. Within three blocks there are dozens of fine restaurnts. One of the great advantages is that their room service menu is perfect for a snack or a full dinner. A perfect vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Not appropriate for the disabled- worst hotel stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: Ihearttheusa
Reviews.Content: The actual hotel is quite beautiful, and in an excellent location in the heart of Amsterdam, just off Leidesplein. It is directly next door to the concert hall/theatre, and about 10 mins walk from the museum quarter, about 15 mins walk from the Bloenmarkt (floating flower markets). The rooms are tastefully decorated in an art deco/nouveau style, and the usual amenities: mini bar, electronic safe, tea/coffee making facilities, shower gel, shampoo. No dressing gown, slippers or iron though. Tv has good selection of channels for English speakers; BBC1, BBC2, Animal Planet, MTV, CNN. Our room 119, had a nice walk out balcony with chairs, that overlooked the fountains outside- was a little noisy at night. There are computers available on the mezzanine floor with internet access free of charge and phone chargers for most makes on the desks. And that's about all I can say positive about this hotel as we had a terrible stay.... My partner and I booked a 2 night stay at this hotel through lastminute.com after searching through hundreds of hotels in Amsterdam looking for one that was wheelchair accessible- my partner is disabled. This hotel lists itself as having wheelchair accessible rooms on both it's own website and with lastminute.com. We thoroughly checked this before booking so felt confident to go ahead and book. In the special requests box we requested a wheelchair accessible room, and explained that my partner was wheelchair bound. Upon arriving in Amsterdam, we were horrified to find that the hotel DID NOT have a wheelchair accessible entrance. We were faced with a flight of stairs to the main entrance. I went in and checked at reception for the wheelchair entrance and was informed that the hotel was not wheelchair accessible. I explained to the receptionist-Martha (who was actually very helpful) that we had booked a wheelchair accessible room. She informed me that they do have wheelchair accessible rooms but the hotel is not wheelchair accessible!!! Totally crazy! After much frantic calling to various people in the hotel she arranged for the concierge and a member of the bar staff, to bring my partner in through the bar entrance and then they would carry my partner up the smaller flight of stairs in the bar! I'm sure anyone reading this can imagine how humiliating this was for my partner. This was to be the plan for our entire stay at the hotel. Upset and tired from traveling, we reluctantly agreed as it seemed we had no other option. We went out and enjoyed the day in Amsterdam, and returned to the hotel. It took the staff 15minutes to let us in through the bar, and that only happened because I banged on the door! We called lastminute immediately to complain, and try to get moved to a more appropriate accommodation. Lastminute contacted the hotel manager to try and get us moved, but he refused to refund our money, so we were forced to stay for the 2 nights. Very inconsiderate, and selfish attitude. I can't believe they wouldn't let us cancel our stay and move to an accessible hotel. Later that evening we ate in the restaurant, as we were reluctant to tackle the whole entrance saga thing again. Surprise, surprise no wheelchair access! In order to access the restaurant we had to report to reception, and someone would then take us in the lift to the service entrance. In the restaurant, the service was appalling. We were sat at the table for 10minutes with no menu, and no drinks. We had to catch a member of the restaurant team and ask them to bring us menus and order drinks. We found the menu had little choice and was really quite pricey: starters approx 16 euros, main course from approx 20 euros. We opted for the 2 course set menu option. My partner went for the fish option and I went for the Roasted Poussin- what a mistake! When it arrived, i cut it open and the centre appeared raw, so I poked a finger in, and it came out with blood on it!. I tried a couple of times to catch a member of staff but had no luck. I decided to not eat it and let the waitress know when she came to clear the plates. When I informed her that it was undercooked, her response was 'that it's meant to be that way'!!!! Obviously not heard of salmonella in Amsterdam. Total bill was 67 euros for 2 courses with 3 glasses of wine, and I had barely touched the main course. Then we attempted to get back to our room on the 1st floor, and yes you guessed it- another saga. The restaurant manager took us to the service lift and sent us up to the 1st floor. When we stepped out of the lift we were faced with a flight of stairs! It was not accessible straight from the restaurant. The next night we decided to eat in the bar. Better choice of menu, and nice surroundings. Walls are covered in photos of celebrity visitors to the hotel so quite a nice talking point. In addition to my partner as company, we also had mice! Yes mice. Whilst sat in the bar we watched mice wander into the main area and then scurry back into what looked like a store cupboard. Luckily they don't bother me but if you are not partial to the furry kind then you might want to give the bar a miss, as when another resident reported it to the bar staff, he told her 'yes we do have problem with mice, I will try and catch it if it comes out again' .!! We hated every minute of staying in this hotel, and the hotel manager did not so much as offer us a complimentary meal or any discount off our final bill, for the humiliation and inconvenience we faced during our stay. Would never stay here again, and would certainly not recommend it. Needless to say, Eden Hotel group will be receiving a letter from me!

Reviews.Title: “A mixture of good and bad......”
Reviews.Author: splibo
Reviews.Content: Booked in for 3 days. Nice room with balcony and most expected facilities. A coffee machine would have been a bonus, as these are increasingly common in decent hotels.Very comfy bed and two easy chairs near the balcony. Having arrived late we headed for the resturant and whilst grand in stature had a rather limited menu. A nice bottle of wine was followed by a couple of starters. However the two main courses were inedible and had to be returned. The resturant manager made appologies and took the whole cost of the meal from the bill. We did not eat again in the resturant. The bar is popular and a nice place to spend an hour or so as an option to the nearby bars. We did however spot a mouse scurrying around behind the bar, and reported this to the staff. Overall the staff were polite, helpful and prompt, checkout was easy, and the bill correct. This is a very well located hotel with a good standard of accommodation. I would stay again but dont think I'll chance the resturant again. This is not a problem as there are plenty of alternatives round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS - WHAT A NICE SURPRISE!”
Reviews.Author: SKW100
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just been away for the first time to Amsterdam to celebrate his 50th birthday. So we had no idea about locations or anything really. We booked this through Jet2.com holidays so really had no idea what to expect. ~All I can say is we were not disappointed - if anything delighted. We got a taxi from Central Station as we found this the easiest way to get to the hotel and it only cost 10 euros. People are extremely helpful in Amsterdam and the staff in reception at the Eden American Hotel were extremely pleasant and very helpful as we explained we were first timers to Amsterdam. We stayed for 2 nights only but the next day we were amazed at how nice the breakfast was and the dining room area was very chic with stained glass and chandeliers and the waiting staff bent over backwards for you. Doors are secured on an evening but intercom allows you straight into reception to allow you in and the location is fab so close to Leidsplien Square with the coffee bars and restaurants. We would throughly recommend the Heineken Experience which was great value for money and drinks included. The room in the hotel was extremely clean, maid service daily and was excellent. No problems in this respect. We had a room at the rear but this made no odds because you only use your room as a base as there is so much exploring to do in a short space of time. On departure day you have to vacate your room for 12.00 but the porters put your luggage in a secure lobby for you and are extremely polite. We would both thoroughly recommend this hotel, had no problems an ideal location away from the hustle and bustle of other areas.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location with great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Anders B
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed for a weekend at this hotel in late October, and I must say I was really impressed. Yes, you can argue that the room and the public areas inside the hotel had seen better days, but the atmosphere with friendly staff and stunning architecture really made the stay worthwhile. Our room was fairly spacey, even though it was probably among the cheaper rooms, and even though the area was lively, we were not troubled by noise in any way. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was good, and with the huge windows we really felt as part of everything happening out on the street. I would say the breakfast was a bit on the expensive side, though, and I have had better for less money on several other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Eden Amsterdam American Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: pamela p
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not as good as it looks on the website. I suffer from allergy to dust and my allergy wreaked havoc the 9 days I was there. The gym is small with less than adequate fitness machines. There service was questionable. The first night I ordered room service, glass of wine, soup and salad. They brought the wrong wine and when the waiter went to get the correct one, I noticed that I did not have a spoon so I had to call down for it. By the time it arrived with the wine, my soup was warm. The food was basic with no extras such as salt and pepper. When I tried to book a restaurant for dinner I was told to come back a couple days in advance and when I did, the restaurant we wanted was booked. Probably because the concierge is not there everyday and the poor advice was from the porter. In their favour the concierge did find us a good spot. The dinner menu in the restaurant was a little bazaar - why they stopped serving the likes of hamburgers at 5 pm, I just don't know. Also, there is no options for breakfast. I only wanted toast one morning but had to pay for the entire buffet. Thank goodness Starbuck's wasn't too far away. I would not stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Eden Amsterdam American”
Reviews.Author: SaltedNuts
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay in the hotel. We booked direct with their website and got a great deal. The location is super and walking distance of lots of attractions it meant we could pop back whenever we fancied to the hotel ( useful for those who like to shop). The room was well appointed and clean. We had a room on the 5th floor overlooking the canal which had a small balcony perfect for enjoying an early evening drink. The mini bar was the usual hotel expensive but there was an ice machine so we did BYO. The bar was friendly with a great cocktail menu and the restaurant although we didn't eat there looked lovely. If you go there turn on the TV and watch the advertising film it shows some good places to visit which we didn't watch til our last night ! I have read some of the reviews on here and I did NOT have the same experience. We took our car. Parking is very expensive in Amsterdam so try to use a park and ride we used the one at the World Fashion Centre 8 euro a day which included a return tram ticket for up to 5 passengers.

Reviews.Title: “Expected better, but it was ok...”
Reviews.Author: najj61
Reviews.Content: Good location and staff were friendly enough, however for a 5 star hotel expected a little bit more. The room was clean although a little bit cramped because of the narrow shape and huge bed, and I do mean huge bed! We did email ahead to ask for a canal side room and were allocated an internal room overlooking the air conditioning machines; we also asked for an early check in as we knew we would reach the Hotel early at 12 noon, which we did, but we were told to come back at 3pm. The original response to the email was they could not guarantee anything but that they would try their best; I got the impression at check in that they hadn't. They did however let us leave our bag in their luggage room. All in all we had a good 3 day trip to Amsterdam and will definitely go again as the place is stunning; but we will definitely choose a different Hotel. Ps. Beware of the cyclists, no prisoners taken!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Colin340
Reviews.Content: Disappointing! Lovely hotel but the room we had was extremely noisy - it was above the delivery entrance at the side of the hotel, with lorries arriving early in the morning to make their deliveries. Housekeeping staff were very good but some of the reception staff exuded a coldness and a superior attitude. We were also presented with a city tax bill on checking out that we had not been made aware of. Room rate was expensive for what we had to put up with. We had wanted to stay at the hotel for years but what a let down.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with style”
Reviews.Author: Hurby S
Reviews.Content: A stylish classic hotel around the Leidse Square which is a good starting point to visit the city. Excellent breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Jane1244
Reviews.Content: The room was dirty and cleaning staff did less than minimal work. A large, visible blood splatter on the heat register was there when we arrived and still there when we left. Bathroom counters were not cleaned and mucky soap scum left. Windows had remnants of duct tape sealing them outside. Carpets were gross! Lighting was dingy with the only mirror inside the closet where it was so dark you had no idea what you looked like! Beds were comfortable. Some staff were very helpful and others very arrogant and haughty. After staying a gew days you would expect a smile and "good morning" to be returned! Breakfast prices were exhorbitant - 19 euro each...lots of nice places nearby to get breakfast for 7 or 8 euro. The art deco motif was good, but it desperately needs a good cleaning and fresh paint. Walls and skirting boards were scuffed and worn. Room rates were too expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “â€œGreat hotel in trendy, arty neighbourhood...not in tourist area though!â€�”
Reviews.Author: Jess E
Reviews.Content: Eden Amsterdam American Hotel was a â‚¬16 taxi fare away from Amsterdam Central railway station. It is not located in the main, tourist area of Amsterdam, but in a quieter area called Leidseplein - lots of great restaurants, street performers and artists frequent this section of the city. It is a LONG walk back into the centre of the city (where the tours and buses and trains depart from). The hotel was clean and comfortable. It is an older-style hotel thought and we had a very unfortunate view onto a neighbouring rooftop and air-conditioning units. The shower was average - we have definitely had better showers elsewhere! We did not eat breakfast or dinner here so I cannot comment on this aspect of the hotel. We were surprised to have to pay the city tax on check-out of the hotel (approx â‚¬5.00 for two people per night), so remember to incorporate this charge into your budget, especially if you are staying a week or so! Amsterdam was a great place to visit and we have no major complaints about this hotel. Would recommend to anyone, but be willing to pay a fair room rate for an average room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Charm”
Reviews.Author: skierlee
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Amsterdam. We chose this hotel because on our previous trip we had stumbled across it and had lunch in the beautiful resaurant. Our room was upgraded and was the best night's sleep we have ever had overseas. Our son's room was the economy room and even though the view was not great the room was well appointed, quiet and clean. This restored art deco hotel is worth every penny. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kmcc51Toronto
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the typical European size but it is in a perfect location. It is incredibly easy to get to from Schiphol Airport - just take Bus 197 and it will cost you only 4 Euros- and you will be dropped right in front of the hotel. It is an easy walk to the Van Gogh and Rijks Museum. There is a stop for The Hop On Hop Off Canal Tour almost in front of the hotel and several Tram Lines are right in front as well including one that goes to the train station. Although the hotel is in a very busy area, we had an interior room and it was perfectly quiet - even when there was a rock concert going on in the square one night. They charge for Internet so I suggest that you go to one of the many Beans and Bagels restaurants (one is 3 blocks away) and use their free WiFi. (They have great food and coffee as well)

Reviews.Title: “Iconic hotel well located”
Reviews.Author: mottyandfluff
Reviews.Content: A real jewel in the. Centre of Amsterdam. Oodles of character with an amazing dining room. Food was very good and the beds super comfy. A really good place for museum lovers as it is a short distance from the museum area. Also close to shops if you are that way inclined. Free Internet but you have to get a voucher and keep entering the numbers, a pit of a pian: it was also a little slow. A small moan really.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: rastawoman123
Reviews.Content: Our third trip to Amsterdam and we chose the Eden American for the great location in the Leidseplein and the provided amenities. We love Amsterdam and checked out a number of hotels for this trip.. We had once enjoyed the Bellevue, The Park, and also spent five days on a houseboat. Nothing can compete with the houseboat experience, but the Eden filled our needs for this trip. We had a split agenda arriving for a 2 day stay, heading to Groningen for a night and back to the Eden for one night. We had an early check in to a great room, very spacious, to rest up after our flight. We were able to leave our bags for the night away and returned to an equally lovely room. A friend traveling with us also had one of the beautiful balcony rooms overlooking the city. We were very happy with the service, comfort, location and value. A beautiful hotel. Don'r miss eating at "de balie" a few steps across the square. Our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent late September stay!”
Reviews.Author: whiteoakspring
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eden Amsterdam American Hotel from 19-22 September 2011 and thoroughly enjoyed our visit. We lived in Amsterdam in the mid 1970s so we know the hotel well and it has always been one of our favorite Amsterdam hotels and cafes. It has been restored and the art deco features are more beautiful than we recall. We requested a higher level room with a terrace facing the canal and were given just this room which was marvelous! Beautifully appointed and restored room with a contemporary bathroom. We could not have been more pleased and also found the service throughout the hotel excellent. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Simple, but good enough”
Reviews.Author: Eliza53
Reviews.Content: Location: The hotel has the kind of location that we like: quiet, but very near to the busy areas. There are a lot of good restaurants, bars around. There is also an upscale shopping area nearby. It is not that close to the Old Town but there is a tram stop in front of the hotel that gets you there in few minutes. There is also a canal hop-on-hop-off right outside the hotel. You may also take an hour boat cruise a few blocks from the hotel. The hotel is also in a walking distance from the museum area - I suggest buying tickets in advance via Internet to avoid long queues- Rijksmuseum in a must as well as Van Gogh Museum. Room: We took an American Junior Suite (room 117) and got a good price by booking in advance. It is spacious, clean, with a small private terrace facing the square, but it is dated and a bit dark. The bed is very comfortable and the windows are soundproofed which garanteed us a good night sleep. The bathroom is small, very basic toiletries and needs renovation - the shower is very good though. Service: Nice staff, sometimes aloof, but generally good. The concierge was always very helpful giving directions, general information and making reservations. Breakfast is good enough. In general, we had a nice four-day stay. We were luck to have four sunny days, it was spring and the tulips were blooming. Visiting Keukenhof was an amazing experience. It is possible to get there by regular buses or taking a tour - there is one that pick you up across from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: Catherine310
Reviews.Content: They said our room would be ready at 3pm. Told us to wait in the bar. Room was ready at 5pm. Had to stand at the desk while others behind the counter were too busy chatting with each other to help us. The lobby is tacky looking. Watch out for the automatic lobby doors people were getting trapped in the foyer when the doors would not open. Room was shabby. Free wifi was a benefit. Location near the tram was good. Not sure that there really is a good location in Amsterdam. Dont take a taxi in Amsterdam. 20 euro from the train. Also don't waste your money on a canal cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to rest your head”
Reviews.Author: crobbtu
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to access from the main train station (about 15 min ride) and located in a great location with plenty of restaurants, bars and entertainment. We took a canal hop-on-hop-off tour and it stopped right outside the hotel which was great especially in June when it rains every few hours. I emailed ahead of time to request a two-bed room and they were more than happy to accommodate us when we arrived. The hotel itself has an old feel but with modern touches. The room was small but comfortable. One night the hotel was especially accommodating; we called up room service and they had stopped serving a certain item and they said that they would be happy to make us the item we were looking for. It was so yummy! The front desk staff was really friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Art deco in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: rcd1129
Reviews.Content: Very pretty art-deco hotel right in the middle of things. Friendly and helpful staff, excellent mattresses and breakfast- a better bargain when you pre-pay. Good price-quality ratio.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: MarilynMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice, and in a quiet neighborhood which allowed us to get some much-needed sleep. It's near the museum district in Amsterdam, so there were plenty of restaurants and attractions within walking distance. A canal tour was available literally yards away from the hotel entrance. The room was well-appointed, and the espresso maker was an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased and would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: bec52
Reviews.Content: Lovely old historic hotel. Rooms were very comfortable and air-conditioning actually worked. Small bathrooms but functional. Staff very attentive and helpful. Fantastic art deco restaurant and outdoor eating area by lovely fountain (did not care for the expensive breakfast buffet, but lunch and dinner were very good). Very convenient area for museums and trams/buses. Lots of great little restaurants all around. We had a room at the back and were not bothered by noise. Our kids had a lovely room overlooking the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Since 10 years my favorit”
Reviews.Author: wopracek
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location in Amsterdam. Near Leidseplein, if you like a good beer.You can walk through the pedestrian zone to the centre of the city. The hotel has an uniquearchitecture. The room s are big in relation to other amsterdam hotels. Beautiful breakfast room and very kind people, who are working in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: marceloRioDeJaneiro
Reviews.Content: Room is clean and new, but a bit small. Hotel is well located, near most attractions

Reviews.Title: “Great location; helpful front desk!”
Reviews.Author: RubyIsland
Reviews.Content: Loved it! Canal boat tour right across the street. Tram right out front. Great restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “stayed before and will stay again when in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: doobydooby
Reviews.Content: Staff always welcoming, check in very smooth, rooms well appointed and quiet

Reviews.Title: “Need a Proposal”
Reviews.Author: AuntieMame42
Reviews.Content: HI.. I notice that the general manager reads and replies to these messages. I wanted to get in touch with the hotel reservations by email, but I don't see any possibility to do that. I think it would be good to have the email address and phone number more obviously placed in your webpage. I spoke with Barbara in reservations on Monday and tried to discuss some 5 rooms that I am interested in booking for November. We had a nice conversation and she said she would send me a proposal.. but now it is Friday afternoon in the States, and no message. I do want to reserve these rooms, and need a proposal. Could you help?? I have stayed before a few times and love the hotel. Mary Gergen gv4@psu.edu

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of it!”
Reviews.Author: Chloe C
Reviews.Content: Location second to none! We felt completely safe out and about in the Leidseplein area, we sat in the main square drinking til the early hours then walked the 2 minute walk back to the hotel past the beautiful fountains. Having been to Amsterdam many times before I felt this was the best and most up market area we'd stayed in. Wok to Walk was just round the corner (amazing!!) loads of coffee shops, bars, nice restaurants (even a few Greek ones) also the location is great if you want to head out of the centre on foot as your only a 20 minute walk from some great coffee shops that aren't too touristy. I am a travel agent and can be overly picky when it comes to hotels but this one was great, we were lucky enough to have a room with a balcony over looking the canal which really made the stay. Rooms we're a good size and the beds were comfy. Can't complain at all!

Reviews.Title: “Of course we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Sissel N
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th stay at the Eden American - and that tells everything!The people at the reception know their work - and also the concierge. The rooms we have had the last times are great - so now we know which room to ask for. The view towards the canal is nice, and inside the room we find everything we want - almost. The location is great, you can easily reach most of the attractions by foot from here. And the bus from Schiphol stops just outside the hotel. But the best is the breakfast in the lovely restaurant - that is great! We surely will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Terrible nights sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Stevoh62
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated is a great location, with tram station, bars, restaurants, coffee shops and smart shops all within a stones throw. Just a shame that they decided to put us in a first floor room with an air conditioning unit right outside the window! This contributed in me and my partner having very little sleep over the weekend! In my opinion that room should not be sold at all unless the hotel is full! Worst nights sleep in a hotel ever, which was a shame as the bed was superb. The iron in the room also didn't work. I then borrowed the iron from my friends room which may as well have not worked also as I could touch the hot plate while it was turned to full! Also no milk to make cup of tea/coffee.

Reviews.Title: “A great Landmark with average rooms in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: ClintonJ1
Reviews.Content: I spent close to a week in this landmark establishment near Leidseplein. Reception was very good and the staff very pleasant and accommodating. My room was on the top floor, which was nice, in one of the extension wings of the hotel. Initially I took the closest elevators to the reception but then found that I had to walk some way and up some stairs to my room. My room, small but neat with all the requisite facilities, overlooked a canal and had a small balcony and en suite bathroom. Corridor noise was low, despite being close to an elevator. Breakfast was not included but I took this downstairs as part of a buffet option. I was in early and the room itself is well appointed though the maitre d'hotel seemed tired and relatively uninterested. The coffee was wonderful, the baked goods, presumably from in house were good but there wasn't a lot of variety. The hot and cold plates were adequate but not very imaginative and certainly on the fruits and cheeses aspect this seemed to be somewhat thin in terms of variety. The usual cereals were on offer and some interesting meats including a 'bucket' of cooked bacon. The cured meats were very good. The bar is vibey, with average pricing and an interesting array of photographs of various celebrities on the wall. This is a great people watching location as is the outdoor seating in front of the cafe. The hotel provides good wifi in tranches of one hour access at a time. The cable TV services are below par but the internet cafe services on the mezzanine are designed for capacity and have good equipment. The Eden group indicate that they have spend considerable monies on upgrading the hotel but these upgrades are not very self evident , perhaps they were mostly undertaken in the infrastructure and not in the amenities. Watch the tariffs, mid week they skyrocket !

Reviews.Title: “Loved it more than I hoped for”
Reviews.Author: Patricia M
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights before our curise and boy oh boy did we love it. The location was the best . The suite was beautiful and very large. It is right on the canal so we were able to hop on hop off the canal boats. The conseirge was very helpful. He had so much information for us. We needed a taxi to get to the ship and it came right on time. Shopping and restaurants are right out side the door. I would not stay any other place except this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mick p
Reviews.Content: Second visit to this hotel. Love the location and the look of the hotel,it has character! Its not like a bland business hotel, so the rooms will differ in size and shape. The last visit we had a nice room, spacious,with a view of the canal. This visit we had a smaller room on the 6th floor with a view of the roof! Nevertheless the room was clean and well decorated. We have always found the staff polite and friendly,especially concierge and front desk. We arrived before noon after a very early flight and asked if we could store our bags until we could check in. The lady at the desk said it would be no problem to check in early,which was extremely welcome . We will definately return. Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Monica36
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night at the American Hotel during a business trip. The hotel is located in the centre of Amsterdam (near the Leidseplein), close to restaurants, bars, museums and clubs. Personally I love the Art Nouveau architecture of the hotel, especially the restaurant is a gem. I had a great dinner there. Breakfast is somewhat expensive (about 25-30 dollars). The rooms are average size. I had a deluxe room, this room was bigger and it had a balcony with a view on the channel. The bathrooms are kinda small. The staff was really friendly (from the welcome during check in 'till the goodbye when I left). All in all I really enjoyed my short stay at the American Hotel and I will definately stay there again next visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Bothnerfamily
Reviews.Content: The Eden Amsterdam American Hotel, in my opinion, is the best place to stay in Amsterdam. I love the fact we are on the canal. It is so nice and depending where your room is located, can be very quiet as well. The Cafe Americain should not be missed.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION & A GREAT HOTEL ALL ROUND!”
