Reviews.Author: SCOTTIEDOGAberdeen
Reviews.Content: We recently travelled to Amsterdam & stayed at this hotel & found it to be very good in every way. The staff were very polite & helpful as our first room was very dark with no natural light so we went back down to reception & were allocated a much bigger & better room with no problem. We found the food to be very good & had a few meals & snacks during our stay & had breakfast included in our deal. The location is perfect & we got the 197 Bus from the airport directly to the hotel which was great. Perfect location for museums/bars restaurants with lots to choose from. We didn't actually realise if was "Gay Pride" weekend while we were there & it was such a fantastic atmosphere with the canals full of boats & the Parade on the Saturday was such a spectacular sight! We will definately return to Amsterdam & stay at the Eden Amsterdam again. Would recommend a great restaurant (Humphreys) which I booked before we left on the advice of Trip Advisor. 3 courses for 23.95 euros & was great value & staff were very pleasant. All in all we had such a brilliant time.

Reviews.Title: “loved the location pity about the noise outside”
Reviews.Author: BridBelfast
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed here having stayed in house boats on the canal for a couple of years, the location of the hotel is great the airport bus 197 stops right outside it. The staff at the front desk ( contary to previous reviews) we found were very helpful ,polite and friendly. The only complaint we have is that the noise oustide our room from what seemed to be a huge bottle crushing machine was unbearably loud. would definitely stay at the hotel again but in a quieter room. We ate in two very nice places De Klos (ribs are fabulous) and the brasserie Vlaming near Ann Frank House the food here is amasing!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average room”
Reviews.Author: avanstraten
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great, just next to the Leidse Plein and within walking distance form the most important museums. Many trams stop next to the hotel and there are a lot of nice bars and restaurants close to the hotel. The rooms on the other hand are very small and basic, definitely not 4-star quality. However, there is free wifi and a water boiler with free coffee and tea. Breakfast was not included and costs 15 euros if you book in advance, or 19,50 otherwise. The breakfast itself is nothing special, just the regular stuff. Coffee is being served, but you only get a cup at a time. Parking spots are virtually unavailable outside, but you can park in a nearby parking lot, for over 5 euros per hour. All in all a pretty decent choice if you prefer a hotel in a top location.

Reviews.Title: “Not everything beautiful from outside is beautiful from inside”
Reviews.Author: WinchesterGoose
Reviews.Content: Amazing building, unfortunately with a less amazing inside. The corridors and rooms are dirty, wallpaper in the rooms torn and also dirty, the arrangement of the rooms is awkward.

Reviews.Title: “our regular choice”
Reviews.Author: a20hol
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are frequent visitors to Amsterdam and have stayed anuually at the American Hotel for the past ten years.The hotel is worthy of it's 4 stars and is consistent. The Cafe Americain is quite unique and whilst not best known for fine dining ,oozes atmosphere. It should not be missed.The location of the hotel is ideal as central Amsterdam can easily be covered on foot. The Leidseplein can be lively at weekends but not at all like the red light area which throngs with stag and hen parties.The museum and antique areas are adjacent and there are numerous cheap eateries nearby. The hotel is not cheap but is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, great breakfast, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: jcakes13
Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Eden. The location is perfect. Literally, right around the corner there are pubs and a great nightlife. Our room was clean- a little small, but you only sleep there. The shower is tad awkward, but again we don't live there. In the morning, the buffet was great. Quite a large variety of foods, and we were able to take some fruit for later. The female bartender in the lounge is super helpful and so was the concierge. Front desk not so much, and not so nice, but the others make up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Excellent holiday”
Reviews.Author: dave_purr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a bustling area, but is not noisy and it is conveniently located for getting to many of the places that most visitors would want to see. The staff were very helpful and the room was nice and clean. If we come back to Amsterdam (and I hope we will) we'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “the Best Hotel to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: fayrouz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just amazing. something like perfect..indeed.. and its much more valuable than big names and brands.. We stayed there and we were offered a very nice room with balcony that have a great view hotel staff were very helpful and friendly food is amazing Value for money is perfect.. location is one of the best in Amsterdam i think if i go again to Amsterdam and i dont get the chance to stay in this hotel , something will be really missing

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again for sure!”
Reviews.Author: RINGLET55
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my 50th birthday,what a lovely hotel,staff were very accommodating and nothing was to much trouble...Breakfast was lovely and set us up for the day. Room 523 with view over the square.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: iguana_9
Reviews.Content: Had a wet and windy long weekend for a family celebration. The rooms were a good size some taking a third bed suitable for kids. Staff were helpful, breakfast was buffet but not a great deal was on offer. The dining room was a very attractive 1920s room with atmosphere but you need to book too experience the afternoon tea. The best thing was the hotels location ..easy walking to the canal for boat trips, restaurants, shops and the tram. Would recommend it, just a shame we did not experience Amsterdam in the sun!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: VEGASCRAZY2004
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 4 days here - we arrived very early and were hoping to be able to drop off our cases, however the receptionist went to a lot of trouble to find us a room that was ready. The concierge overheard us talking about the Jazz brunch on the Sunday and effortlessly booked us in there and then - this was wonderful - both the food and the atmosphere - would definately do again. We also had a meal in the American Cafe on our last night which was super and would definately do this again too. You can also sit outside and have a coffee, drink or a meal and we enjoyed doing this on several occasions. All the staff that we met were friendly and helpful and went out of their way to make our stay a memorable one. We did the canal tour which was a great way of seeing Amsterdam, the house, bridges and the houseboats - great fun and you can get a canal boat from just outside the hotel. The trams are great - just hop on no. 1, 2, 5 or 11 - they run from Central Station, which is 4 km from the hotel. Van Gogh museaum is close enough to the hotel to walk and we spent a few hours here, also visited the BOLS museum which was fun and would recommend. Flower market, red light district, shops were also a lot of fun. Loved De Bijenkorf department store in particular, situated in Dam Square - the pastries here are wonderful ! The hotel is also very near lots of bars and restaurants which are great for people watching. We would definately come back and hopefully for longer than 4 days.

Reviews.Title: “Great Old Building Needs Update”
Reviews.Author: tradervicky
Reviews.Content: This is in a great old building with a bit of history. (Mati Hari had her wedding reception here). Great location on canal and next to one of the main streetcar stops. Comfortable mattress but whomever decorated the rooms made them look dull and drab; rooms large for a Europe hotel. Concierge was next to useless, don't stay here if you expect, and are accustomed to, good cusomter service as for the most part it is non-existant. Someone needs to buy this building and give it a complete renovation, it could be awesome if done well; but then the nightly rates would be much higher. Not the best but far from the worst!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynnj2468
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a 3 night trip, and really enjoyed our stay -We stayed in room 314 overlookng the canal - lovely room much bigger than expected when reading the trip adviser comments before we went, The bed was really comfortable - the pillow not so - but you cant have everything. The breakfast was a great choice of cereals /fruit /pastries and some cooked products.set us up for the day - fantastic location as everyone has mentioned - we got the train from the airport really easy (16 euros return for the two of us) and then crossed the road from the station and hopped on tram 5 down to leidseplein hopped off just across the road from the hotel. Plenty of bars in the area - beer approx 5 euros a pint wine approx 4.50 a glass similar price in the hotel too.The concierge in the hotel was really friendly & helpful nothing was too much trouble - i would definately stay here again Hop on the boat tour right outside the hotel 10 euros for 1.30 min cruise great way to see Amsterdam - there were alway really big queues for Ann franks House - but it is open late too

Reviews.Title: “For the location, price and service it was perfect”
Reviews.Author: njs6153
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eden for three days,to begin a European 2 week journey. Had some pills taken from my bag at security and the hotel helped me to a pharmacy and all was fixed in less than 2 hours. You can walk to most museums or take the tram. Buy the IAmsterdam card at the airport and take the train in. It was good for everything. The rooms were nice and clean. I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Friendly but Mediocre...”
Reviews.Author: ufgator27
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here previously for a business function and knew the location was perfect for a holiday...so, I chose this hotel to stay for a 3 nights when I brought my mom with me. I worked during the day in a business center a 20 min drive away while Mom got to tour around. The weather wasn't very cooperative which made the great location all the more valued. Truly, it is perfect - everything w/i walking distance. Most of the staff super friendly - shout-out to Irene, at the front desk who was superb. Concierge and evening housekeeping also fabulous. One particularly grumpy front desk clerk stood out as rude, unhappy, and the opposite energy of what you would want at a front desk. Room service tried hard but lacked the grace of nicer hotels (not muting the line to talk to a colleague and so I heard loud shouting in Dutch while I was trying to place an order). I think his English might not have been that great either based on the comparison of the order to what we received but... this is Amsterdam, not the US. However, considering the hotel touts its "American"-ness in the lobby and name, you would expect some familiarity with the fact that people like butter/jam with toast and when I say brown toast, I mean wheat bread (as is normally described in many European hotels). The food is really not great at all - but, Amsterdam isn't known for its food. Trip Advisor recommendations were great though on this point though. The main issue of the hotel was the horrible horrible bed. Mom has a sensitive back and so we requested a board be put under the mattress to help with this (most hotels I've encountered seemed very familiar and happy to accomodate such a request) but it didn't help at all. Mom ended up putting the mattress on the floor - didn't help. Then, she tried sleeping on the mattress cover on the floor and that wasn't great but it was the 3rd night and we were leaving. I do not have a sensistive back but even I was very stiff and uncomfortable after sleeping on the what seemed to be a very old mattress. I did comment about the poor mattress but let's face it - what more can they do?? Upon checking, we were upgraded to a renovated larger room which was very very nice and much appreciated - unfortunately, the lighting was horrible. The phone had a very loud hum which made it diffficult to use (also shared this info w/ staff but no changes during our visit). And.. the bathrrom was fine enough but... seriously, has anyone from the hotel ever tried to take a shower in there? The showerhead auto pivots to face the interior shower wall with low very pressure.... how are you supposed to wash your hair!? It is a good size hotel so renovations must be costly but I see a big need - hall carpets old and worn, etc. Irene and the evening houskeeping gentleman who helped with the beds (apologies for not catching his name!) shone though and I managed to leave with a pleasant enough feeling but... wouldn't stay again unless they commit to a new mattress in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Jazz Brunch highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Steveonholiday_9
Reviews.Content: We visited the hotel in June as group of 12 friends celebrating a 50th birthday. Excellent venue but we recommend booking a superior room as we did ..... the room we had was delightful with a large double balcony.....well worth the extra cost as some of the other rooms that members of our party booked were disappointingly small and dark. Superb super king sized bed with comfort to die for!! Take time to book into the Sunday Jazz Brunch........fantastic food and a fabulous way to whileaway a lazy Sunday lunchtime. Friendly helpful staff on reception. We would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: dragonfly1856
Reviews.Content: We had some appehension about the price, but found our stay to be well worth while. The room was small, but clean and bright. The beds were wonderfully comfortable, and our inside room was quiet, with no distracting street noise. The fixtrues were modern and everything worked well. The windows open at the top, so you can get fresh air. One of the biggest assets was the concierge on duty at all times. He helped us to find restaurants, trips out of town, and trams to take to get around. The staff were all very helpful and made us feel quite at home. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Bar, perfect location but pretty average rooms”
Reviews.Author: JPTAust
Reviews.Content: I have now used this hotel 3 times for business trips. The front desk staff are very friendly and helpful. The main bar (not the horrible 80's decor cocktail bar) is one of my favourite in Amsterdam - brilliant Art Deco decor. Sitting there with a Palm beer is great. The real issue is the rooms. They are all looking pretty tired and really need a good old spruce up.

Reviews.Title: “Very Solid Choice for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: mjohns7861
Reviews.Content: This review is long over due but have been wanting to share it for awhile. When we booked our trip to Amsterdam, we really agonized over the right hotel. Their website offered little in terms of description or info. Reviews for Amsterdam hotels are across the board. In the end, we selected this property as it really seemed to be the best value in terms of amenities, location, and uniqueness. We were not disappointed. The building itself is beautiful and has a history has one of the most foremost hotels in the city. This history has somewhat past as the hotel has really evolved into a reliable business and travellers hotel. The room we had (king bed - standard room) appeared quite a bit bigger than the website photo and was very comfy. The bathroom was very good. My perception of the inside of the hotel was more like a typical Doubletree property. Not quite 4 or 5 star but solid and nice. We asked for much help from the concierge in terms of directions, assistance with luggage, etc., and received fabulous service. The hotel is *supurbly* located. You can walk to the Riks Museum and Van Gogh. The street car can be picked up right out front to get you to other parts of the city. It is worth noting that it is right on the Liedsplein, a very active nightlife area in the city. If you want to be tucked away from the action, this may not be the choice for you but I would add our room was very quiet. The restaurant in the hotel is somewhat pricey but we enjoyed sitting outside in the cafe and people watching. Enjoy Amsterdam! It's one of the great cities in the world. I would not hesitate staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, big room”
Reviews.Author: magnolia88
Reviews.Content: We booked a twin superior room with a canal view, and our room (108) was absolutely HUGE by European standards. I was expecting two small twin beds but they were two full size beds, very comfortable, with a separate living area as well. It almost felt like a suite. We also had a nice view of the canals, so the room was quiet, just what we wanted. It wasn't super luxurious but very comfortable, and our room certainly felt like a 4* hotel, along with the helpful service we received. The only negative would be that the room was very dark - there are some bedside lamps but they do not offer much light. In the daytime the windows provided enough sunlight but at night we felt like we could barely see. The hotel itself is perfectly located in the Leidseplein, right near a tram stop with several lines that will take you anywhere, but surrounded by all the restaurants and bars you could want. I would stay there again, but would book a superior room. We got a good deal by booking far ahead and it was a good value for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location near loads of restaurants, bars, trams & canals!”
Reviews.Author: irl_sars
Reviews.Content: We arrived late Friday evening in the rain to be told the hotel was overbooked and we had to be moved to another hotel, we were so tired and wet and disappointed but then luckily a manager stepped in and managed to upgrade us so we ended up in a lovely suite for the weekend! The suite was huge but quite dated and the cleaning in the bathroom was pretty sloppy - the toilet needed a good bleaching! The location is the best thing about the hotel, it's great for getting to everywhere. They had a lovely cafe and bar on site, (all old-world style) the cafe service was pretty slow, but there are millions of nearby options so you don't need to bother waiting there twice! We left our luggage there the day we were leaving. Noise is also an issue, there was pumping music from a club across the road over the weekend nights from midnight til 5am or so, we were sufficiently tired to sleep through it but light sleepers might have a problem! They have some free terminals and printer that you can use which is great but it could be improved further by installing a PDF reader to print boarding passes! It It was all pretty 3 and a half star really, not 4! I would stay there again though for the location.

Reviews.Title: “First Visit to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: therealdeal08
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a dreaded overnight flight from Canada early in the am. we were hoping a room would be ready but in hindsight this was an unreal expectation. We went sight seeing at 8am and much to our surprise found some wonderful benefits. First off if the Ann Frank home is on your list of things to do (it was not on mine) however due to our arrival my wife made sure it was! thank goodness our check in was delayed , it was extremely moving (may have been the lack of sleep but think not) and the line up at 9am was15 minutes. Thanks to the immediate intervention of the concierge on our arrival our bags were safely stowed and we set off to follow his recommendations as well. We walked a short distance to the flower market and had some beautiful flowers for the room and on to a food market and enjoyed unbelievable baguette, cheese and fruit by a canal. Anyways back to the hotel, we arrived back at 1:15 not expecting our room to be ready but hoping, and it was. The front desk on our few occasions we needed them, they simply could not have been better. The room was clean, beautiful but small by North American standards but as I am typing this from Paris it was great by European standards. Now the bed, I travel for a living and find myself in hotels up to 30 weeks a year and this bed has moved to the top of the list (I may even consider returning just to sleep in it again). Be sure to enjoy the patio for a glass of wine before going fo dinner the ambience and other guests are wonderful to enjoy, our service horendous. (note for hotel......the waitress that ended up writing our chit was not the one who served us). All in all, we travel alot we try to travel low key without being to demanding, these people simply want to make your stay pleasant. Have no worries if booking this hotel our room was 210 on the canal (bravo Eden)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location with access to transportation and many restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Putt4Doe
Reviews.Content: It was a nice stay at the hotel - I think the optimum rating would be three and a half stars. It is an older hotel that has been updated through the years. I booked in advance and secured a non-refundable rate for a 'standard room'. I will say that the room was extremely small in terms af American standards - thus, if you are an American traveling over to Amsterdam for the first time, please understand that the 'standard room' will not be equivalent to a 'standard room' in the States. I was there on business for the week by myself and thought it was a bit cramped - so, a couple will be extremely cozy!! 8-) Given that I was there for business - I wasn't in my room alot of the time, so it wasn't that bad. But, if you are a couple that is planning to book a room - please consider the next grade up from the standard. The location is excellent close to many sites all within walking distance. Make certain you wear a comfortable pair of shoes and explore! Also, one thing that I wish I would have done in hindsight was rent a bike - there are a few places within a block (ask the concierge) where you can rent a bike for the hour, day or week. Highly recommend doing this as there is NO city in the world like Amsterdam when it comes to bikes. It will blow you away. I will stay at this hotel again but will likely spend a few extra euros to get a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “CRAFT Weekend”
Reviews.Author: oman54
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eden American Hotel in Amsterdam with a group of 11 friends. The hotel is perfectly situated in Leidesplein, about 20 minutes walk from the main train station. It's a fab hotel, classy, clean and smart. It boasts an amazing cocktail bar, has a small leisure suite and comes reasonably priced. It is located near many attractions from the Van Gogh museum to the Paradisio nightclub. It is surrounded by cafes and restaurants plus small theatres and comedy clubs. It's suitable for all ranges and ages of visitors. I have stayed there three time now and will make this hotel my regular when staying in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel,”
Reviews.Author: phillywicklow
Reviews.Content: very central hotel, room was very small and bathroom was tiny. Didn't like the frosted glass door into bathroom. The hotel was really clean and staff were all extremely pleasant and willing to help give directions etc. Bar very quiet at night, didn't eat in hotel. Would go back but would request larger room . Rooms too small considering what we paid for them, but then we only slept there.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place !”
Reviews.Author: MrDemon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for eight nights and enjoyed it. The location and history all played in to our overall memory of our vacation. We had a nice time and were glad to have the place as a base to work out of.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: Pustilnik
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of the beautiful historical building it is located in and the relatively good reviews on Trip Advisor. We were willing to pay a large amount (350$/night for a junior suite) to get a special expericence. Unfortunately other then a beautiful facade of the building there was nothing worth paying for. For this huge amount breakfast was not included and we had to pay another 15euro each for a measly breakfast (although in a gorgeous restaurant) at the hotel. At 9:30 many of the components of breakfast ran out and were not renewed. Althogh the room was spacious (we did pay for a suite) the bathroom was so tiny that I banged my chin on the sink trying to sit on the toilet. There is no lobby to speak of unless you consider 4 chairs in the hallway a lobby. There was a small sitting area one floor above the entrance area but it was not convenient for use. The blanket was synthetic and made me sweat all night. At the cheaper Marriott where we stayed the first 3 nights the blanket was down, so much better! Fitness room was a poor excuse for this name. Couple of instruments stuck in a stuffy basement. Not a place I would set my foot into. Personnel were nice but so s l o w... It took 30 minutes to check out and all we had to do was pay for breakfast and a tour. They made a mistake in the cost and it took forever to fix it. Bottom line - great disappointment

Reviews.Title: “Well-Located Hotel With Good Service”
Reviews.Author: FrogPrince63
Reviews.Content: The Eden Amsterdam American is well-located for enjoying the sights of Amsterdam.. Walking to places is easy. Several convenient trams pass right by the hotel which is next to a picturesque canal. The staff was was very helpful in answering our questions. Our room was large, well-appointed and quiet. I expect that rooms located directly on the Leidesplein, a busy plaza, would not be so quiet. The hotel has a mix of business and leisure guests and a good restaurant and bar. The only negative we experienced was the high fees charged for using the hotel computer in the business center. We would stay at the hotel againl if were were to revisit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “First Impressions Don't Count”
Reviews.Author: EtoileBrilliant
Reviews.Content: Walking into the lobby and up the threadbare carpet to your room, you might be mistaken in thinking that you've landed a bum deal. Strangely enough th longer I stayed at the hotel the more I thought it wasn't half bad and that was primarily down to the wonderful staff service from the front desk to banqueting. Amsterdam is chock full of hotels that are situated on the former sites of great city houses (The Grand is another example). In short these are buildings with strange little corridors and coves and rooms tucked away in attics (I wouldn't recommend the hotel for disabled travellers) but this is all part of their charm. The hotel is situated at 7 o'clock (if Central station is at noon) and most districts are within a 20 minute walk. The area is much less salubrious than say Dam Square and has a good selection of restaurants both tourist and gourmet. Rooms were clean (though a little dark) and WiFi at â‚¬22 a day was a little steep - if you get a room facing the City Theater you can hijack their free wifi (good but patch). As I said earlier staff were excellent, food in restaurant whilst not perfect was good for the price. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely interior, staff was mixed”
Reviews.Author: thoma22d
Reviews.Content: In my opinion this was a nice looking hotel, the interior wasn't tacky and the rooms were standard for a 4 star I think. When I first arrived (very early afternoon) there was a woman who told me I could not check in yet and would I like to leave my bags to explore the city? Having just arrived from Boston I declined and thought if I waited she would find me a room faster (people had checked in after me and their rooms were availble, same size as my own). Finally a younger man who'd helped someone else was free so I asked him to find me a room - he was incredibly obliging! I'll stay here again because it was familiar and nice enough, although I'll ensure they'll have something available if I arrive even an hour before check-in!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, small and dingy room.”
Reviews.Author: marcjwilson
Reviews.Content: One night stay for business, didn't sample breakfast, but restaurant was nice if not a little pricey. Great location - walkable on a nice day from Amsterdam Centraal, plenty of nice pubs in the area. Reception were friendly and quick, but the room was pretty dark and dingy for my tastes.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: debrigard
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Standard room with inner courtyard view. Room was clean and comfortable, including bathroom, even if room & view lacked personality. Lack of free internet was a nuisance & costly. Plugs all 240v. Stayed there for 6 days as part of a 15-person workshop. In general we were well-attended, and the food was good (although not memorable). The nicest part of the Hotel experience comes from having breakfast in the large "Cafe Americain", with its high Art Nouveau ceilings and Tiffany chandeliers, looking over Leidesplein Plaza. The buffet-style breakfast has a nice assortment of healthy foods, and if bought with the room is reasonably priced (E 15/person). Note: our experience here and elsewhere is that service is good if you treat waiters as human beings, but lousy if you just order them around. This is an egalitarian city, more so than others. Also, make sure to request a city map from the concierge - the maps are excellent. Leidesplein Sq. is noisy at night: you are better off with a room facing an inner courtyard if street noise bothers you.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: jakkob
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful, the room larger than expected with a rather big bathroom. I'd have like furniture more in a 1920's style but I have nothing to complain about, the room was really great, everything was very clean. The breakfast buffet is quite appealing. The location is pretty ideal, although I never really understood why Leidseplein was so popular. The only downside is the surprising lack of a free internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, ugly room, expensive/bad internet, dirty”
Reviews.Author: evm18
Reviews.Content: A long wait at reception (room was booked ahead of course - 'we're looking for an extra noce room for you, when I asked', otherwise the lady just tapped at her screen for minutes without any comment) yielded an ugly, stuffy room with a small, stuck window. It was dirty, there was a plastic sheet over the mattress, the minibar (no expense spared there, it's electronically monitored!) excruciatingly expensive... the location is great and that's all there's to be said about this place. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Best buy!”
Reviews.Author: MarijanaTea
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in the city centre a few steps away from all major attractions and nightlife. As we arrived by car and parking on the street or garage in the city centre costs around 50 euros per day, we parked our car at the P&R on Olympisch Stadion which is 15 minutes away for the hotel by tram. We booked a standard room and got a pretty big one for Amsterdam hotel standards (#132) with a nice street view. Rooms are fairly soundproof and there are coffee/tea making fascilities at your disposal.

Reviews.Title: “Eden American...great location”
Reviews.Author: mkings12
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Eden American for 4 nights in April and it is a wonderful hotel...if you stay in a room other than #129. Don't get me wrong, the room was clean and very adequate during a 4-night stay for a couple only spending a couple of hours sleeping in there a night. There was a view of a wall from the only window in the small room, which ended up being alright if you want to sleep in. I guess the even numbered rooms have a view on the lower floors. We didn't mind the lack of view b/c we were out and about all day long. The concierge was more than helpful and spoke several languages which was a great help to us. Each piece of advice and help went above and beyond the call of duty and was much appreaciated. I would recommend the Eden American to any tourist for the ease of help from the staff there and the amazing location of the hotel right on the Leidspleien with trams, canal boats and busses all inside of 2 mins away.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, friendly staff and a little bit of luxury”
Reviews.Author: JackieD51
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights around Easter having spent two nights at the Amsterdam American last April. The hotel's location is excellent, on the edge of a busy area of the city with great restaurants, designer shops, thetatres, opera house, casino etc but also alongside a canal and just far enough away from the hustle and bustle to ensure a good night's sleep. Five tram lines are within a couple of minutes walk (including three which go to the central station) so getting around the city and beyond is very easy. There is also a canal bus stop immediately ouside the hotel, Vondels park is 10 minutes walk away. Being Iprefer members (following a tip on Trip Advisor a few years ago) we were upgraded to a suite which was huge and very nicely appointed, superb bathroom. Last time we had a canal view which was lovely whereas this time the room faced onto a road which was a bit noisy with the windows open but silent with the (very well glazed) windows shut. We did ask if there was an upgrade with a canal view but the hotel was full so we stayed put. All the staff are helpful and pleasant, this is the case at all iPrefer hotels we have found. If we visit Amsterdam again (which we probably will), we will definitely return to the Eden American which must be as good a recommendation as you can get. A tip - Humphreys on Nieuwezijds kolk (next stop after Dam sqaure on 1, 2, or 5 tram to central station) is an excellent restaurant offering three courses (choice of 6-7 items at each course) of top quality fare at less than 25 Euros. Well worth a trip.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive breakfast room, nice staff, tiny bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: JJEnglandUK
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant staff and all rooms no smoking. Toiletries disappointing as shower gel and shampoo just dispensers on wall, no conditioner. No slippers, no dressing gowns. Stayed three nights and allocated small room (could only just walk past end of the bed), bathroom the smallest I have ever encountered. View of building opposite and tram lines - felt like we were in the 'budget' accommodation - though we were certainly not paying budget prices. Floor boards creaked in our room and in one above, which disturbed our sleep. Asked for room change and given bigger room, with view of canal, which was nice. Floor boards did not creak. Bathroom still tiny - first time I have ever had more leg room on plane than whilst sitting on the loo... No room to swing a mouse, never mind a cat. Although towels were changed, tissue dispenser (which was empty was not refilled) and we had to request another toilet roll. Bedding was not changed. Opted to take breakfast on two mornings - offered at Euros 15 is booked in advance (cheaper than booking breakfast inclusive room). Breakfast room nice and though not extensive, the breakfast was of reasonable quality. Hotel staff were friendly and efficient, but really we should not have had to ask, for example, for tissues to be replenished. The big issue with this hotel is the bathrooms, we were told that all the bathrooms were at least as small as the one we had (apart from suites, which we could upgrade to, but only if we paid extra). For that reason alone, I would not recommend this hotel, nor stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tico78
Reviews.Content: It was a good value for money with a nice stay near leidsplein and the night spots

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: rd333104
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Amsterdam with my husband, mother and aunt. We had a wonderful time. Eden Amsterdam American Hotel is a great hotel, in a very nice neighborhood. Our rooms were very comfortable and clean. It is easy to get to the hotel from the airport. Bring change to buy a bus ticket. Hop on bus 197. 197 will also take you back to the airport when you return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place...but 22 euros for one day of Internet!”
Reviews.Author: jjf113
Reviews.Content: Nice place, nice location, but spending already over $200+ night, then having to pay over 22 euros for the Internet is just a plain ripoff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: brtoy
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 2 nights at this hotel. We had booked 2 rooms that were on the same floor next to each other. We checked in early and one room was availalbe so we stored our bags in one room and went sightseeing. We were on the 2nd floor and didn't have any noise level from the street below. Our room was beautifully decorated. It was a big room with a king size bed, small sofa with a chair, a desk/chair, flat screen tv with mini-frig. The bathroom was a good size with a garden tub. The second room was smaller than our room (exactly as picture on their website for a standard room) but it still had a king size bed and was still beautifully decorated. The location was perfect for sightseeing. It was within walking distance to most tourist sites and 10 min. walk to Dam Square. We took a 3 1/2 walking tour with Sandeman's Tours. Students give tours free and just ask for tips. Our guide's name was Joe and she was excellent. Sandeman's offer walking tours all over Europe. We didn't eat in the restaurant or bar. Prices were very high. They did have 2 computers available for a small fee although the day we tried to use it, the comptuer worked but the printer didn't work. We asked for assistance at the Front Desk and they allowed me to check our departing flight schedule and print boarding passes free of charge. The conceirge gave us tips on sightseeing and told us where to catch the public bus going back to the airport. We took the Schiphol airport bus to and from the airport for 4 euro each way. The hotel exceeded our expectations and I would definitely recommend it. The staff went above and beyond to make sure we enjoyed our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Eden American Hotel - Where Amsterdam and Times Square collide!”
Reviews.Author: richardoa
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Eden Amsterdam American Hotel last week for business. The hotel is a wonderful combination of Euorpean architecture and art deco! Beautifully situation overlooking the Leidseplein square, The American Hotel has a lot to offer the business and leisure traveler. My room was clean, efficient and with a balcony overlooking Leidseplein. The cafe and restaurant were wonderful and full of energy. The counter staff and concierge were wonderful and helpful. The American Hotel is perfectly situated for all your business and social needs. Walk out the front door and you can ride the Tram 15 minutes to RAI Amsterdam (Convention Center) Or 15 minutes to Central Station. It is only a 15 minute walk to the Fashion and Museum district. I highly recommend visiting the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum. Every night the Plein is filled with people eating and drinking at all the cafe's, bars and restaurants. If you are looking for something more American. There is a Hard Rock cafe 5 minutes away. I would recommend getting a 96 hour Tram Chip Card. This will allow you travel all over the city. The card can be purchsed for 19 Euro. Take a ride to Central Station and stroll through the Red Light District. This reminded me a little bit of Bourbon Street. You can then walk South and see the Royal Palace and Dam Square. Tired? Just jump on the Tram and take it to your next stop. You will not be disappointed at the American Hotel for a truely great Amsterdam experience.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was a great surprise”
Reviews.Author: Luizign
Reviews.Content: Good location, service, cleanliness, I am very satisfied with this hotel wich I didn't know anything about it.

Reviews.Title: “I Thoroughly Enjoyed This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArchAngel521
Reviews.Content: The Eden American is a lovely hotel, inside and out. Rooms were, I though, fairly large by Amsterdam standards (see pictures), the bath was nicely large as well. There was also a minibar, with EXTREMELY high prices (e.g. 4euro, almost $6, for 0.3 liter of Coke). The bed was comfortable and actually KING size, and was accompanied by a desk, two chairs (one at the desk), a dresser with flatscreen TV (many channels in English), and a decent sized closet with door. I appreciated that there were many lights and lamps, all of which could be controlled from switches right by the bed. This is a first class hotel in a prime location. The Leidseplein is at the intersection of tram lines, which makes it very convenient to get to varied locations around the city. It is also walking distance to many attractions, including casinos and museums. The Leidseplein itself is filled with bars and restaurants, from less expensive "fast" food restaurants (and, heaven forbid! U.S. chains like Macdonald's and Burger King) to very nice restaurants and quant bars and pubs. On a nice day, much of the plein is also filled with tables and chairs so you can eat/drink outdoors. But, going into the Leidseplein is not required, as the hotel itself has a lovely, if pricey, restaurant and bar, and its own outdoor service. The staff was very warm and welcoming, trying very hard to make the stay comfortable. Housekeeping was thorough and well done. This was one of the first hotels that I have run across in years in Europe that also had ice machines on every other floor! It is amazing at how hard it is to get ice, even in restaurants. This little feature made a lot of difference. Internet, wired, was available but expensive (18 euro for 24 hours contiguous, or 10 euro for 60 minutes non-consecutively during a 24-hour period). Service was fast and easy to connect. Even though I was on the fourth floor, I could still hear the tram noises. It was not awful, reminded me of a lightly rolling thunderstorm until the trams stopped at about 1am.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great part of Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: LondonTropicslover
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel and its fabulous location, near shops, cafes and restaurants, as well as in easy walking distance of the Vondelpark and Museums. The breakfast is good value for money, offering a choice of "full English" or cold Continental meats, cheese and pastries, served in a visually stunning environment of the Art Deco dining room. You could even help yourself to a civilised glass of Prosecco. We found the staff most helpful and some went well beyond the call of duty, providing us with a photocopied 'history of the hotel', which made interesting reading. Our bedroom overlooked the canal, so it had a nice view. It was perfectly comfortable and quiet, which is all one wants from a city hotel. We'll certainly stay again next time we're in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ripejack
Reviews.Content: Located just off Leidseplein and next to a canal, it is ideally placed for the Melkweg, the Paradiso, the great Oestebar fish restaurant and for a myriad of other bars, coffee shops and local specialties! The American Hotel bar is funky, and the Hotel bedrooms of a very high standard. I would certainly return to the American Hotel, although the Sofitel Convent Hotel probably just about has the edge for it's convenient location a few minutes walk from Centraal station.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly an Hotel to stay in when in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: SCOTSTOURIST
Reviews.Content: Surprised at some negative reviews by other members. Our experiences were completely positive from the very first moment (when we arrived to find our room was not quite ready, Reception immediately offered us a free drinks voucher and repeated that when it was still not ready less than half-an-hour later) until the end (our luggage was whisked away so that we could make use of our free time until departing for the airport). This hotel rose to every challenge. Any requests were greeted politely, gently and courteously with an "Of course!" reply. All the staff were friendly, but even more so once we had seen them a couple of times. The hotel was frequently extremely busy with locals and visitors but the staff still maintained a professional approach and service was usually prompt. The beautiful restaurant offered a comprehensive breakfast (we were offered a seasonal discount by Reception which we accepted), with all manner of cereals, cold and hot dishes, breads and pastries, juices and drinks - including champagne! - so we were astonished that some members had felt that breakfast was too expensive. Dinner was most enjoyable but we did feel that perhaps chef could have offered daily specials or that there could have been greater variety. Our fourth floor room was large, well appointed, quiet and comfortable. The en-suite was clean, the water almost instantly hot and the towels large and comforting. The mini bar was comprehensively stocked but Reception didn't pick up that we had used a large bag of crisps until we told them that we had. There was occasional "bell" noise from the trams outside (probably most noticeable in the morning). The tip by members to get the 370 bus from the airport was a very good suggestion. We did so to the Eden and back. Members need to be aware that the road from the airport is very smooth but has quite a few bends and, unless you can get a seat, coping with cases can be tricky. The Eden is ideally situated for access to the canal system, museums and shopping centres, either on foot or by using the buses or trams. The Hotel offered us an excellent map of the area, handy when exploring. We thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of our stay and would unhesitatingly stay at the Eden when next in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “RUDE, RUDE, RUDE”
Reviews.Author: Trip123_11
Reviews.Content: Hotel location was outstanding, near many good shops and restaurants, on canal. upon check in, I requested directions so various tourist attractions, it was clear this was a major imposition, some of the information they provided was wrong. Checking out has never taken so long, she was very slow and had several mistakes. When I asked for a cab to the train station I was advised to take the bus....yes, me and my 3 large bags....very helpful! When the cab arrived I asked the bellman if it was mine, (he did not see it pull up)...he said harshly:"I told you it would be 15 minutes".....yes, it did turn out to be my cab, he then watched me struggle to carry my own bags down the steps. The bed was very comfortable, the room very dark. If you want convenience and don't mind rude service this is good.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place to land in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: haveopinionwilltrvl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times and I am always welcomed back with warmth. The wonderful staff provided a lovely welcome to my parents for their 50th anniversary 3 years ago. Rooms with balcony are most favorite. I highly recommend this hotel for business or pleasure as a location to be grounded so that you can get out and explore the city. Proximity to Vondelpark, museums, tram, restaurants, canals, etc., is convenient. Sauna is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Historical Hotel With Bland Room Decor”
Reviews.Author: ArdentMusic
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderful except for the rather drab room firnishings and decor. I expected something more in keeping with the history and style of the building itself. In any other 4 star hotel the rooms would be fine but after the dining room they can only disappoint. We also had problems getting a comfortable room termperature and there didn't seem that much of an effort had been made to reduce the effect of street noise. We did not sleep well. Other comments - The vegetarian options in the dining room are incredibly limited if you are staying more than one night. How many burritos can you eat on one trip? The rooms need an ipod portal so that you can, at very least, play your ipod through the tv audio. I would also have liked to have been able to buy a short book or pamphlet about the history of the hotel. The dining room is increible, almost a museum on its own and it would be interesting to know more about it. At 800 euros for three nights stay The rooms really should also have robes.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: claire76
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel as a suprise city break for my husband's birthday; we are both in our 30's (34 & 38) and whilst wanting to experience the 'nightlife' of Amsterdam, we were more intersteded in good food, good beer and exploring the sights of the city. The hotel was in an excellent location for our requirements; just off Leidseplein and generally sheltered from any late night noise. We stayed in Room 526 which was a very good size, although the bathroom was on the small side. The room was serviced daily. Our only grumbles being that we did not get replacement tea & coffee on one of the days and the hairdyer in the bathroom did not blow warm air! The staff that we encountered were very friendly and helpful. Leidseplein itself is a busy square especially on a weekend evening, but felt safe and we did not encounter any trouble. Amsterdam is very walkable and from the hotel, you can walk to Centraal Station in approx 30 mins (medium pace) Would definitely recommend this hotel, especially if you manage to get the 3 nights for the price of 2 deal! Top Tip - from the airport take Bus number 197 from outside Schipol Plaza. For 4 Euro's per person, you get dropped straight outside the hotel; just look for the red neon American Hotel sign when you reach Leidseplein. Bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, wonderful service. Highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: snowball-15
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Eden American Hotel for one night. The room had contemporary furnishings and had a business feel, but was very elegant and comfortable. I had a balcony overlooking a busy square. The view of the city was fantastic, especially with Christmas lights and all. Although breakfast was not included in the rate and was rather pricey at 19 euro, it was superb. I had only two minor problems during my stay, but they would not prevent me from staying there again. First, this being Holiday season, there was some concert downstairs and at 11 pm it was still a little loud. But staying higher that the first floor would have probably helped. And I also did not like the Concierge. I was very hungry upon the arrival and needed guidance for the local restaurants. I got the impression that he wanted to get rid of me asap. When asked to point out a french restaurant, he has sent me to a generic burger place. When asked additionally about restaurant areas nearby, he has sent me to the shopping district where very few restaurants were. I still love the hotel, but their Concierge seemed unpleasant and incompetent to me.

Reviews.Title: “NIce location away from chavs, within walking distance of everyting”
Reviews.Author: yourekidding
Reviews.Content: Located next to a canal(what isn't) near a decent shopping area, not far from museums and only about 10 - 15 minute walk from anywhere you want. Great location for exploring Amsterdam and far enough away from the red light area, so decent sleep and safe ish. Casino just around the corner, DONT go into the hard rock cafe, its worse than an old Berni Inn if you ever went to one of those. Plenty of nice eateries around.

Reviews.Title: “smelly room, with bad lighting and not very friendly service....”
Reviews.Author: minxdorf
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for two nights, to explore amsterdam. the location is great... but the room smelt awful, the loo seemed to be leaking. and the lighting was awful, so although we were there in the summer, the room was so dark that we didnt want to stay in it longer than a few minutes. i would say for the prices they charge u could find somewhere cheaper and better. unless they upgrade the standards of their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Explore the City”
Reviews.Author: pintac90
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Amsterdam before, I booked this hotel because it was centrally located. The location was perfect, very well positioned so you can explore the city. After flying in from Newark, I arrived at the hotel around 10:00 am and I was given my room without any problem. The room itself was very clean and well furnished, I had a great view of the Canal. Since this was mid December it was very cold outside, but my room was very warm and comfortable. I would definitely recommend this hotel to travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - superb location!!!”
Reviews.Author: sarahvix
Reviews.Content: Right next to the tram stop on Leidesplein this is a fantastic location!! The best bars and clubs are in this square but remarkably inside the hotel you could hardly hear the buzz from outside. The hotel is also a 5 minute walk to the top art galleries - Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum. The building itself is beautiful - art deco style. You really feel you are staying somewhere special. The hotel has a great cafe and bar that looks out on fountains. Sadly once you get inside you could be in a premier inn/ travelodge/ ibis whatever. it has that look and feel about it and there are none of the features of this beautiful building inside. My room was ok - small windows- but to be fair I was on a cheap rate so I assume you get the 'worst' rooms. However the room was clean and had all the things you need. At night the outer door is locked which is good as there are a lot of drunk/stoned people about!! Staff all friendly and of course speak fluent English so were helpful with advice. Overall a great place- I got a room for Euro140 which is great value - however some people there were paying nearer to 300 which is way too much for what you get. So if you can get a good deal stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: notbriansweetser
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the American from Nov. 1-12th 2010 and was very happy with my stay. It was my first trip to Amsterdam and first business trip alone. There was plenty to do around the hotel from a tourist standpoint. Tram 5 takes about one minute to walk to, giving you quick access to Museumplein, Centraal Station, and Station Zuid (my office was close to there). I had arrived early in the morning the day of my first booked night and my room wasn't ready for hours, but the staff ensured that I was comfortable and happy while I was waiting. The breakfast buffet, while a bit on the expensive side at 19.50 euro, was very delicious, and I ate dinner one night in the restaurant, again expensive but very good. If you plan to purchase some groceries for your room, I would recommend getting on Tram 5 toward A'veen Bienhoff to Museumplein, there is a store there much larger and seemed to be cheaper than the one near the hotel. All in all, great stay, the bed was pretty comfortable, and the room was very large for a standard European hotel room...internet however costs 88 euro a week....fine if the company is paying for it but it could get frustrating if it's a leisure trip...don't know much about it but there is a Marriott about a 5 minute walk from here as well so you may want to compare the two hotels before making a decision.

Reviews.Title: “standard room just reasonable, dining room great, location perfect !”
Reviews.Author: HJenThomas
Reviews.Content: We are living in the Netherlands and went to the new De La Mar theater to see the La cage aux folles show. First the theater is really great, and the show is fantastic! Great decors, great actors and ofcourse lots of drags. Must see it ! After the show we went into te the city to get some cocktails. That's not a easy in Amsterdam because we experienced that drinking cocktails is not so common in Holland then in the US of Germany for example. When manage to go to a great cocktailbar called: Njoy : www.cocktailclubnjoy.nl After the cocktails we went to the hotel. We get the American for a bargan: 140 euro. And that wraps it. The hotelroom was a standard room and for sure no more worth than the 140 euro's. We saw that some bookingsites you have to pay 100 more ! Dont do that, its not worth it. The rooms are clean and even big for Amsterdam standards. And what's unfortunaly also tipical dutch is the unfriendly staff. Only one guy was at the checking in. the woman who helped our friends wasn't friendly and helpfull. She didnt explane anything not even the breakfasttimes. We did expect more from such a hotel (****). The entree of the hotel was a bit dissapointed. Very small and no grandeur. The diningroom (also for breakfast) is simply great !! Very beautifull art-decor! Must see that. The bar was modern but after 11pm no hot snacks and at 1am closed...!! So mixed feelings about this hotel. The location at the Leidseplein is great. The outside and the dining/breakfastroom is great. The rooms are value for money when you have a bagain like us (140 euro). Service is average/poor and in my opinion tipical dutch...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend, perfect hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jandkWestMids
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other reviews about the hotel we were a bit apprehensive about what we would find, but when we arrived at the hotel in the morning we received a very friendly welcome from reception who explained that although the room wasn't ready we could do the check in process so that we only had to collect the keys later on and the concierge took our suitcases for us - gave us a ticket so no photo id was required to collect the cases later - and then he gave us a very useful map of the city and pointed out all of the best attractions and best areas to shop/eat etc. The hotel is in a perfect location. We took the advice from one of the reviews and got a return ticket for bus 197 from the VVV Amsterdam shop inside the airport (next to the airport information centre) for 10 euros. You get the bus right outside the airport and it does stop literally right outside the hotel. Plenty of room on the bus for suitcases etc and there is a liitle tv screen that tells you what the next stop is. the hotel is right in the centre of everything so we walked everywhere - no need to buy a public transport ticket for your stay - and there is a hop on/hop off canal cruise stop outside the hotel as well which you can buy a ticket for 24/48 hours and stops at all the major attractions. The hotel room was very nice. I think the hotel rooms have been refurbished since some of the other reviews on here as it was very modern and looked brand new. The beds were really comfy and we didn't hear any noise. The only thing I would say is - girls take your own hairdryer!! There was one in the bathroom but it took me absolutely ages to dry my hair and the handle on it gets quite hot when you've been holding it a while. We also booked a reservation at The Seasons restaurant for the Saturday night as recommended on trip advisor and the food was very nice. A 3 course meal for 27 euros and it did get full and they were turning people away, but there are lots and lots of places to eat in amsterdam so getting in somewhere on the other 2 nights we were there was not a problem. Would definitely go back to the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Madge_n_Fineogs
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at this hotel, mainly because of the great location but also due to the friendly and efficient hotel staff, the extremely spacious room (although the decor was a little plain for its 4 star status) and lovely comfy bed ensuring a sound sleep. Others have complained about noisy rooms and disturbance from maids knocking on doors early but we encountered neither of these, maybe because the hotel did not seem particularly busy. We got a pretty good bargain on lastminute (Â£75 per night) so felt we got v. good value for money. We did not bother with breakfast as it seemed expensive at nearly â‚¬20 per head, but had a drink in the main cafe/ restaurant to savour the superb art noveau splendour. The lounge bar was also very pleasant - one of the nicest hotel bars we have encountered in a while. Free WiFi would have been welcome but you can't have everything. We used one of the hotel's computers, to check in and print off our boarding passes at 0.35 Eur/min plus 0.35 Eur per printed page - OK if you can type fast! If you're flying in to Schiphol then get the 197 bus from the Plaza to the Leidseplein (4 Euro and run every 15 mins) and it will drop you off practically on the doorstep of this hotel - another plus point. Would not hesitate to stay here again provided that the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless Night”
Reviews.Author: robinfri
Reviews.Content: have stayed at this hotel a number of times in the past and it has been adequate. However, this time it was totally unacceptable - I was woken up at circa 1.30am by a constant load banging noise coming from below my room. I called reception and was initially ignored until the banging became so load that it could heard by reception via the phone. After another 3 calls the receptionist (it was now 2.00am) they advised me that workman were completing essential work in the dinning room!! Eventually I had to move to another room at circa 2.15 am which of course totally disrupted my sleep for that night. I found the staff rude and dismissive - I always thought that the point of hotels was for people to sleep in them!! I will never stay there again as apart from this specific problem the hotel is not that clean and the rooms are in need of serious refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & bar/restaurant, but NOT 100% satisfaction : (”
Reviews.Author: jules8000
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for 7 nights. There were good and bad points. Friendly staff, fantastic bar/restaurant/loaction and fountain. But this does not filter into the hotel reception or room. I would have liked the feel of the American art deco style to filter into the lobby area. The restaurant is super, and the bar is trendy, but the hotel lobby has no character. Room was fairly good, (slightly dusty) but I was very satisfied with the size, bathroom, TV, huge bed and furnishings. Fresh towels and bed tidied daily. There were a lot of leaflets and info in the room, which is good to certain degree, but would be nice to have it all in one folder like many hotels I have stayed in (including the minibar menu, that was no where to be seen - attention to detail matters, especially if you are paying high rates in a 4 star hotel!). The biggest disappointment was the lack of wireless internet (which my partner required as he was attending the IBC conference). The internet service which was provided was slow and too expensive. Would have liked wifi, or at least some facilities in the lobby for free surfing? Room rate was high because of the high demand at the time, but it didn't help the fact we had to pay city tax per day, and only realised this when we were checking out. (We don't usually travel within Europe but apparently you pay this in several other countries like France too)! We had to book this hotel because all others were booked as the IBC conference was in town. Location however was spot on. Located close to theatres, casinos, and canal boat trips. Tram lines literally seconds from the hotel. Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Musuem 5/10 mins walk. Stay here if you want good location. But there are many other hotels in the center that do the same at a much cheaper price, and maybe breakfast at a reasonable rate too!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Carlo016
Reviews.Content: Have spent in this hotel about 40 nights over the past 6 months. Location is great for both business and leasure travellers as it is right in Leidsplein and in front of tram 5 stop (so you can easily reach station and Amsterdam South office district). Reasonably priced for Amsterdam, rooms are large but furniture of standard rooms is a bit dated. Try to get a room with canal view if possible! Fitness center is OK (a bit small)

Reviews.Title: “Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: newflyer
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this hotel and I found it great for a leisure trip. It is within walking distance to the coffee shops, tons of restaurants, the trams, shopping, and right on the canal. I signed up for the breakfast as part of the room charge and found it to be great. A good selection and a nice quiet place to eat before going out to explore the city. The room was a good size and pretty quiet. I was disturbed a few times in the morning by street cleaning, or construction or something like that but was heading out anyway by that time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but...........”
Reviews.Author: jccoupe
Reviews.Content: A great hotel within easy walking distance of all the city and good transport links with buses and trams outside. However the service in the restaurant was tediously slow due to them taking a large party booking which seemed to take preference over everyone else paying full price! It took 2 hours for 2 courses and they tried to serve us a dessert we had not ordered before we had the main course! Offer was a bottle of water to compensate! Overpriced for food.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Hallpeople
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the end of a River Cruise and could not have been happier with this hotel. We had a room overlooking the canal and it was very large and clean. The location of this hotel is perfect for a visit to Amsterdam as it is so well situated and is in easy walking distance to almost all of the sights. The staff were very helpful and courteous at all times. We did not have any meals there as there were just so many places within the area to choose from. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gemmer95
Reviews.Content: Just back from staying at the American Hotel, what a great Hotel, friendly staff, great room, brilliant bar, just cant rate this Hotel any higher. If your going to Amsterdam, please book this Hotel you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam American - Historical Hotel in Leidesplein (a happening area)”
Reviews.Author: mpeterson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a trip that included 2 nights at the Amsterdam American Hotel. We had a king room that overlooked the canal (although there was a giant tree in the way so we didn't have much of a canal view). Our room was larger than I thought it would be, given the previous reviews. The bathroom, however; was tiny. It was hard to have two people in the bathroom at once. Also, my husband really disliked the bathtub. He is tall, and although the shower was a good height, the bathtub itself was narrow with a slopin floor, making it hard for him to stand with his feet level. His front or back part of his foot had to edge up the side of the tub to stand under the shower. Having "dainty" feet myself, I didn't have this problem, but it was very annoying for him. The location of this hotel is very convienent to a lot of activities that we wanted to do while in Amsterdam. The night life around the hotel is booming, but not close enough to cause a lot of noise. The canal boats are right along side the hotel, and the hotel is only a few minutes walk to Reijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum. (Buy your tickets early at the Tourist aide shop just a block down from the hotel, near the giant outdoor seating area -- and you won't have to wait in line!) The canals around the hotel are very picturesque. The hotel itself if very historic and quite beautiful in the old art deco style. The American Cafe, and room service, are outrageously expensive. Our pizza was about 20 euros (but delicious late at night). I recommend going to the Pancake House or the cafe near the opera, a few blocks down from the hotel. We did not have any problems with bed bugs, as one reviewer mentioned, and although we didn't have very many dealings with the staff, they were curteous and efficient in check in and check out. I would stay here again - but would make sure that we got the cheap prepaid rate like we did this time. The room service/cafe prices are outrageous, as is the wifi. (20 euros!) Overall though, we had a comfortable stay at a good price, and that's what is most important to us!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: kellyhatty
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my husbands 40th Our room was beautiful views of the canals - the hotel is lovely The bed was massive !! Service was excellent A lovely romantic break

Reviews.Title: “Great time in a great city”
Reviews.Author: City-Break-Lover
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe I had stayed at the same hotel as the previous reviewer. We went to Amsterdam on a City break. We found the hotel using Trip Advisor and as usual, were not disappointed. It was our 41st wedding anniversary and when I booked I asked if it was possible, whether we could have a room with a canal view. Not only did they give us this but it had a small balcony as well. It was delightful, spotlessly clean, the bed was enormous and there was plenty of free tea, coffee etc. The toiletries were of a high standard and the bathroom. although not large, had everything we needed. The staff were very helpful and although there may have been students (every-one has to learn somewhere) the staff seemed very experienced and when I thought I had lost my passport, they were very helpful. The mini bar was expensive (they usually are) but there were so many places nearby this wasn't a problem. We didn't eat there because the food did seem very expensive with not a lot of choice. We went out for breakfast which was great fun as there were several good options. The hotel was ideally situated near to all the main attractions and we would certainly want to stay there again if we went to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: saudoso
Reviews.Content: It's a stone's throw away from the museums, you're right on the canal belts with the most beautiful streets, and an easy 20-30 minute walk to anywhere in the old town center. The tram also stops in front of the hotel, if you're ever tired of walking. Although I'd highly recommend renting a bikeâ€“ best way to enjoy the city and really experience it like a local.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and hotel that was very civilized without being stuffy.”
Reviews.Author: izzyandme
Reviews.Content: The location was within a short walk to the museums, across the street from a canal boat stop and various transportation options.The area restaurants were a bit pricey but hey, it's Amsterdam. The hotel's bartender named Roger was a delight and we intend to buy him a round the next trip. If you stop in, tell him Isabella and Peter said hello.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but extras can add up”
Reviews.Author: ThatSemanticsGuy
Reviews.Content: First, the good points: the hotel itself is beautiful, the rooms are very comfortable, and the location is great. Even being in the middle of one of the biggest tourist areas in Amsterdam, I didn't have problems with street noise keeping me awake. The hotel is right on the tram line, and Amsterdam isn't very big, so it's easy to get to wherever you want to be. The staff is very friendly, and the cafe out front is a comfortable place to sit as the sun goes down. Now, the bad: extras can be expensive. If you decide to have breakfast at the hotel, it's wonderful, but it is quite pricey. The same with wireless, which most definitely isn't free. At the same time, I got a good deal on the rate when I booked, so that took the sting off, at least a bit. Interesting surprise: if you ask for a wake-up call, the phone will ring, but only the one on the desk, not the one by your bed. They really do want to make sure you wake up! Overall, a wonderful place to stay, especially if you don't indulge in any of the expensive extras.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel but very expensive to eat and drink there!”
Reviews.Author: Hayles_kat
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, very clean, excellently located and good value for money on a deal. We arrived on the night of the World Cup final and decided to try and catch the match in the hotel bar, big mistake! The bar is small and very over priced 5 euros for a cider and 7.50 for a vodka and lemonade!! But to be honest Amsterdam as a whole is VERY expensive. We had breakfast in the sports bar almost opposite the hotel and also at the pancake place just over the canal towards the Van Gogh museum, far cheaper there! I would stay in this hotel again and would reccomend it to others. We paid for a standard room and got upgraded to a massive one too!

Reviews.Title: “An impressive looking hotel that lived up to its reputation.”
Reviews.Author: bookworm137
Reviews.Content: A beautiful building in an excellent location. Easy to get to by tram. Canal ride pick up directly outside hotel. All areas were exceptionally clean and well maintained. Staff were above average for Amsterdam but they don't really go the extra mile there so if you don't expect it you won't be disappointed. Room was pleasantly large as we only paid for a standard room with huge bed. We overlooked the busy street at the back but the efficient air conditioning obliterated most noise (although they did start to remove the road surface at 7am one morning). It was quite an expensive hotel but if you can get a deal it's worth it. I don't know how others feel but there are some huge trees between the hotel and canal so if you did pay a supplement for canal view you may be disappointed during the summer months. Very small gym but with good equipment but NO air conditioning - phew!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: pumpcaptain
Reviews.Content: We arrived to Amsterdam in the morning. The hotel stored our baggage and put a rush on our room. They gave me a call a short time later saying our room was ready. The staff in the restaurant was especially good. The breakfast was quite extensive. The room is large for european standards. We had a room with a balcony overlooking the canal. It was very quiet. I am especially sensitive to noise, and there is no noise coming from outside or the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service and stuffy rooms in an old building”
Reviews.Author: gmhowi
Reviews.Content: While the building looks nice and is located most conveniently, the service we received was simply bad (e.g. nobody at the door to help with luggage, unfriendly waitress at breakfast, slow service at breakfast - how long do you need to wait for a cup of coffee?) and the room was quite appalling (appeared to be grimy and not quite cleaned; window frames with peeling paint and some loose tape at the outside). And this all for a room rate of EUR 200 plus EUR 16 per person for breakfast!! Never Again!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Eden Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: 2DayattheBeach
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Eden American was wonderful. When I booked I wasn't so sure because we didn't know where anything was, but it turns out that Eden is about half a block off one of the two main squares. Our room was perfectly clean and there was plenty of room for our luggage. There was a very comfortable bed, a desk, and a small table and chair. When we got there, which was early, our room was already ready. The front desk staff was helpful and alway courteous, showing us which buses and trams to take and there was a place to store our bags when we checked out. This is by far the best place to stay and we wouldn't even think about staying somewhere else when we go back!

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't have been happier”
Reviews.Author: Cherna
Reviews.Content: Nothing much more to add to all the other reviews: this in indeed a beautiful hotel; our room was larger than we expected with 2 windows and a Juliet balcony overlooking the square. It is immaculately clean. The bed was very comfortable; the staff was helpful and polite. They will store your luggage until check-in or after check-out if your plane leaves late. It is close to everything: shops, museums, restaurants, tram stop in front of hotel - you have everything you need for a pleasant stay in Amsterdam. I would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Wonderful Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: CaitlinDublin
Reviews.Content: Booked a canal facing room with a balcony and if the weather is good (not raining!!) it is well worth the extra cost. Enjoyed the wonderful breakfast in the truly lovely Cafe America (it is on a special rate of â‚¬17 pp at the moment - fantastic value) and had a delicious dinner there also (we thought it was also great value) and enjoyed drinks in bar America. Staff excellent (particular the waiters). Found the tip to use 197 bus for reaching the hotel (â‚¬4 per person - pay on bus) excellent. Arrived early and were able to leave luggage and use hotel safe deposit box (nervous about walking around a city with passports and credit cards) while we enjoyed the city until our room was ready. (Although staff asked for photo id when we got back - luckily we still had some id on us). As many others have said this hotel is in a great location for seeing the city - trams and canal cruise boats (booked 2 day Museumline cruse) outside the door - nice reasonable snacks available in the restaurant which is a short walk to the right of the main door of the hotel with views of the canal.

Reviews.Title: “such alovely hotel in the center”
Reviews.Author: DaLaL_ShaNe3a
Reviews.Content: this was my first time in american hotel the building was nice it was built in 1900 the stuff was so nice and helpful and polite we booked and standard room at the chech in they make for us afree upgrade to a deluxe room because we are staying for 14 night and it was really nice with alovely view over the suqare and anice balconey the only things that it was to noisy and u can hear the tram from 5 in the morning we couldnt get asleep other than that it was nice be sure to ask for aroom in ahigh floor and avoid the first floor it was to noisy, the location of this hotel was in the center and every things was withen walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is in a perfect location for...”
Reviews.Author: Barjan1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location for sightseeing, bars and restaurants. It was very easy to get from the airport using the number 197 bus, as the bus stop is right outside. The big downside to all this is that it is extremely noisy at night. Car horns sound all night long so if you like your sleep I woulnt recommend this hotel. We stayed up til the wee small hours anyway but it was a waste of time trying to sleep before 5am. The hotel interior is ok, nothing special and the room we had was large and had a canal room. It was clean and did the job but we wouldn't be bothered to stay there again.
