Reviews.Title: “The most amazing time ever....”
Reviews.Author: coles76
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotels. Staff are very polite and helpful. You were closed to bus and tram to travel round this very pretty city. I can't wait to come back

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel retains its charms.”
Reviews.Author: Kwiptix
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at this hotel nearly 20 years ago. On this visit I was glad to find the hotel has retained its charming if somewhat faded old world atmosphere. The art deco details are a distinctive feature of this hotel, distinguishing it from the common characterless modern 4 star hotels. The location of course is very convenient but despite being on the busy Leidseplein, I found the room to be quiet and peaceful, but then I did not have a room facing the square. One tip for getting to the hotel, if you travel by public transport from Schiphol, it's better to take bus 197 from Schiphol plaza than to take the train to Central station. The bus takes a little more time but it drops you very near the hotel. My only complaint about this hotel is the same complaint I have about almost every 3 and 4-star hotels I have been in: internet charges, both wired and wireless, are outrageously expensive. Business travellers with expense account may not care but holiday makers on their own dime won't want to fork out 20 euros a day when you can cross the square to Burger King and get free wireless there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...overpriced with poor service”
Reviews.Author: supaflytnt
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Holland and stayed at the American for 4 nights. Without a doubt, the location of this hotel is superb. You are very close to the heart of the city, with easy access to all parts of Amsterdam. The canal station is one block away, and the city trams are right outside your door. Not to mention it is an easy walk to almost everywhere of interest for tourists. However, the price is just unacceptable for the service we received. We spent about $400 per night when you include taxes. There is no breakfast included at this price, but for another 20 euro per person, there was. No thanks. Also, the front desk's attitude seemed to be 'no can do' for simple requests regarding what restaurants to eat at, and recommendations for places to visit at night. It almost seemed like we were imposing on them when we asked for recommendations...funny I thought that was their job! We should have expected this after we asked for a place to go for breakfast our first morning, and we were sent to the local sports bar chain...we found many quaint cafes within a few blocks on our own for the rest of our stay, so its not like they don't exist. Bottom line, the location was great, but for the price we paid, you could do much better. Because of the poor service, we will not be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, great location....comfortable bed!”
Reviews.Author: KingswinfordSteph
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the American for 3 nights and between us had 3 rooms. They were tastefully decorated and very comfortable. The Hotel had a restaurant...check out the stunning room that houses it. Very expensive though, but plenty great eateries nearby. Hotel bar was quite lively for a hotel bar. Staff were very helpful when we were stranded due to the volcano. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “top hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: redsandy1892
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading about it on this site. Have to say its in a great location, central for most things. The hotel is well presented both from outside and in. The rooms can be on the tight size for space but are clean (last time we stayed in amsterdam the hotel we booked had the smallest room ever compared to that one this one was double the size). We asked for an outside room with a balcolny which we got and is was lovely. The bar is pretty swish but is pricey. 5.5 euros for a larger. We ate out for breakfast as this was cheaper than the 20 euros they wanted. I plugged my netbook into the wired internet and it worked perfectly and was free. The beds are lovely and bigger and soft with very clean white sheets. The bathroom did its job and the towels were soft. We also had bathrobes and slippers provided. We only stayed there two nights but will be booking this hotel next time we come to amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Handsome hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyDLondon
Reviews.Content: Right on the Canal. Solid old fashioned hotel with charater and charm. Great location, walk every.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: WilmaB24
Reviews.Content: Stayed Feb for a special break away. Booked a classic double room got a very big room with separate office area. Well stocked mini bar but did not use as too expensive, Very clean and lovely bathroom. Did not use food area`s 19.95 euros per person for breakfast when there is a great bakers just up the road. Amsterdam is a very expensive place with drinks and food not cheap anywhere but it is a good town to visit different cultures and areas of interest. I would stay at this hotel again as it exceeded my expectations and is in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: mcgac
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel, staff were very accommodating when we were woken up at 7am with the noise from the building work going on in another anex of the hotel. Complementry breakfast was offered and they moved us to another room with a balcony and a lovely view over the canal. The hotel was very central to everywhere, and the bus back to the airport was just outside the door of the hotel and took about 45 minutes. Price 3 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: spicyhippo
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on location and reviews. Location is superb, took the 197 bus from the airport and was very easy and probably the best way to get to this area so will give details on how you do that. On leaving the airport follow the signs for buses and stop in at one of the news shops who will sell you a stripenkart, 7.50 Euros for 15 strips. At the bus stop there is a big electronic sign telling you which bus stop each bus is so easy to find where you need to go. When the bus turns up hand your stripenkart and tell the driver you want to go to Leidseplein, he will stamp 5 strips and hand it back to you. There is a screen on the bus that tells you which stop is next so easy to know when to get off. The Leidseplein stop is directly outside the American Hotel and its that simple. You can use 5 strips getting back to the airport and use the other 5 on trams getting around the city and always buy another stripenkart if you need to. The hotel location is ideal for the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum, House of Bols, Heineken Experience and a host of bars and restaurants in and around Leidseplein. Its also a 30 minute walk to red light district and about the same to Anne Frank house. Out the back entrance is also the stop for the Hop on Hop off canal boat cruise which is a great way to see the city. The boats have commentary ( In English ) so provide a guided tour also and cost 20 Euros and are available to use 24 hours from purchase. There are 3 different lines you can ride green, red and blue and stop at all the notable landmarks Muesemplein, Central station, Anne Frank house to name a few. We arrived at 12pm and although check in is supposed to be 3pm I emailed before letting them know that I would like Canal facing room and to check in early if possible. They emailed back saying although they couldnâ€™t guarantee either request they would do there best and I was delighted that on my arrival both requests were facilitated by a very friendly and helpful reception girl who checked us in. She asked if we were celebrating and I said yes as it was my girlfriends birthday and in the room was a nice welcome letter and two free drinks vouchers for the bar. We had a few drinks in both bars and the American bar with all the celeb photos was quite nice with good friendly staff. Found the staff in the hotel overall very good and helpful with requests during our stay. As breakfast was 20 Euros we decided to eat elsewhere as there are plenty of alternatives right on the doorstep at half the price. Location, service and the overall building general areas and the fountain outside where great. Where this hotel doesnâ€™t score top marks is as others have mentioned the rooms need a facelift as although they are clean, the chipped paint and hooks hanging off in our room didnâ€™t really measure up to the rest of the hotel. That said if I went back to Dam I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, but very dated. Terrible room service menu. Expensive internet.”
Reviews.Author: MarisaB
Reviews.Content: The hotel is apparently pretty centrally located. The lobby leaves much to be desired, the rooms and common areas are very dated. The restaurant is decorated really cheesey (think red furniture with black & white photos), the rooms are dated, the bathrooms are tiny and look like a Days Inn and the internet access is 22 euros! The room service menu is so bad, I couldn't even order anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: markroy53
Reviews.Content: stayed here for two days in february 2010. well located, within walking distance to all of the major museums and tourist sites. the staff is very attentive and the rooms, though small, are more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Canal View and Loft Apartment - fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: PeteandSiobhan
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to book the Ruud de Wild Art Suite - a spacious 2 level loft style room. The bedroom was upstairs and a lounge area and bathroom downstairs. Large flat screen TV's were on also both levels. The lighting was unusual - spotlight style lights which changed colour. There was a beautiful view of the canal and small balcony. A Nespresso coffee maker was also available for use. Breakfast was average - a large selection of pastries, juices, cold meats and cheeses, eggs and sausages. The restaurant was a magnificent setting. Location could not be better - just outside Leidseplein and access to trams and canal boats. Certainly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER STAY HERE - STAFF ARE RUDE!!!”
Reviews.Author: jnaf
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay at the Eden Amsterdam American Hotel the weekend of Feb 19 for my wfie's birthday. My wife is not a big fan of flying so we decided to catch a train from London. Unfortunately our trip has had to be cancelled because of the horrendous train accident in Brussels as no trains are going in or out of the city. Now you would think a hotel would be sympathetic towards this plight and offer a full refund however that was not to be the case. I booked the room through Expedia and I'm aware that the rates were non-reunfdable but you would think due to the extenuating circumstances they would provide a full refund. I found the person I spoke to rude and heartless and if this is an example of the rest of the staff at the American Hotel then I would advise you look for somewhere else to stay. (By the way, providing a full refund was not an issue for the train company who I booked non-refundable tickets from as they were most gracious and happy to provide me with my money back).

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Wonderful Location - Top Marks!!!”
Reviews.Author: marypoppers
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous rooms, really comfy and clean. the staff were lovely and you couldn't be closer to Leidser Square if you tried. The bed was the largest, and most comfyiest bed we've ever stayed in which made us have an afternoon siesta which lastest for much longer than planned! We will definately recommend and will definately stay there again. 10/10

Reviews.Title: “One day a long time ago....”
Reviews.Author: twau
Reviews.Content: American was a topnotch hotel I guess. Measured to today's standards it just feels very old to me. Bedmatras in room where I was staying was way too soft like it was there for over 10 years allready. Bathroom had a 80's vibe as well. When you are a modern day traveller you better go to Park Hotel it only 2 min walk away and has a fresh vibe to it. It just needs a major intern renovation to bring it back to a modern hotel. Outside is really great looking I must say.

Reviews.Title: “Happy canal-side stay”
Reviews.Author: LagunaGrrl
Reviews.Content: Great convenient location, nice staff. CHECK-IN: It's a 3pm check-in. We had a 9am flight which had us at the hotel by 10:30am. Our room was not available, but with our names in we were told to come back after 12:00 and they'd try to get us in early. We got back by 1:30pm and they had our room ready. Staff were friendly and accommodating. ROOM: We had #116, which is a great canal-side room with a balcony. The bed was comfortable and the room large for European standards. The bathroom was fine with great water pressure, however we were traveling in December and there wasn't a heater directly in the bathroom - which meant the air was a bit chilly for the morning shower. No noise to speak of - couldn't hear neighbors or the streets outside. The black-out curtains worked great to keep city lights and morning sun out. LOCATION: Great location. Convenient to Leidseplein, trams and walkable to the Dam. A completely safe area, well-lit. PROPERTY: The hotel is well-maintained. There's a bar on-site and the cafe is well-known it's own right. There was a large holiday party going on at the time - the staff took care to make sure that hotel guests were not bothered by noise or the crowd by leaving a note in rooms advising of the festivities and who to call if anything was a problem. A rare proactive approach. PLUSES: Location, access to trams. Staff were friendly and helpful. MINUSES: If you get an "inside" room, you will have a truly ugly view of interior walls. The "canal" and "external" rooms are absolutely recommendable, but not sure how you can guarantee you get one. We just booked an internet sale deal and lucked out. BOOKING: $132/night via Expedia. We booked over 60 days in advance and got a pretty amazing deal. TIPS: If you'd like to sample some fine Netherland beers, BiercafÃ© 't Arendsnest is a fantastic and cozy place to do so.

Reviews.Title: “great location - not luxurious though”
Reviews.Author: margmc
Reviews.Content: we stayed here over new year - the exterior of the hotel is lovely - inside you will be a bit disappointed - the reception area is a let down and the lifts are very old in need of updating bar is good - pricy though the best bit of the hotel is the location - easy walking distance of restaurants/bars and the trams rooms are bordering on the basic - ask for a canal view room - these have the nicest views i would recommend this hotel if you get it for a bargain price - we didnt and i felt it was expensive without having any semblance of luxury

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel - We didn't want to leave & beware of sleeping in over the alarm!”
Reviews.Author: rebeccaeady
Reviews.Content: Check-in at this hotel is 3pm but luckily they had our room ready and cleaned for us about half past 1 in the afternoon - A nice bonus after being awake since 4am, a flight, a train journey & a tram ride, plus endless amounts of walking to pass the time. We have been to Amsterdam many times before so we already know whats about & where, that is why we chose the Eden American Hotel on Leidesplein. Perfect positioning if you want to be close to the nightlife, museums & shopping areas of Amsterdam - Leidesplein is definitley one of the less 'seedier' places you can stay in Amsterdam & I definitley feel safe! One thing I should point out which was a bit naughty of the hotel was that they asked for 90 euros a day for 'incidentals' on a credit card. Well firstly, we don't own a credit card & secondly this was never stated when booking the hotel directly on it's own website. Luckily they reduced this to 90 euros during the hotel stay & accepted a debit card. They did give us the option of paying it in cash, however we felt this was a little unfair as we had brought the money to spend outside of the hotel. This was the only critism that I had of the hotel. We were placed on a 'vip' list as we were celebrating my birthday (albiet a month later!) but we were placed in the most fantastic room! Room 109 was perfect for a view over the canal & watching the hustle and bustle down below. We were also given a voucher that entitled us to a free drink in the main bar. We were going to use this, however we lost it on the day we were going to use it. Typical! There was a little sitting area and a huge window that was fab for relaxing on. The usuals of a working desk & internet connections, those you would of a four star hotel. I must move on to something, that was quite spectacular, and this object was the king sized bed! Although Im sure it was MUCH bigger?! It was the comfiest bed known to man - so please be warned if you stay here you may outsleep your alarm or wake up call! The bathroom was nice and equipped with a bath/shower, toilet and sink, of a small size but did its job & plenty of towels were provided. There were nice toiletries made by a company called 'rituals', you will find this shop walking around leidestraat area & upto the flower market. There was also a safe, tea/coffe facilities, mini bar, LCD tv which catered for all languages, Animal Planet being on frequently! The hotel does have its own restaraunt, bar & cafe, however we did not have the pleasure in going in them as the menu was a little pricey, however this is what you would expect of a 4 star hotel, but apparently the food is devine! They also had a gym/fitness room which clients could use. Overall this hotel is in a perfect location, has fab staff & the hosptiality is second to none. We will DEFINTLEY be returning to this hotel hopefully on our next trip to Amsterdam - which is once a year! We just love the place & this wonderful hotel. I would recomment this hotel to anyone, we paid 100 euros a night and it was well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “For Parents, children and family Amsterdam is a great City Break destination”
Reviews.Author: DublinRoseG
Reviews.Content: We are a family of three, two parents and a nine year old daughter. This is a great city - dutch people are very relaxed and helpful. It's easy to get around. After lunch one day, the cafe owner sat and just chatted to us! We stayed in the Eden Amsterdam American Hotel in Leidesplein. This is a lovely down to earth comfortable hotel. There was a photoexhibition and authograph book of previous musicans, popstars who'd stayed there! All members of the staff were helpful and friendly. We stayed in Room 130, it wasa good size, an internal room, with one window overlooking a rooftop - we slept well! My daughter shared the room, but essentially had her own annex. We booked 21 days in advance on the dutch website Hotels.nl and got a really good deal. The two nights for the three of us cost about 250 euro incl. taxes. In Leidesplein, there are two streets with lots of restaurants and pubs, We went to a dutch restaurant "Stoop Stoop" excellent food! It is possible to sit outside in the square. Also there was a pan cake house across the street - which was wonderful for breakfast! The trams stop right outside the hotel. We bought a "strippenkart" in the newagents -there is a little machine in the tram to stick the ticket into! The Hotel is near Vondel Park, the Van Gogh museum and Rijksmuseum - a ten minute walk. Also, outside the door of the hotel is the Canal Cruise boats. You can hop on and off at various attractions! We went to see the Anne Frank house. This was a high priority for us and my daughter as she's reade various editions of Ann's diary. The queque moved quickly. It was at times a bit overwhelming for my daughter but she found it inspiring. It is easy to travel on the train from the airport to Central Station and get Tram No 5 outside the station. The airport bus also stops outside the hotel. Schipol is an easy airport to get around. However give yourself time at the boarding gates because full sceening and xraying of bags take place as you queque to get on your plane. Also, buy souvenirs in Amsterdam, everthing seems at least a third more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location & Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ScotsGlobeTrotters
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as birthday present for my boyfriend and could not have been more pleased! Its a beautiful hotel with lots of history, but better than that the price was fantastic. Shop around as we got a great deal compared to many other sites (soz I can't remember what one) and I also booked months in advance. The staff are lovely and the rooms are great, just a god size for city trip of a few days.....plus its all true ..... these beds are amazing!!!!! If we'd fallen out we'd have thought we were sleeping in different rooms !!! Had a great time over there and although its a "once done can't say we'd be back in a huge rush" place to visit, I'd stay at this brand of hotel again based on this experience. Best location as its in the middle of every major sight seeing landmark and a good distance from all the best bars, restaurants and cafes. Can't recommend more :-) !!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of Amsterdam....”
Reviews.Author: parkydj
Reviews.Content: Great location, great room, great hotel, great service, great staff. Superb!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location... No complaints”
Reviews.Author: RickStevesJunior
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice so far. Perfect location for all things tourist; located nicely between central walking areas and museum/park district. They accidentially checked us into an occupied room and before we even had time to complain they upgraded us to a nicer room. The rooms are not extravagant, but are still upscale. Because it's an older hotel, the rooms are unique and not a typical hotel box-type room (although the one they accidentally double-booked us in did look more like a standard crappy room). The windows in the rooms have great noise-proofing from outside noise; both times we have stayed with views over the leidseplein, more or less, and when you shut the windows all of the noise disappears. The hotel bar and cafe are actually both tourist attractions in their own right, so it's nice to have them close. The bar is particularly nice at night when the weather is warm enough to open the windows and put out the outside chairs. Whenever I go back to Amsterdam, I am going to stay here again, as there's no need to fix it if it ain't broke.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT deal and nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ynotUsa
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff and clean well located hotel. Nice restaurant as well. Definitely should be on the short list for A'dam hotel value.

Reviews.Title: “Great outside & location, a few problems inside...”
Reviews.Author: Martymiami
Reviews.Content: I am curently in the hotel now (Room 429) which, admittedly, was an Internet special single room. The furnishings are lovely and while the room is smallish it is OK (other reviewers have hit on the need to ask for for an outside room - a balcony would have been heaven). My biggest disappointment is the 1 hour + I spent upon arrival with computer tech supprt trying to get my laptop to work in the room. All to no avail. Come to find out, the hotel only has wireless in the lobby - which is where I am sitting now writing this review. Argh! There is dial up in the room, but the cable hookup in 429 seems not to work (several lights don't work either) - what century are we in, anyway?? I have wireless hotel room connections in Haiti (!), why not Amsterdam?? When I complained, the front desk put me on to the Internet provider - a bit of a cop out for a 4-star hotel. The cable TV "bouquet" is also a bit odd - for the "American Hotel" there is no CNN (and very little English news), but lots of US sitcomes with Jennifer Aniston as a (seeming) teenager - what's with that?. I think next time I am going accross the street to the vanilla Marriott (going to check them out right now, while I think of it), although I love Art Noveau and Art Deco. Disappointed in Amsterdam. Marty Mueller

Reviews.Title: “A great place in the great area”
Reviews.Author: FinlandFinn
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in Amsteradm American hotel. Hotel was very nice and beautiful. Room was spacious. And the surrounding is the one of the best in Amsterdam. Previously i have had accomodation in the other areas in Amsterdam. In the future, this is the area I would like to stay in Amsterdam. Only negative thing was the cleaning of the rooms. In this hotel is strictly forbidden to smoke hash and we don't do drugs. Anyway, we found a small amount of marijuana from our room.... But anyway, hotel and it's location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - central location without being too loud”
Reviews.Author: TurquesaTrippers
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights. It was a perfect base for exploring the city from. The rooms were spacious and clean with a huge bed. The stain glass windows and fountain outside the hotel add a bit of intreague and beauty. The outdoor bar is pleasant to have an evening drink in. We would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay to when visiting Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Fanc
Reviews.Content: Incredible location in the heart of Amsterdam Centre on the canal. We were on a 2 week car trip through Europe and only stayed in Amsterdam for 24 hours. The hotel was amazing lovely, the bar incrediblely beautiful and the service top notch! The location was best of all! Our room was oversized, spotless and beautifully decorated AND the view of the canal from our window was spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Old Style Charm”
Reviews.Author: Outbound09
Reviews.Content: A stay in this unique hotel is like a trip back in time. It is an Amersterdam landmark and perfectly located for all your sightseeing needs. The front desk was extremely helpful, service in the elegant bar/restaurant was attentive and friendly, and consequently I hated to leave. My room was huge and the single air conditioner vent barely cooled the room, but I got it as an accomodation. After a long flight arriving early in the morning, I begged for an early room check-in and was switched to the only one available. I needed a shower and rest so bad I can hardly hold that against the hotel for their kindness! I can't wait to go back and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: skflowers
Reviews.Content: Service was great, hotel and room were very clean and staff helpful. Centrally located and in the thick of the nightlife of the Leideseplein. Our room was a nice size and overlooked the canal. Even though there was always so much going on in the street below, the windows blocked out most, if not all, of the sound. We were welcomed to our room with a letter from the hotel manager which included a voucher for a complimentary drink at the hotel bar and/or restaurant to be used at any time during the time of our stay. We are definitely going back to Amsterdam and will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort +”
Reviews.Author: djvmax
Reviews.Content: Their beds are THE most comfortable beds we've ever slept in. Location is excellent...close to everything without being noisy. Service was good. Nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sidhartha
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the American for 4 nights and was very happy. Good location, nice rooms, great dinning options and attentive staff. The hotel is very cool from an architectural standpoint and sits on the southern edge of the Liedesplien- with a nice fountain in front. It is definitely the more upscale side of the square and is very pretty while offering great people watching from the outdoor cafe. And it is close to everything- Melkweg and theaters, restaurants, Bulldog, canal boat dock steps away, Museums, trolley stop,etc. I think I paid for the deluxe vs the standard room- and it was great- on the 5th floor with a little balcony overlooking the square. The breakfast was in the amazing dinning room but in good weather all other meals are outside at cafe American. Breakfast was a big spread of self serve which I frankly prefer to ala cart, coffee and tea brought by a waiter. But the cafe has waiters and such. And as an American you do have to remember to slow down a bit when at the cafe- the point is to milk it. So if it takes a while for the guy to come take your order, don't fret. If you want quick- go across the square to McD's. Found the staff helpful, courteous and attractive. Very used to storing bags and helping out. A few hints for travelers: 1. You enter the trams on the second to last car- there is a conductor sitting in a little booth there- you buy and validate your tickets there. 2. Bikes rule here. They are the top of the food chain. They will run you down- always be aware of your place on the street- do not stand in the bike lane. You might think it is a sidewalk- it isn't. But cars and trams will go out of their way to brake for you and expect you to take the initiative and right of way. 3. If you have done some urban biking- rent a bike. If not- stick to canal boats and walking - maybe ease into it with a guided tour. Biking is a fantastic way to see the city- especially the edges- zoo, museums, Pijps, Jordann, etc. Would avoid the Centre. Hope that helps.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Europe”
Reviews.Author: caonima1
Reviews.Content: Eden American Hotel is the best hotel we stayed in Europ so far. The room is huge (twice or maybe thrice the size of the Grange Hotel room we had in London), the king size bed is very confortable. Everything is large even by American standard. All staff are really friendly and helpful. Especially Danny, he's the best staff we encountered so far. Well, all Amsterdam residents we met are very nice, so maybe he's not that exception. We 1000% recommend this hotel and thank Danny very much. Walking back from red light district to the hotel at midnight is extremely safe. Tons of people still hangout in the plein, the atmosphere is wonderful. Our best European experience ever.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, elegant hotel in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: danifornian
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel thanks to Trip Advisor reviews and am pleased to say we weren't disappointed. That I also got a deal on the rooms at the height of the tourist season didn't hurt either! The hotel is elegant, situated on the banks of a canal (of course!) and right in the heart of the city. Rooms (and bathroom) were beautifully and modernly decorated, clean as a whistle, and spacious, all things considered. We travelled with my parents, who got upgraded to a room with a balcony overlooking the fountain out front - lucky! Their room was also slightly larger than ours, but over all, the same style and amenities. Nearby are tens of restaurants and you're within walking distance of the museum district, so handy location.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: SarahJV63
Reviews.Content: I am so angry at people who leave reviews saying that the hotel rooms are tiny. What do you expect? This is an amazing bright and luxurious hotel but please dont forget it was built over 100 years ago and is a "canal" hotel, the rooms are smaller compared to anywhere else in Europe purely for this reason...you try finding anywhere a lovely as this with larger rooms!! We booked and paid for up from (incurring a large discount) for a deluxe room, and that is exactly what we got, large room with balcony overlooking the canal, good sized clean bathroom, tea/coffee facilites and a wide screen tv. The room was cleaned everyday an the staff could not have been more welcoming and helpful. The location is fantastic, you can walk into the centre of buslting Amsterdam or out to the outskirts maybe through the Vondel Park which is beautiful. The canal boat stop is right outside the entrance to the hotel and is very convenient. Breakfast is charged at 19 Euros per person but as a hotel guest charged at 17 Euros - this is expensive and why we chose not not eat at the hotel - there are loads and load of places to choose from within a very close walking distance of the hotel for breakfast, including a cafe in the park which we frequented. We had a brilliant tim in Amsterdam, and visited most of its attractions except the ReikMuseum which unfortunatlely was closed for reconstruction during our stay. We wouldnt hesitate in recommending this hotel to anyone considering staying here and really cant understand why so many people have cause to complain!! Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoA_in_Atlanta
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel facing a lovely section of the canal and a park. Right on the tram line but also walking distance to most of the major sights. Rooms are nicely appointed and well maintained, though somewhat small by U.S. standards. Fine for 2 people, especially if you're not planning to spend a lot of waking hours in your room. The bed was very comfy. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our only complaint was that internet access was about double what you would pay for hotel internet in the U.S., but that seemed to be the case at every hotel we checked (coffee shops are not as convenient or pleasant, but internet access is much more affordable). If you're a light sleeper, ask for a canal side room -- you'll be less bothered by the noise of the tram going by at night.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the action!”
Reviews.Author: bainso
Reviews.Content: We arrived early & tired from the U.S. None of the "Classic" (Standard rooms) were ready. The woman at the desk offered to get a Deluxe room overlooking the canal ready for us for a special rate of 30e a night extra. I asked to see both rooms so that we could decide if it was worth it to us. The "Classic" room was small, but perfectly fine...the Deluxe room was huge with a large bed, plenty of storage, 2 stuffed wing-back chairs with small table in between, large desk & a flat-screen TV atop a dresser with several drawers...a sewing kit & a shoe mitt was in one of the drawers. The view was of the Ticket booth & the canal where canal tours start from. The bathroom was not huge, but there was enough room for all our toiletries. Since we were celebrating a birthday, we decided to splurge on the Deluxe room. There was an iron/board & an electric pot for instant coffee or tea. There is an in-room safe & a minibar. There was ice available on the floor above. They provide 1 robe & 1 pair of nice slippers. The towels were large & thick, but if you want face cloths you may have to ask for them. They do not provide small bottles of shampoo...there is a plastic container attached to the wall that you have to push to get the shampoo to come out. They do provide 2 small bars of soap & some lotion. The rooms were very clean. I did not like the hair dryer! We did not eat in any of the hotel restaurants, but the small cafe & the outdoor seating with a view of the large fountain in front of the hotel was always busy. The hotel is convenient to a lot of sights...The Rijksmuseum, the Van Gogh Museum, Vondelpark & the hotel is just steps away from the Leidesplein...a lively square with tons of cafes where you can sit outside & people watch, there are all types of restaurants & a parade of street performers. We liked Ristorante Peppino..we had the veal & eggplant dish...we also liked the Satellite Sports Cafe..bottle of Bud 3,90e. We were warned strongly at reception when we were leaving for the airport that the Connexxion Shuttle was unreliable, but we had paid 45e R/T for 2 people so were worried that they would not come to take us to the airport...well, we were surprised that instead of a shuttle, they sent a private car to whisk us to Schiphol. If you do use this service pay by credit card just in case. Try the trams...it will save you a lot of walking & tired feet. You can buy a strip of tickets at any Tobacco shop. Watch out for the many bikes & trams when crossing the streets. Have a safe & fun trip. I don't think you will be disappointed if you pick this beautiful hotel...enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: phdhonda
Reviews.Content: The hotel is both modern and historical located at one block of Leidseplan. I booked two rooms facing the canal for they don't have a quadruple and they upgraded us for free to rooms with balcony. The #408 is bigger (the other was #410), with two couchs but both have king size beds (very soft). Breakfast is expensive, even if you accept the "offer": 17 euros/person (regular price: 19 euros). There's no parking (you can park for free at white dotted places at the street between 11pm and 9 am) and the internet is very expensive: 0,35 euro cents/minute.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to explore Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneLeapy
Reviews.Content: My teenaged daughter and I spent 4 days at this hotel in July. The location is perfect for access to most of the tramlines throughout Amsterdam, and most tourists sites are within walking distance. The hotel is surrounded by restaurants and the concierge made some great recommendations that were all within a couple of minutes walk. Boom Chicago is on the next block and the area is alive with local color. We booked directly with the hotel and managed to get a great deal on the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Went out of their way to help”
Reviews.Author: M2K_and_DK
Reviews.Content: We found the American (Eden) Hotel perfect for our stay in Amsterdam. The location was ideal for seeing the Museums and was directly on a canal. We arrived early and we were able to check our bags so that we could explore until our check-in time. All staff were extremely helpful. They even supplied us with a map and list of popular things to do. Our room was comfortable. We didn't have a stunning view, but only paid 94 Euros (great deal) for the night. We had to leave early in the morning before they had opened their dining room and they actually got us coffee even though they weren't ready (it was really good too). We would stay here again for the location, comfort, and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Capri54
Reviews.Content: The best hotel I have ever stayed at in Amsterdam. Friendly helpful staff. Excellent room overlooking a canal with decent bed . Despite the location suprisingly quiet. Breakfast exceptional including bucks fizz and a cooked breakfast with all the trimmings. Would not stay anywhere else. Convenient for Schipol - the bus stops almost outside the front door.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Amsterdam - BAR NONE”
Reviews.Author: redwood_studio
Reviews.Content: This is a true gem and I rank it better than the 5 star we stayed at in the Amsterdam City Center. We stayed in Amsterdam for four nights. Our last night we decided to stay in the Leidseplein area which was amazing. Room 411 was amazing with a balcony facing the canal, the room was big and the bathroom was also big. The staff were very friendly and you can also rent scooters right from the hotel. Tram 1,2,5 take you right downtown if you want to do the tourist thing around the city center ie. Red Light District. The hotel is only a 10 minute walk if that to the Van Gogh museum This hotel is only 1 block away from the main Leidseplein square. We wish we would have spend our entire four nights here but unfortunately we spend our first three nights at the 5 star "Kras..." right in the city center, that one was more like a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MonicaCyprus
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights (24-28/5/2009). The biggest asset of this hotel it is it's location. The rooms are ok and in my case the bathroom was the smallest bathroom I have ever seen. The staff is very helpfull and polite in the whole hotel, the food is good and restaurant is a landmark from the 20's. Internet connection is very expensive and in my opinion a 5* hotel should have wi-fi for it's guests. An good overall experience, mainly based on the location and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “A four star hotel deserved in service, responsive and helpful front desk staffers, and service that is instantaneous!”
Reviews.Author: prosyad
Reviews.Content: This is a great location hotel, away from the noise of the Grand Central Station, and next to all the spots you want to visit. It is just a tram away from the Central Train Station. But, the best part of this hotel is their friendliness, a genuine presence that the Dutch folks want to really invite you to this fine city. They manifest it in their bellhop service, I called in five seconds, they were in our room. No, I am not exaggerating, as I hanged up the phone, the knock on the door is heard. It was the bellman. When we needed referral to a good Indonesian restaurant, they gave us precise directions and they gave us a good referral. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was clean but, of course, since this is Amsterdam, space is a premium. Even for an American hotel, it felt so cramped, yet, I would probably be told, this is already spacious by Dutch standards. This hotel is worth every penny you pay them, they return to you in terms of four star service. Internet is easy to do, but expensive euros.., my only complaint. And breakfast is great, a buffet that is well chosen and more generous even by French standards, it was the best breakfast I have had in Europe. Quite satisfying for an American used to hefty portions! But perhaps overwhelming for a French appetite

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Lynn2Manchester
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Edan American on the 15th May 09. We were in Amsterdam for my friends Hen Do there were 10 of us in total. The hotel was perfectly located just off Leidsplein Square where there are lots of bars. The hotel is just near a tram stop which makes anywhere in the city easy to get to. The Hotel itself we found to be excellent the staff could not do enough to help!! We stayed in a lovely refurbed room on the 3rd floor with a balcony - it was lovely. The rest of the party stayed in the rooms still waiting to be updated but they found them to be of a good standard with plenty of room. I would recommend this hotel to others especially for the sevice and the location.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel lovely city”
Reviews.Author: Wendy03
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel American for 3 nights.Room was very comfortable,bed was huge,as was the bathroom.The location of the hotel is excellent , we were able to walk to all the main sites.The only down point was the cost of the breakfast,19.95euros,we did not have it and went every day to The Sports bar in the square. If we come to Amsterdam again I would stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: wehavethetravelbug
Reviews.Content: This is such a great hotel in an excellent location! After reading some great reviews about this hotel I booked it for our euro vacation and was so pleased!!! I took the advice of one reviewer who suggested contacting the hotel and asking for a room with a canal view or street view and I am so glad I did because we were given a room with an incredible panoramic view of the street and outside water fountain and it was so nice!!! Its in a heavily touristic area which is so perfect because tram #5 is literally outside of the hotel and EVERYTHING is within walking distance. I loved every second of amsterdam because we were situated perfectly and the hotel lived up to its standards. The only little incident we had was at breakfast one morning where we went to get some eggs and the eggs were so over cooked we couldnt eat them. The Maitre D promptly had the eggs replenished and did not charge us for breakfast that morning. I'm sorry, but thats good service if you ask me. And nobody gave us a hard time about it for 1 second! :) I will definitely come back to this hotel! You will be so pleased with its location and pretty decent sized room & bathroom for a european hotel! FYI - they have wifi for a fee and its not worth ordering room service with so much to choose from walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms & no english tv”
Reviews.Author: airlandsee
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from spending five nights in this hotel. The location is convenient. But, the room was extremely small. The walls needed a paint touch up. The room definitely would not merit 5 stars at home in the USA. Maybe 3 stars. The front desk was nice and helpful. They let us check in at 9am. Downside, there was no news on the tv in English. No CNN international. Covers on the king bed were strange. 2 twin quilts. Paid wi-fi only. Nice hot water in showers. Room had hair dryer but no bath robes as advertised. Close to the museums.

Reviews.Title: “We look forward to visiting this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: BGS53
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with everything about this hotel...the staff, the room, the view over the canal, the location,the design & decor. After a long trip, it was the perfect place for our introduction to this great city and we look forward to the day we can stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL - WORST EXPERIENCE EVER - PREPAID ROOMS WERE UNAVAILABLE”
Reviews.Author: jt1975sf
Reviews.Content: My family and I attempted to stay at the Amsterdam American Hotel in November 2008, having chosen the hotel due to its location at the Leidesplein and proximity to the Rijksmuseum. We prepaid for two rooms to get the discounted rate, made special arrangements for early morning arrival (our flight from Africa arrived at Schiphol at 06:00), and reconfirmed our early arrival by email two days before. Yet when we arrived, our rooms were unavailable. We were told that even though we had PREPAID and were PROMISED early arrival, the hotel was booked and NO ROOM would be available until 15:00 at the earliest. Even though the hotel FAILED to provide rooms as promised, the front desk staff REFUSED to refund our money. We asked to speak with a manager and none was in the hotel. We were forced to go across the square and stay at a Marriott. What's worse is that when we returned to our home in California, we disputed the prepaid room charges with our credit card company. The hotel fought the back-charge for six months and FABRICATED completely UNTRUE statements - notably, an assistant named Annemarie made the FALSE statement that we were offered a "more luxurious" room and that it was our choice to cancel our reservation. I do not recommend this hotel, and as a matter of principle, would not consider staying at any Eden City Hotels hotel due to this unconscionable treatment. To date, the hotel still has not refunded nearly $500 for prepaid rooms that it never made available to us. John H. San Francisco, CA USA

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: sb254
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights in Amsterdam at the American Hotel. My husband and I had one room- our two children 20 and 22 had another. Can't say enough nice things about the hotel. Lots of character, the dining room is beautiful. Rooms are large for a European hotel - ours had beautiful stained glass windows.The location is great - we were able to walk everywhere and lots to do for the kids at night after us old folks turned in. Yes, you may hear the tram at night or some of the lively activity outside, but it was worth it to be in one of the best parts of the city right on a canal and in a busy square. Breakfast came with our room fee - a wonderful buffet each morning with a chef ready to fry eggs or make us an omelet or waffle. The hotel is has all modern amenities, but retains the charm and elegance of a 100+ year old facility. I would definitely stay here again. Not cheap, but what hotel in a city is these days? Breakfast included helped - otherwise would have been 19.50 euros each, so it made a difference. We just stayed in three nice hotels in Europe and this one was the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mackemmaddy
Reviews.Content: We were booked into another hotel in the city but when they could not accommodate us we were transferred to the American. We found it very easily as it is right in the square and has some unmissable fountains outside. The location was great as shops, cafe's and bars were all really close. Also there is a canal cruise departing from right outside. We were treated very well on arrival. The staff were polite and helpful. The rooms were lovely and spacious with huge beds, although the views from our windows weren't great. We had a wonderful stay in Amsterdam thanks to this great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A little mouse with clogs on, well I declare!”
Reviews.Author: CamberleyNel
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms and requested that they be close together and that is exactly what we got. Our daughter's was small but with a lovely balcony overlooking the fountains in the square; she loved it. Ours was small, dark and with windows so high up the wall I could not reach to open or see out of them. They faced 3 concrete walls around some sort of inner space about the size of our room. Our room had space for one person to access either side of the very comfortable and large bed and one person between the end of the bed and the dresser. The door to the bathroom could not be opened at the same time as the wardrobe, or the main door. To put the suitcase away in the bottom of the wardrobe required a high degree of logic. Yet the wardrobe was spacious with an ironing board and iron. The room was so dark, I lost a pair of black socks, only finding them when packing on the last day. In the bathroom, I could not stretch my arms out fully when towelling my back (I am just over 5 feet tall with arms in proportion), but that didn't really matter since despite daily requests for bath towels, we only received them on our third night. On our first night, we were told that they had run out of them! Good shower and the lighting was good in here. Breakfast was very expensive but there was a good range; the few waiters employed in the morning worked hard keeping tables cleared and coffee served. I did not like the fact that tourists were allowed in, by a manager, to take photos of the salon while guests were eating breakfast - very intrusive. Generally all staff were very friendly and helpful, but then we found ourselves commenting that nearly everyone we spoke to on our trip was just so. The restaurant dinner menu did nothing to attract our custom; the bar however was a really great place to sit and people watch, until, on our last evening there, I spotted a mouse (with or without clogs on) running about. When I pointed this out to the barman, (as I am slightly hysterical at the sight of such things), he simply stated that they always have them! Although we had secured a good price of 95 Euros per night per room, the descriptions led us to expect bathrobes and elegance; we got basic. However it is a beautiful hotel in a prime location with excellent staff; and when we commented on the room at check-out, they agreed with us - 329 is a very disappointing room. Insist on a canal or fountain view when booking. And take your own mousetrap!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, friendly staff, right on a canal.”
Reviews.Author: TinaNYC
Reviews.Content: Things I liked about this hotel: you could see the red American Hotel sign from far away, it was nice to see it pop into view when I was tired. Beautiful art deco architecture. Very clean room, comfortable bed. Hotel right on the Singel Canal. I lucked out with a canal view room and I drank coffee in the morning watching the tour boats pull up below. There is a park bench right there outside the hotel, on the canal, for you to just sit and people watch. (or have that smoke that you are not allowed to have in the room). Tram stop right across the street. Walking distance to all the museums, to everything really, if you like to walk. Don't bother with the breakfast, too expensive for a tired hotel buffet, instead, walk around the corner to the Pancake House. Cheaper, hotter, more tasty. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Totally unpredictable”
Reviews.Author: AntBeez
Reviews.Content: I have been a guest at the American Hotel at least 8 times since 1992. Each time was different. I've had rooms canal side, once a room fronting the square on an upper floor with a tiny balcony. Amsterdam is typically my point of arrival, so having a nice room in a great location is a wonderful way to begin a trip. My issue with this hotel is that it has changed ownership several times and management/housekeeping /.food & bar are extremely inconsistent. Sometimes it is spotless, sometimes not. Typically the breakfast buffet is fabulous, however, at the cost per person it should be. When it is off, it is OFF. The Night Watch is always a great spot for a drink, coming in or going out. My last visit may well be my last. After a transatlantic flight, checked in, had a great walk, blah, blah, blah. Tried to adjust the body clock, went to bed fairly early (before 10 pm). Woke to the sound of television, loud talking. Eventually called the desk to complain(like at 1:30 a.m., 3:30 a.m. and 5:00 a.m.) Drunken stoned thugs/soccer fans, 4 of them, evidently did not sleep the entire night. Nor did I. I regret being civil at the desk, did not want to be an "Ugly American" at the American. The very young lady in charge could have absolutely cared less. I told her that I had been a frequent guest, wanted to be changed to the room which I had requested, etc. Made it abundantly clear that the guests in the room next door had been HORRIBLE. (Thugs checked out, so desk declined to move us). With great pain they reluctantly comped our breakfast. I felt sick from jet lag/lack of sleep for what was basically two days, not to mention that for a tiny room, on the tram side could have just as well stayed at a Vondel Park hostel. Yes, it is a beautiful building. Stunning light fixtures. Some of the rooms are very nice. Sometimes staff are courteous and responsive to requests: extra towels/pillows. They do a great job on issues related to ordering cabs, storing luggage, etc. I have had many fabulous days and nights at the American, however, next trip will try the Park, or go back to the Pulitizer or Marriot. I love, love, love the location, but at this stage of life do not care to gamble on a good nights sleep, particularly at that cost per night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all ways!”
Reviews.Author: travelbuddies39
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel twice in February as a stop-over enroute to/from Africa. Service was excellent, particularly at the front desk and in the restaurant. We had asked for a quiet room, and although they couldn't guarantee it on reservation, we were given the best possible rooms (top floor, canal/quiet side, as far away from the main streets as possible). Paid for an upgrade to a suite on the return so that we could get into a room in the very early morning. Quick walk to Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum, Flower Market, shopping.... Didn't have breakfast in hotel; found the Satellite Sports Cafe around the corner (near Burger King) and it was a gem. Got a good rate off the web by booking and paying well in advance (no changes/refunds). Would definitely try to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Itsawideworld
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because I had a 19 hour stop over en route to India where was going to spend three weeks staying in $7 a night hotels. I managed to find a room at the Amsterdam American for $150 Canadian per night and I was not disappointed. I love heritage hotels and this place was beautiful. My room was not very big but it had a comfortable queen size bed and a very large well appointed bathroom. I was glad I had done a lot of research because the hotel was in a great neighbourhood and the building was gorgeous both inside and out so my few hours in Amsterdam made a lasting impression on me. The hotel is right on a bus route to the airport so it is a great alternative to airport hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a fab location”
Reviews.Author: IshIshBaby
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the American whilst on a Hen Weekend. The hotel was in a fab location, rooms were a good size and everything was on the doorstep from Restaurants, Canal Cruises, Pubs, Bars, etc. A perfect base from which to explore Amsterdam and all its offerings. Would defo recommend for groups of friends, couples or families.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but very convenient”
Reviews.Author: AusUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the American hotel on a Saturday night in December 08, and generally had a good experience. I arrived to complete chaos, with a very large tour group of teenagers tearing up the reception, but once I battled through to check in, it was fine. The room was a generous size, and very clean. The tv had a couple of English language channels, which is helpful. The only thing I would say is that the room service was very expensive for what it was, and on top of the prices, you had to add â‚¬3.50 each time you wanted something delivered, and at â‚¬4.50 for just a coffee or â‚¬4.00 for a juice or can of coke, this can really add up. Amsterdam in general is very expensive (or at least the places I went seemed to be) so maybe this is normal. The staff were really helpful and friendly and the location was perfect for exploring!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: BraddyBarcelona
Reviews.Content: I cannot understand why some reviews are mixed about this hotel. In my opinion it is one of the best in Amsterdam. The location is unbeatable, with absolutely everything on the hotel doorstep. The rooms are great, well furnished, a good size, comfortable and decently heated/cooled. The bars and restaurants are institutions in Amsterdam, and you can easily rub shoulders with celebraties and VIPÂ´s. If you book 21 days in advance, or even up to 7 days in advance, you can get really very good rates. In fact, on my last trip I just walked in and asked for the best price, and got a really good rate there and then. All in all very good indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and great location”
Reviews.Author: KimberlyAtlantaGA
Reviews.Content: Husband and I traveled to Amsterdam for the first time in late November, 2008. We booked the Amsterdam American for all but our last night. I enjoyed it very much. We arrived at 11am, several hours before checkin time, but we were checked in right away. The houseman gave us a little tourist guide and street map and helped with our bags. Everyone at the front desk was helpful and pleasant during our stay. I had read the rooms were tiny, but I found ours comfortable. All the furniture was in good shape and the bathroom was great. The bed was a true American king size and very comfy. The shower was lovely (though the shower curtain let too much water through and flooded the floor every day). The hair dryer was a little weak, but it worked. The shampoo, shower gel and soap were replenished every day, and were good quality. The room had coffee and tea making supplies, but we did not sample them. Signs asked us not to use the minibar fridge for our own items, which I found a little annoying. There were plenty of electrical sockets in the room for charging our electronics and such. And housekeeping made the room up nicely every day and were very respectful of the 'do not disturb' sign. Our view was to the back of another wing of the hotel, but the large windows opened fully and allowed plenty of light. Good quality drapes blocked all light at night, and double-glazing kept out drafts and street noise. The hotel is right on Leidseplein and at the corner of multiple tram stops, which made this an excellent location. We ate at restaurants on Leidseplein every night and took the trams to visit museums and other attractions. Very convenient. We stayed over a weekend and into the next week. The weekend nights are party central on Leidseplein, and the crowds of drunk, stoned, and silly young people did get tiresome. But that's certainly no fault of the hotel's! We did not eat at the hotel. Breakfast was priced too high, and the fine dining in the restaurant was out of our budget. On our last day we were changing hotels to stay near the airport for a very early flight. We checked out at 11am, but the American hotel cheerfully stored our bags for the entire day. When we came back for the bags in the evening, they called a cab for us to take us to the airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “stunning stay”
Reviews.Author: Flipautum
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights through on business. The hotel was fully booked while we were there but it never seemed full. The reception staff were great with lots of advise on tours and places to go. Right outside there is a tram stop so this was great at night coming back down after being out for the evening. The bedroom was a little small but as I was on my own not an issue. The room faced out onto the square and had a lovely little balcony. The room itself was decorated very well and I was really pleased with it.flat screen tv etc, bathroom nice if small all very clean. The downside was that the lift was broken down a lot during my stay, and I was in a room near the stairs so could be nosiy at times. This is an old hotel, and there was noise from rooms above with creaking floors etc which was only a problem as I was getting up early. The diningroom is stunning and a must visit in Amsterdam, service was first class and buffet breakfast had a wide range, with tea coffee etc being ordered at the table. All in all I really enjoyed my stay in the hotel and would recommend to others as a cut above in amsterdam to locate yourself in for a business or leisure trip.

Reviews.Title: “Back to The American, which meant returning to the best bar in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: SophieCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Despite a mess-up with the hotel reservation system overbooking the rooms, I had to stay in the nearby Park hotel for the first night of my recent stay in Amsterdam instead of The American, where I've stayed several times before over the last 15 years. I'd never experienced any problems with booking a room in this hotel before, so it came as a shock. As it was entirely the hotel's computer system fault for the confusion, they made up for it all by offereing me a suite instead of the usual standard single room I'd originally booked and I was also offered complimentary breakfast! (usually an extra 19.95Euros), so the confustion actually worked out for the best and I ended up having one of the best stays I've ever had in Amsterdam! The suites are on the hotel's 1st floor and are very comfortable and spacious. Toothbrushes, razors, slippers and all necessary toiletries are already there in the bathroom, so it's not even necessary to bring them packed, as the hotel provide them free of charge. The one main reason why I always choose to stay in The American while in Amsterdam is because I have a lot of fond memories of socialising in the famous Bar American, plus the cocktails here are delicious and at 9Euros each, that is not all that expensive compared to the ridiculous prices we are charged for good cocktails at trendy bars in London. The drinks were as tasty as always, however, I was very disappointed with the food menu this time, 14Euros for a Caesar salad was too much for what it was. The bar itself has undergone a few changes over the years, but still remains the popular rock 'n' roll style hangout it's known for. I go to see bands at the local Melkweg music venue, which is just across the road at the back of the hotel and the Paradiso, another popular live music venue and club is just a stroll away. The Leidseplein area is always buzzing and the trams stop just across the road from the hotel. There is no spa, but luckily there is a very private sauna and gym on the lower ground floor which only guests can access by keycard.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, sadly flawed”
Reviews.Author: Hibit
Reviews.Content: I could not recommend staying at this hotel until the road / building works outside the hotel are complete. Check before booking. Its a shame because the hotel itself is impressive in itself and in its location and its clear that the staff are dedicated and diligent.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and great location”
Reviews.Author: LeedsUK1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days over christmas 2007 and had an excellent time, we are 2 couples aged between 25 and 32. Me and my partner have stayed here on a few occasions during the last 4 years and the place just gets nicer. The location is great in a nice more upmarket area of amsterdam close to good restaurants, shops, museums etc, the rooms we have had have been lovely art decor style and spacious, we had a lovely view of the canal this time, but on one visit we had a view of the courtyard which we are not bothered about but if you want to guarantee a good view it might be worth pre booking a canal view room. The bathroom was quiet luxurious with nice toiletries topped up daily and kept spotless. The beds are comfy i think we have always had a super kingsize and the bedding and towels are always changed regularly, you also get robes and slippers. The staff are pleasent and attentative and the public areas of the hotel are kept very well. The restaurant is very nice although pricey it is worth it and the bar has a great atmosphere. We will stay here again and i would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joburg74
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect and close to everything you might want to visit. We were given a beautiful canal view room on the top floor which had an amazing view and a small balcony. The room had a lot of natural light and was very clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. We weren't charged for our late check-out which was also very nice. Although breakfast was very expensive, just the experience of eating in that grand old cafe Americain was worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Spilson
Reviews.Content: Situated in a very central location, the hotel was perfect for heading into town and enjoying the canals. The staff were lovely, and the hotel itself was very attractive and clean. On the downside: Our room was tiny with a miniscule window which looked out onto a concrete block- we had no natural light at all! The hotel has no parking, and the cheapest parking was 40 euros per day. The food at the hotel was average, and there was a (very cute) mouse in the restuarant. Breakfast was 20 euros per person. Although we had a room on the lower end of the price spectrum, one night there was a VERY loud party in the hotel bar, right below our room. The staff very kindly relocated us to the deluxe room. This was expectedly more attractive than our room, with a large window, but felt very bare and not very well decorated. All in all, we were rather dissapointed with the hotel, as from its pictures it looks as if it would be fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gianni70
Reviews.Content: It's a very good hotel, really well located: 10 minutes walk from the two Amsterdam's main museums (Van Gogh and Rijks) and on the outermost of the city channels (you can reach Dam Place in less than 15 minutes). It's an expensive hotel. We decided not to have breakfast, since they sell it for about 29 euros (close to the hotel there are plenty of bruin cafes where you can have a wonderful breakfast for less than 7 euros). The only negative point: we have chosen this hotel since we meant to travel around Nederland by car, and their website stated "Available parking for guests". They didn't mention that the parking fee is 30 euros for the first day, decreasing by some euros the following days. It's not exactly a bargain...

Reviews.Title: “A gem!”
Reviews.Author: twenty/twenty
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the American Hotel in Amsterdam in August /08 and was thankful that we had booked such a central location. Within walking distance to pretty much everything. Close to the museums as well. Staff were very welcoming and the room was great. The room had a large balcony overlooking the fountain which we could sit out on and enjoy the atmosphere of the square after busy days. Only downside was the noise at times, primarily sirens. The hotel just won an award for 2008 as a top hotel in the area. Part of the Eden Hotel group. I'd recommend you check their website before booking and see if it is the type of hotel for you. No complaints from this end.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay...we will be back...”
Reviews.Author: rodman954
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in great location. Staff is professional and friendly. Room was on the quiet canal side and was quite large and updated. Everything was clean. We had friends staying in a smaller room that opened onto a rooftop deck. While it is a shared deck, it provided a great opportunity to get out into the fresh air right from the room. Breakfast is overpriced, but dinner and cocktails were priced appropriate. Beware of the pricing on their website. Seems their rates change daily (like the airlines, not like other hotels) and they try to lock you into a prepaid rate that may be higher than a last minute rate. You would think that if you book/pay in advance you'd be getting a better rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: TC.BM
Reviews.Content: Emailed the hotel the night before we arrived and asked (if possible) for a view of canal. Arrived and offered an upgrade to a suite for small supplement. We declined and glad didn't spend the extra money. We had room 608 which was large and comfortable, with a small seating area with a view of the canal. A great base for exploring the city. Only small problem, but only one lift goes to the 6th floor! We didn't eat at the hotel, or try the bar, or fitness sauna as didn't get in time for breakfast and were out enjoying the city. Not the kind of trip for the fitness sauna! Can only base the hotel on the staff and our room. The staff were helpful - spoke good English and looked after us really well. Our room was clean and comfortable, with all the facilities needed for a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay at The American Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marybeeeee
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel rather over-priced for what it really was. The bedroom was small with barely enough space to get around the bed. The window opened out onto a roof and I saw a man strolling across it while I was in bed in the morning! Breakfast was an additional â‚¬20pp, in my opinion over priced, and the staff were less than helpful. We also had an evening meal in the dining room but we had to wait almost an hour for it to arrive. We had a second booking for a further two days in this hotel and we could not be accommodated in the same room. So with the hassle of moving rooms, we found we were allocated an even smaller room with a smaller bed! Once we complained enough, they managed to allocate us something more suitable but it was a lot of needless hassle. In saying all that, the location is very central.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lnktvlr
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our week long stay at the American. It can't be beat for location, right on the Leidseplein. We had a room overlooking the canal and it was perfect for us. Big picture windows that opened for a full view and a great breeze. I am sure the rooms vary in quality and size, so it would be to your benefit to book in advance (plus you get a great deal) and ask for a room with a view. Our room was large by Amsterdam standards with a nice sitting area, really comfortable bed, and small but sufficient bathroom. The housekeeping was excellent and if you put your DO NOT DISTURB sign up: they leave you alone. The hotel is booked full in the busy summer months, and as the last reviewer found out, you clearly can get stuck with a less than satisfying result if you don't plan ahead. This was our third time staying at the American, and we wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: sands4
Reviews.Content: The hotel was walkable to most attractions, clean, fairly spacious and we were lucky to get a room that overlooked the canal. Reception staff were very helpful and cheerful and indeed the breakfast staff were too. We ate the first breakfast at the hotel (quite a lot of choice) but there are many small cafes locally that serve a decent breakfast for under 10 Euros which is half the price of the hotel. The only downside was the lighting in the room wasn't really sufficient and there was an overall smell of dusty hoovers but nothing too horrible! I would definitely stay there again - price wise it was much better value than others that we looked at.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: leilac
Reviews.Content: Good location, but our so called luxury room was a converted meeting room with a bed that dropped from a cupboard. The bathroom was too small and it was virtually impossible to get into the shower as you had to jump the toilet. The worst thing was housekeeping banging incessantly on our door at 8.30am on Sunday morning wanting to clean. The room smelled of cigarette smoke as the airconditioning was poor. I raised all these matters with the desk but didn't get the promised response on the day or subsequently.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - quiet but central”
Reviews.Author: Argassi1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well situated. Receptionist and concierge very professional. Room clean and no complaints other than there is insufficient lighting in the entrance to the room, difficult to see into wardrobe or the full length mirror. The room was really quiet. Cocktails at 10 euros each are not cheap, but they were some of the best cocktails we've tasted. Trams 1,2 & 5 are right outside the door and take you to and from Centraal station.You can also do the canal trip right outside the door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, excellent bar”
Reviews.Author: CountyDownChris
Reviews.Content: On arrival at The American they could not find our reservation. We were joining friends who were already checked in and after being told they had lost our booking and the hotel was full we were not very happy. We were booked out to the Park Hotel for the night and promised an upgrade for the following night in the American. True to their word next day we were upgraded to an executive room with balcony overlokking the canal and given a gift by the General Manager. Room was excellent and the view superb. The best bit about the hotel is the American Bar. On a warm spring day there is nowhere better to sit outside with a drink and watch the world go by. The location could not be better being roght on Leidesplien and surrounded by bars & restarants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Visit”
Reviews.Author: andi_wilson
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself enjoyed a 3 night stay at the American Hotel to celebrate our 1st Wedding Anniversary. I can't fault the hotel, service and city itself. We had a really fabulous time. Our room was huge, spotlessly clean and although we didn't dive into the mini bar it was still nice to have. We did not hear ANY noise in the room and the beds were extremely comfortable. We enjoyed several drinks at the Cafe Americain and Bar Americain and the service was wonderful. We ate only once in the restaurant and that was for breakfast. The hot and cold buffet was perfectly acceptable and the surroundings in the dining room are beautiful. We did eat in the Pancake Corner, liteally around the corner, which was a cheap and delicious alternative to paying 19.95 euros each. We had some lovely meals out and about and found the locals very helpful. The transport links from the airport to the hotel are cheap, regular and easy to follow. Altogethr a great time and I will definately be returning to the American Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: jim1664
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend here in august with friends and had a fantastic time. the hotel was a good 4* with decent sized rooms. We had breakfast cocktails outside the hotel and evening drinks in the bar prior to going out and everything was fine although drinks were a little pricey. The hotel is more or less at Leidsplein Sq where there are plenty of bars so the stagger back to the hotel is only a short one. In all a decent hotel for a city break with either friends, someone special or both.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend,if freezing”
Reviews.Author: dizzy007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the American for his 40th Birthday in Jan 08,my sister had stayed here the year before and had recommended it .We were not disappointed .We had a large room overlooking the canal(which I had requested when I booked) with the biggest bed I have ever seen or indeed slept in,the downside of which was that I didnt see hubby for the two nights as he was at the far side of the bed but we both did sleep very well.The staff I found to be helpful,we asked for extra pillows and they were brought straight away,the check in was quick,the Concierge helpful and friendly .The tram is the best way to get around and cheap ,especially from the station to the hotel.We did all the sightseeing Madam Tussaud's , Anna Frank House(huge queue's though) the Flower market and such.There are hundreds of restaurants and bars to choose from ,we ate one night in one of the Gaucho's restaurants ,hope you like steak lol,,The bars around the Leidesplein are hopping ,and theres good food to be had there too,the best of all though has got to be the chips that you buy on the street in the cone shaped paper with any sauce you like on them garlic ,curry, bbq you name it they have it,,yum yum yum,, To end though I must say it was the coldest place I have ever been ,the wind blowing off the canals would skin a cat ,,but I guess it was January

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: nicolep11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a two week honeymoon in Europe and Amsterdam was our middle stop between Ireland and Paris. We had a great time in Amsterdam and thought that the American was a great place to stay. It's in a fantastic location, we came from the airport on the tram, which was totally cheap and even easier to navigate. The tram stops right in front of the hotel, which is super convenient, no taxi is necessary from the train station or the airport. We booked a standard (21 day advance) room which did the trick for us. We were looking for something economical, but a little nice since it was our honeymoon, thank the US dollar! The room was very small compared to what we expect in the US, but it was big enough for us and our stuff, but there was some tripping over suitcases. We actually didn't even manage to make it into the famous Bar American for food or drinks, but it was beautiful and we regret no making it in there. The location is really fantastic, it's walking distance to a lot of things, which was very nice. The main street off the Leidseplein Square is great and has a ton of shops and sweet shops!
