There are a TON of restaurants near the square, too many choices almost. Also, a ton of bars, coffeeshops, cafe's, etc in very close proximity. We took a canal tour with the company "Lovers", which actually isn't just for lovers...The stop is literally right outside the door and a 1 hour tour is only 9 euros, very nice when you are looking to stop walking. Overall, a great city, a fantastic location, great hotel and staff. No english speaking channels on tv but CNN and BBC, but that is only if you need more tv, we didn't watch too much. They brought us a adaptor when we requested one, which was lovely and a much needed touch. Free internet was nice too, always is....

Reviews.Title: “Slow Decline - What happened to the amazing service?”
Reviews.Author: RedGiraffe
Reviews.Content: As a regular visitor to Amsterdam (at least 3 or 4 trips per year) I have been a big fan of this Hotel and have stayed there at least 30 times. This place was previously owned by the Intercontinental Hotel group and later became a 5 star Crowne Plaza owned Hotel. Throughout this time my numerous visits were made very special by the outstanding customer service, the elegant dining, cocktails and champagne breakfasts at the cafe American. There always seemed to be a complimentary bottle of wine or box of goodies waiting for us in our usual suite that we had no problem booking in advance. We even started a tradition celebrating new years at the hotel and my partners birthday. Since the Eden group have taken over the reception staff barely look up from there computer screens let alone provide a civil welcome. Even the staff that remain form years back seem to have a different attitude. Its odd and quite sad. Having said all of that the hotel is beautiful and the suites are reasonably big (note the internal facing standard rooms are not so great). The refurb has panned out really well and the spirit of the Art Deco theme has survived in all it's splendour. If you have never been before you should give it a go in order to decide for yourself. Cafe American is as expensive as ever but it is great to get a table by one of the huge windows and watch the world go by (day or night), Breakfast is adequate and dinner is always a grand occasion. Reservations now also refuse to entertain booking a specific room or even recording a preference of which side of the hotel you would like to stay. On my last visit in January I was overcharged by 600 euro and it took me 3 weeks to sort a refund. No apology was offered. The fire alarm also got triggered at 4am in the morning and could not be switched of for 1 hour despite the hotel staff telling the guests not to leave their rooms. What has been gained by the refurb seems to be lost in the service that really made the American an amazing place to stay. For the first time in over 10 years I have just booked an Amsterdam trip and I will not be staying at the American.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel & great location”
Reviews.Author: RIPScarlett
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just come back from a weekend at the American Hotel and I thought it was a great hotel in a great location. The building is stunning outside and inside. It was nice to be right next to a canal. The room was a good size with very comfy beds and pillows. The shower was lovely too. Got plenty clean towels. The hotel is right next to Leidesplein Square so the location is excellent. The tram from the Central Station stops right across the road from the hotel. There are plenty of bars, restaurants and cafes in the area. The Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum are only a short walk away. We also walked to the Dam Square and Red Light District area but it was a bit of a walk and we did get a bit lost so a tram may be better for this. I had an excellent time and would highly recommend the American hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in fab location”
Reviews.Author: dancelover
Reviews.Content: From the moment we first contacted the American Hotel for rates and availability to the moment we left, myself and 3 friends found this hotel and staff to be first class. Nothing was too much trouble and the rooms were clean and very comfortable. We booked the rooms 4 months in advance and got a twin room for the fantastic rate of Â£90.00 per room. We arrived early on the Saturday morning and the check in was fast and the staff were very friendly. The Concierge was also helpful in locating and booking a restaurant at the last minute. Loved this hotel and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cstmartin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a full service hotel with a beautiful restaurant and an upscale bar. It is located just a few steps from the tram so it is a great location to use as a starting point for canal tours, walking tours, museum visits or for visits to areas outside of Amsterdam. To reach the hotel from Schiphol Airport, take the train to Centraal Station, then hop aboard the 1, 2, or 5 tram to the Leidesplein area and you have arrived. My room was small, but efficient, spotlessly clean and very well serviced.

Reviews.Title: “Would be reluctant to stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Wrynie
Reviews.Content: We were unimpressed with the customer service at this hotel. We presented our credit card upon arrival to pay for our stay, however the hotel's machine wouldnt accept the card. An issue that another couple were having the same time. It turned out there was no problem with my card. I felt that the staff were very unhelpful under the circumstances, and we received no apology for the incident. Also their mini-bar policy wasnt made clear - disturbing or moving an item will incur a charge. Other than that, the hotel was in an excellent location and the room was very comfortable. J & M, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Claudine Y
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Amsterdam on the 26th of December at 6am. By the time we arrived to the hotel it was 7am, the check in time was at 3pm. The guy at the reception desk was so nice to let us do the check in at that time and offered us a complimentary upgrade of our room because we had written an email indicating we were on our honeymoon. The room we got it was nice, spacious and very comfortable. The location is excellet, basically you are in Leidsenplein. The only thing i didnÂ´t like it was the cleanliness because we used some of the spoons they had for the coffee and the spoon was never changed during our two night stay. We requested a knife to cut some charcuterie we bought and in less than 5 minutes the room service brought us the knife. DEFINATELY EXCELLENT SERVICE. WE LOVED THE ATTENTION TO DETAILS LIKE FINDING A PERSONALIZED WELCOME LETTER FROM THE HOTEL. I definately recommend this hotel to anybody who wants to be a block away from the shops, restaurants and clubs.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel , excellent location”
Reviews.Author: celticwarriorCardiff
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is an extremely reasonably priced 4 star hotel . The rooms are a nice size with a great bathroom. The Art deco public rooms are amazing. The hotel is on the canal boat stop so its great for sightseeing. The vtrams also stop right outside. With a few minutes walk there are many pubs , clubs , restraunts and convenience stores

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: busterFlitwick
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel December 24th - December 27th 2007. We had no pre-conceived ideas but hoped it would be good as it was Christmas....... we were not disappointed. The room was immaculately clean ...room house keeping impectable. Staff very friendly and very accomadating to every needs. We needed a cork screw room service brought one for us to keep ... no charge! Staff very friendly. We had a very early start and checked in at noon and were told as our room was ready we could go staight to it which as great. Couldn't recomend this hotel enough we shall certainly return when in Amsterdam next!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fur coat but no knickers”
Reviews.Author: V8_Junkie
Reviews.Content: This a lovely building and a great situation. The architecture is outstanding. Unfortunately though, its all smiles and no content. The Friday evening of our stay was the worst. The dining room downstairs was hosting a party. A band played until 01:30 - not too bad but we were on the first floor and I hate Queen (and Abba)! However, after the band finished and the room cleared, the staff dragged the furniture back in over the wooden floor. It was past four in the morning before I got to sleep. I mentioned this when I checked out but got no satisfaction. Our room was beside a store of some sort - at least we didn't "waste" any of the holiday sleeping late in the morning! Finally - I came home with two nice bite marks as a souvenir of my stay!

Reviews.Title: “very pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: walterlazymouse
Reviews.Content: As we had already booked this hotel I was more than a little worried when I read some of the reviews on this site, I even tryed to cancel our booking but the American Hotel does not do this, so beware..As it turned out this was just as well. The hotel turned out to be really lovely, we upgraded our room to an american duluxe from an american classic so I can only go on this room. We asked for a room with a balcony overlooking the canal if possible and thats what we got, the room had the biggest bed we had ever had in a hotel and the decor was very pleasant, not the biggest room ever but very comfy and cosy. The staff were very friendly and helpful, Cafe America was a joy and if you visit the bar try a sweet candy cocktail, well worth Â£8 euros. We are returning to Amsterdam in Febuary and if we stay in this part of town will certainly be coming back to this hotel, we found none of the negitive things lots of other people found thank goodness and am pleased to recommend this hotel to others, it proved very good value for money.... Amsterdam as a city if fab to....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: HenrikIbsen
Reviews.Content: Me and my buddies stayed here for two nights during our yearly cultural journey to one of the bigger European cities ("cultural" meaning everything from visiting museums to real heavy drinking). Excellent location at Leidseplein where all the action is. A little distance from the Red Light District, but never mind, take a cab. Excellent staff, excellent bar. We never had breakfast at the hotel, but I am sure that was excellent to. Not the cheapest of hotels i AMS, but if you take advantage of the various internet offers, you could get away with it at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: amjur613
Reviews.Content: Booked for 3 days as a stop on the way home from the East. When booked I inquired about the cancellation policy, as always. I was told that I would be liable for at least one night, even if I didn't stay at all. Upon arrival, I had become quite ill and informed the desk at check-in that I would only be staying 1 night. The desk attendant said that was no problem and that they would credit my credit card for the 2 nights. Another person overheard this and the whispered into the clek's ear and all of a sudden their policy changed!!!! I was stuck with payingfor 3 nights despite leaving the next morning! I won't even go into the intenet problems! That it didn't even work in the guest rooms, as promised, was the least of the issues. The room was OK, but "European" small. The location is great if you are into the art museums but pretty far from everything else. Would not stay there again. Amsterdam seems to have many better options.

Reviews.Title: “Oct 13, 07 seems very nice but...”
Reviews.Author: traveler5635
Reviews.Content: I just checked in 6 hours ago, when I entered the room there was a very strong smell, like some kind of air freshener trying to cover up a rotten smell. I should have requested a new room immediately, I opened the window, hit the sauna, ran out to see the city. After coming back to my room it was better (of course), but still smelled a bit rotten. Had to close the window (cold outside). I called the front desk to see what they could do about the smell or the room, the gentlemen said he would get back to me. It has been over an hour, no one has called back. A few minor things I would have overlooked but with the room smell they add up: the sauna had no towels, another guest asked if I knew where the towels were, also went to order room service, there was no menu, had to call twice, 40 minutes later they brought a menu. Overall I would not recommend this hotel. It is beautiful place, but the service is very poor! Wish I had a better review.

Reviews.Title: “A top choice for staying in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: MyLSD
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE this hotel! I first caught a glimpse inside this hotel in '03 when my cousin was staying there on business. It looked like a nice quality place to stay, so when I saw rooms available there at reasonable prices this year, I didn't hesitate to book! This hotel has two main features that I look for: Nice comfortable, clean room AND location, location, location. The room was definitely nice and clean. It had modern decor and furniture to the room. The bathroom was nice and clean. The bed was comfortable.... and so where the blankets and pillows - oh the pillows! =) The room was a tad bit narrow for my taste, but it was NOT closet tiny like most european hotels. Location was what this hotel is all about! It is located RIGHT smack in Leidseplein (if you are familiar with Amsterdam - it is literally one block from Bull Dog). I like the location because yes, it's in a touristy area, but it is in a safe area. Late a night, you can easily walk over to the next block where all of the restaurants and cafes are and people watch all night long. The long streets of shopping are also about a minute's walk away. When you walk about 5 minutes in the other direction, you can easily cross the Holland Casino and make your way to Museumplein. But of course, the tram stops are right near the hotel, so you can pretty much get yourself everywhere around town. The people who worked the reception were really nice and helpful. They were able to make reservations for us as needed for restaurants and taxis to the airport. This is my fifth year returning to Amsterdam, and this is amongst my top choices for hotels. If you can find afford so splurge a bit or can find a deal on this hotel - stay here for sure! It'll only add to a quite "magical" experience in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: pooch2121
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for 2 nights staying with friends for a weekend break ,this hotel is fantastic ,rooms are on the small side but are clean and have everything you need,the reception staff speak fluent english and are very hepful as to explain the local area and things to do,the area outside the hotel has a wide variety of shops ,restaurants and things to do ,i would thourghly recomend buying a canal pass (there is a canal stop just outside the hotel) you can get in to dam square and see some fantastic sights on the way.one thing i would recomend about this hotel is to avoid the mini bar very very expensive, but do visit the hotel bar which is beautiful

Reviews.Title: “Is this the best there is?????”
Reviews.Author: laplume9254
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the hotel since it was one of the top three splurge hotels recommended by the Frommer's guide. If this is one of the top three hotels in Amsterdam, what are the other properties like??? The room was average at best...dreary hallways, tiny elevators, smelled musty and old, and located in a dirty section of town. If you need to stay in this area, opt for the Marriott just next door.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location - public areas are 'tired'”
Reviews.Author: Sackville
Reviews.Content: Booked on hotelbook.com (which was a really easy site to use) and no problems at all with the bookking. The rate was expensive due to a congress and Amsterdam was pretty full. i stayed at this hotel years ago (when it was an Intercontinental)and unfortunately it looks as though some of the public areas and stair/lift areas have not been touched in years and are due for refurbishment as it's looking very tired. The room was extremely small and overlooked the front so noisy at night. (Fountains and traffic). That said, the room was clean and the bathroom good. the bed was way too soft for my likning, but that's a personal choice but everything else was fine. Didn';t get a chance to eat in the hotel as only a one night stay and early departure. The location can't be beaten, but it would be even better if the hotel lived up to the location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: rk-winelover17
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and new right away that this was a pleasant place to stay. The lobby was swanky, chic, and the staff were attentive. Our room was modern, and had the most amazing bed down comforter. It is also the best location and I would recommended this hotel in a heartbeat as my boyfriend knows I can sometimes be hard to please.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: janoandpastie
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very central, we have been to amsterdam before and stayed in the Marriott which was far superior, having said that, the American Hotel was very good with the little extra's i requested on-line before the trip. It was our son's birthday and we treated him and his girlfirend to this break, we asked the hotel to provide a birthday cake and give them a room with canal view. they fulfilled our request's, and delivered the cake at the exact time requested. the rooms were average size, but the bathroom was very small. We think this part of amsterdam is excellent, lots of bars, place's to eat, street entertainment, comedy clubs, you cant go wrong staying near leidesplien square.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, clean, beautiful. Extras are EXPENSIVE!”
Reviews.Author: glib1122
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, classic and truly beautiful. It is located on Leidesplein, a lively square lined with cafes and entertainers. It is walking distance from all the big sites. The trams run frequently to more outlying places and were easy to master (even for this inexperienced traveler). I booked a basic room- it had no view, but I didn't care. It was spacious (for Europe) and the bathroom was huge. Air conditioning was powerful! The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. My one complaint is that the extras- cafe, minibar, phone calls are all outrageously priced. The minibar has sensors in it- we didn't even open it and one night the "minibar police" knocked on our door to restock the bar b/c the alarm had gone off. Overall, a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Amsterdam American”
Reviews.Author: Ohjustpeachy
Reviews.Content: I was delighted to get a good deal on booking.com as the hotel is beautiful (in person and online). Its location is fantastic and the restaurant oozes charm, character and chatter every day. The room was very large, with coffee facilities, safe etc. and I gather it was a much older (decor) room than some but it suited us perfectly because we were out and about most of our time there. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All Star Conveniance”
Reviews.Author: Newyorker765
Reviews.Content: Stayed four days at the Hotel American in May. Room 607 was a "delux", very comfortable, with a great view of canals and boat traffic. The Hotel is walking distance to all the main museums, flower market, and even Rembrandtplein. Three trams are right out the door, as is the Water Taxi. Old town and Red light District are only 10 minutes away on Trams. Staff was very friendly and helpful. These are the "Pro's". The "Con's": Rather expensive overall, outrageous Internet and Mini Bar Prices, and overpriced Cafe American (but it does look stunning!) "Gym" is poor. All in all a wonderful stay despite the caveats.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DCMJMM
Reviews.Content: Great location. Near Museum Quarter and convenient public transportatin to get anywhere else in the city. Near many different ethnic restaurants. Stayed in a Junior Suite. Nice modern room and bathroom. Beautiful restaurant. Good breakfast buffet but cheaper options nearby. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location”
Reviews.Author: E_Hemingway
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the best part of Amsterdam in my view. Pretty much the geographical centre and a hub for trams. Despite this the room was quiet with little outside noise. The hotel itself is good by Amsterdam standards. Apparently some rooms have canal views, but not mine. But the room is massive with plenty of room for 2. A good comfortable King Bed. Mini bar prices are expensive but there are a number of convenience stores just outside the door. So get your beer there. 7.50 euro for a heineken is a joke. Staff are friendly and what you would expect of a 4 star. Really, the whole hotel is standard for a 4 star but the larger room made me give it an above average. Plus Cafe Aericain which is a must visit even for just afternoon tea. Although, you don't need to stay here to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Cancellation/Reservation Policy -- Book carefully”
Reviews.Author: SFtoADam
Reviews.Content: I have been relocated to Amsterdam for work for 6 mos and my company booked me in a room at the American Hotel in Amsterdam for 8 days while I looked for an apartment to rent. Overall, the staff at the hotel was great and location central (albeit touristy) but they tack on lots of little extras. A subpar buffet breakfast costs 21 Euros (after making the mistake once I walked down the street to Bagels and Beans and ate much better for 4 Euros), basic internet access costs 17 Euros a day and I had problems with my eithernet connection. However, my main issue with the hotel is that after you check in you can't change your reservation. So, as luck would have it, I found an apt and moved in on my 5th day in the city. I let the manager know 24 hrs in advance that I would be leaving 2 days early, however, apparently once you physically check in to the hotel you can't change your end date. You can change the length of the reservation after you make it but this has to be done bfore you check in. My company was obligated to pay for the two days that I didn't stay there -- and they could have easily re-rented the room as it was a national holiday and 3 day weekend. Additionally, two colleagues for work were coming out for a week for work and our work travel department booked them in the hotel as well (I have since told them not to put people there). Based on my review, my co-workers tried to cancel their reservations at the American Hotel 3 weeks in advance of their arrival date and they were told that if they cancelled they'd have to still pay the full amount for their stay (over 1600 Euros each). So, apparently you can't cancel a reservation in it's entirity as well. You can only alter it (which is what they did -- changed from 8 days to 1 day and will be moving to a nearby, nicer and cheaper hotel) . Apparently these details are included in the fine print when you make a reservation, but I have never heard of such an inflexible reservation policy and haven't found another hotel in Amsterdam that has such a policy in place. So, a word of warning, if you book at this hotel make sure that you are 100% confident in your dates and book trip insurance in case you have to cancel and are charged the full amount

Reviews.Title: “A Great First Time Experience!”
Reviews.Author: DTravelerAndFriends
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went to Amsterdam for a concert - this was our first trip out to the Netherlands! We had been looking all over the city and read tons of reviews and decided to stay at this hotel finally! And we were soo glad we did. Like I said it was our first trip there and we weren't familiar with the area at all so it was VERY nice to be in the middle of everything! The staff was absolutely superb! They helped up track down our hotel tickets - which eventually were hand delivered to us! They also made our breakfast reservations on our departure day with no problems! On arrival, we had special requests that had been honored to the T - we had even forgotten we had made the requests as usually most requests are not always guaranteed! But everything was perfect!!! The city is soooo well laid out that we ended up walking everyplace and the fact that our hotel was friendly and right in the most perfect location, we took Amsterdam on as soon as we arrived! We would def stay there again and would highly recommend it as a perfect place to begin a love affair for such a great city!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Playsmart
Reviews.Content: The wife and I booked a last minute deal through expedia to be there over christmas. The hotel was very lovely. You really can't ask for a more central location than this. It is a art-deco hotel and one must remember that when they stay. The staff was extremely friendly. The room was nothing that stood out since it is a typical european hotel room. Small yet quaint but def. big enough. If you are going to a place like Amsterdam you aren't really going to be spending that much time in the hotel anyways. Agaian, I can't rave more about the location and you have about a half dozen trams to choose from when you walk outside. It was gorgeous in the winter so I can only imagine how the summer is. Big thumbs up for the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and restaurant, but boring hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: Kneeto
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel is exceptional. The rooms are rather dated and they are nothing special. That said, the restaurant is like a 3 carat diamond. A sparkling gem which I would recommend to anyone and everyone that I know. I will not likely stay at the hotel again but I will complement the restaurant and remember our meal there for years to come. The service is top rate and the staff are something special. The decor and atmosphere are an experience. The piano player was just the kind of extra atmosphere you would hope for. If you go to Amsterdam and want a special meal, this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Art Deco funky in the heart of the the tourist zone”
Reviews.Author: MizunguhowRU?
Reviews.Content: The American Hotel Amsterdam. This art deco monument on Amsterdamâ€™s Leidsekade has a charming period exterior which was unfortunately obscured with billboards and scaffolding during my stay. Operated by Summit Hotels, a group that specializes in boutique properties, itâ€™s location just off the busy Leidseplein will please you if you want quick access to the touristy sites and sounds of Amsterdam in the evening. It is easily accessible from the Amsterdam central railway station by taking the 1,2,or 5 trams which stop a half a block away so you can be in the thick of things very quickly. The rooms are clean and comfortable with high end bed linens and a plasma screen TV, and they are also air conditioned. I mention it because in northern Europe this should never be assumedâ€¦always ask when visiting in the summer months and make sure you ask re â€œin roomâ€� vs. the public areas. Even many high end properties will fudge on this. Most of the year itâ€™s not needed but it can make for a miserable stay in July, August or even September if you donâ€™t have it. My rooms with a queen size bed was decorated in a muted art deco modern style that was very attractive and comfortable. A mini bar (with jiggle sensors) and an in-room safe is provided. I was somewhat amused by the safe in my room which was simply sitting unanchored in the closet. It could be moved all over (I did just for fun but put it back) and I could of easily carried it out in my suitcase if I wantedâ€¦ See the picture. This may have been unique to my room I suppose. A buffet breakfast is available at 25 Euroâ€¦. I passed on it and made for a neighborhood bakery..yum. In room Internet is offered but at nearly 30 US Dollars a day ,the local internet cafes (of which there are many) or the hot spot down the street at McDonalds is a better alternative and you will have it practically to yourself before 11 or so in the morning.. Itâ€™s a shame really..hotels could really make a buck on Internet access and build customer loyalty if they would establish a reasonable price point. I suspect a lot donâ€™t even know how easy it would be to maintain their own wireless networks instead of sharing profits with greedy telecoms. It might even pump Room Service sales in bad weather. Oh well..with more and more cities establishing public internet utilities at free or low cost it will become a moot point soon enough anyway. Although the Leidseplein itself is a bit tacky with lots of really awful street performers, there is plenty to do just outside, with theater, cinema, bars, nightclubs and hundreds of restaurants within easy walking distance.. OK to be honest, half the restaurants are Argentinean steak houses, (darned if I know why?) but there are still lots of choices. Tram access to most of Amsterdamâ€™s attractions or business districts is a snap so by all means donâ€™t bother renting a car. Driving in Amsterdam will make you homicidal anyway. Walking along the nearby canals is a pleasant way to spend some time. Cycling around town is even an option with bike rental readily available. I paid about 220.00 US dollars a night to stay at the American and reckon it was a fairly good value when compared to its local competition. The rack rates are much much higher however so shop around. Staff was pleasant, attentive, and professional. All in all, I would say its four star rating is legit.. Like many older European properties, advantage has been taken in the â€œgrandfather clausesâ€� of the EU disabled access laws. There are a lot of steps in unexpected locations and no wheelchair ramps that I could find. While the American Hotel not as inaccessible as many, disabled or mobility challenged folks will want to communicate their needs in advance or seek a more contemporary lodging.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: smokeyjobe
Reviews.Content: I came across the Amsterdam American Hotel on my first visit to the city, when on a bright summers day, I sat in the outside area of the Hotel and enjoyed a delicious tapas lunch. On that occasion I stayed at the very pleasant Amsterdam Art Hotel. The only problem was the distance from the hotel to the city centre (3km). This time, recalling that lunch, I found and booked to stay at the American Hotel at a very reasonable rate (approx 80% discounts available if you find the right sites). The staff were pleasant and helpful. Part of the Hotel was under renovation and when we arrived at our room, there was a letter on the bed apologising for any disturbances, and offering 1 pack of earplugs and 1 small paintbrush compliments of the Hotel! Thick walls prevented any unwelcome noises, the bedrooms were stylish and modern whilst remaining comfortable [excellent bed!] and the bathroom housed a shower/bath in which I had the best shower I've ever had at a hotel. The only disappointment was the cost of breakfast (22 euros per person). I'm not known as a tightwad, but we were able to get delicious hearty breakfasts that cost half that amount at a cafe across the square, and how can you argue with that? The Hotel's location can't be faulted as it is situated in the heart of the eating/drinking/shopping/theatre area (Leidesplein) and only a few minutes walk from the main art and histrory museums. Plus, pretty much all the main attractions are within 40 minutes walking distance. Alternatively, the Canal bus, regular buses and trams all have stops right outside the Hotel. The restaurant is worth a visit. The food is very good if a little pricey (lunch is best for those on a budget), but what makes it worthwhile is the amazing Art Nouveau interior. Photos do not do the place justice. Just beautiful. I would definitely stay at the Amsterdam American Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Faded glamour!”
Reviews.Author: DarrylGould
Reviews.Content: Please forgive me for writing in the present tense, but I am in the hotel room now, and feel so strongly about this hotel, that I had to write my review immediately. Last week I stayed in the Marriott hotel which is just a bridge away. I was quite impressed with the Marriott, but felt I should try the American as a friend had recommended it. The American was 5 Euro cheaper than the Marriott. It cost 160 Euro for 1 night (without breakfast). On first impressions, the hotel seems very nice. It has a cosy bar, and an inviting reception. The staff were pleasant and prompt. When I reached my room I was very disappointed. The room is narrow and you have to manoeuvre your way passed the TV cabinet to get into the room. When the bathroom door is open it is virtually impossible to get passed the bed. The bid is a King-size, but the mattress is extremely soft and I am struggling to sit on it, never mind sleep. The sheets are cheap, and the budget didn't even run to a valance on the bed, as I can see the bed base (which is quite unsightly). The furniture and curtains have definitely seen better days. The bathroom is tiny. Barely room to take a pee standing up! All of this is in stark contrast to the Marriott, which has recently been refurbished. I will write a review of the Marriott as soon as I get home. To sum up: this hotel has certainly seen better days. If you are looking to stay in this area, book the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: liniloo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 3 night business/pleasure stay at this hotel and were extremely pleased with every aspect of the hotel. We booked the hotel through a booking website and then e-mailed the hotel direct requesting a room with a balcony with a canal view which we were allocated on arrival at no extra cost. The staff were very friendly and helpful and we found the service in the bar and restaurant to be excellent. Location was perfect and we will definately be using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: DinkyN
Reviews.Content: I booked the trip as a surprise Birthday present for my husband for us and 2 further rooms for friends. We had a fantastic long weekend and overall I was impressed with the hotel. When I booked I told them that it was a Birthday and requested a high room with a good view which they gave us together with drinks vouchers and local biscuits as a gift. The room overlooked the canal and was really clean and well appointed. The bar area is very funky, decorated with photos of stars who have previously visited and the location is excellent, right next to the tram stop for easy access to the rest of Amsterdam and also adjacent to Leidseplein with all its bars and cafes. The room was not ready when we arrived but we were warned at the time of booking that was likely to be the case and the concierge was extremely helpful and efficient, storing the bags delivering them to our room when it was available.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: Tashmoo
Reviews.Content: Given the amount of time I spent on Trip Advisor looking for information I figured the least I could do is provide a review. I booked a six-day stay at this hotel for me, my wife and teenage daughter. The location is very central. Our room overlooked the main square which was quite nice. The tram noise might be a consideration for some but we did not mind it (background atmosphere). The room was large and quite nice. Nice hot shower. Front desk folks were helpful and pleasant. I wish we could have checked in earlier after arriving at 8 am on a flight from Boston. We had to wait until almost 3 pm, the official time, and we were dead on our feet. The hotel bar is a nice place for a drink. We were very disappointed with the service in the restaurant (In general, the philosophy of service in Amsterdam appears to be one of benign neglect). We are not picky customers but I think waiting approximately one hour to get our main course is a bit much. My real complaint is that no one, such as a floor manager, stopped by our table to explain what the problem was and offer us a drink. We were in no rush and would have been sympathetic. Having worked in a restaurant I know that chefs do melt down and kitchens do get overwhelmed. One waiter did mention that we were not his table and he was helping out another waiter and another waiter mentioned something about new systems. It was not just us. A poor family with kids at the next table also waited a very long time for dinner. The clincher was when I asked for the dessert menu. Yet another waiter brought us the menu. When he returned I ordered Creme brulee, one of only several desserts, and the one thing I was looking forward to all night. They were out! Why he did not mention that fact when he brought the menu escaped me. The food was good but all in all we were very disappointed. We expected the service would match the decor and it did not. I hope the management pays some attention to this issue and corrects it. Other folks had posted similar complaints and we decided to take a chance. Speaking of service, when we returned to our room there was a room service tray outside the door of a nearby room. It was still outside the door late the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: CarolineB1982
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I (30 and 24) had a fabulous stay at the American hotel in Amsterdam, it's situated by a main square where there are more restaurants than you could think of within 2 mins by foot. The hotel is currently being renovated so we didn't get to see in it's full glory as there was some scaffolding up. It was mentioned as the first apartment / hotel in the whole of the Netherlands so that was cool. The hotel itself doesn't have such an impressive frontage but once you look round the corner you realise it's grandeur. The room itself was a little on the small side but spotlessly clean witha big plasma tv, mini bar and desk. The management had left tokens for complimentary drinks ofr us and there was a set of ear plugs and a paint brush! As we only stayed for only one night, Sunday 4th March, it said the work was only going on Mon -Sat so we didn't hear anything. We slept till after 10 on the Monday morning in the giant bed! Had a lovely meal after the canal tour in a Mexican restaurant right next to the Cafe Alto Jazz Bar on a street whcih runs down past the Bulldog Coffeeshop. The jazz bar was fab, excellent friendly musicians and drinks weren't very expensive - all in all a lovely end to a trip visiting family in another part of the Netherlands.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a great price in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: artfestival
Reviews.Content: The Amsterdam American hotel is in a fabulous location, on a square, conveniently located to most everything in Amsterdam. The rooms are spacious, immaculately clean, plasma screen tv's, huge windows that open. The room we had was bright and sunny and faced a side street so it was quiet. The bar in the hotel was great. Very lively and had great drinks. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money. Definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: TinytearsLeicester
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after searching on Easybook.com. It was well placed next to lots of shops and bars/restaurants. The hotel staff were very polite and efficient. Rooms were large and very clean. View from our room was rubbish as it backed onto another building but as we didn't spend much time in the room it wasn't a big deal. Fully stocked minibar and tea and coffee making facilities. Pillows on the bed were very small. The bathroom was extremely clean and the water pressure in both the bath and shower was excellent. Lovely hot water on demand. Few basic toiletries also included. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Half Term Break”
Reviews.Author: Hispanist
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Amsterdam. We saw the American Hotel on our previous visit three years ago, sat outside, had a drink and thought the location would be ideal if we ever returned. We weren't disappointed. The hotel is ideally placed for shopping and sightseeing and there are several bars and restaurants nearby. The hotel lacks the wow factor of the Radisson where we stayed in 2004 but there is not much to complain about. The service was friendly and efficient from start to finish. Every member of staff we came into contact with was friendly, helpful and polite. The room we were given was a little on the small side and the view could have been better, but it was well equipped, well decorated and the beds were comfortable. There was some work going on during our stay but this did not prove to be an inconvenience. The bar is great in the evening as you have a good view of the square outside and can sit and watch the world go by. The restaurant is well run and the decor and ambiance justify the hotel's five stars. Overall we would rate the hotel as a good four star establishment and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shelly2006
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from amsterdam yesterday!Stayed at this hotel arrived on an early morning flight,they upgraded our room and we got allocated our room straight away even though check in was for 3pm!Staff couldnt have been more helpful!Got a great rate for this hotel!Fantastic location!Would def recommend this to a friend!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant time and brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: loopylouie22
Reviews.Content: got a really good deal on this hotel, the room was small but i had no problem with that. great location right next to great nitelife. we didnt have a canal view but then again i paid very little for the room so that was expected. i wud highly recommend to stay here...a beautiful hotel with great facilities and helpful staff. will stay here again with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: jonnysdad
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in mid January in a very pleasant Hotel. We didnâ€™t arrive til quite late thanks to a delayed flight from Blackpool, an hour delay on a 50-minute flight is a bit annoying! We were quickly and efficiently checked in by the friendly staff, and given an upgrade to a de luxe room with a view over the canal. The room was spotless with the biggest bed I ve ever seen, though the bathroom was a little on the small side (though spotless nevertheless). After a quick freshen up we went down to the bar for our complimentary drinks before setting out to find somewhere to eat, (not a problem as there are dozens of restaurants around the Leidesplein). We had booked 'room only' so had breakfast across the sq in the unpretentious looking 'Sky Sports' bar which served excellent food, huge portions at a very reasonable price (try one of the pancakes!) The hotel is being refurbished, though other than the stairs to the mezzanine floor being taped off you wouldn't know. Overall a very pleasant hotel, friendly staff, and a pleasant though expensive bar

Reviews.Title: “It's worth paying that bit extra!”
Reviews.Author: PeterNewcastleUK
Reviews.Content: I go to Amsterdam every year for a short break, this was my 20th visit and I have stayed in many different hotels from budget to luxury. I can without hesitation state that the American Hotel tops the lot in my opinion. I booked in on the back of other Tripadvisor reviews about this hotel and I got what I thought was a good rate at 100 euros a night (single,room only basis,booked via ---.nl). I requested via email a 'quiet room on a high floor' and was allocated a room on the 6th (top) floor on arrival. The room was spacious with a massive bed, spotlessly clean but most importantly VERY QUIET - you could hear a pin drop. The only noise I heard was the distant clang of the tram bell. A big difference from other hotels, sometimes more expensive. I did not eat in the hotel as it was expensive but as other people have said there are many places to eat elsewhere. Trams 1, 2 and 5 stop around the corner and all take the same route to the Centraal Station (1.60 euros only) via the flower market, Dam square etc. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Still a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Shazhudson
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my boyfriend and parents from 23rd December 2006 to 28th December 2006. This is the second time my boyfriend and I have stayed here and it's still a really good place to stay. The service was still great and the staff really friendly and helpful. The breakfast is expensive at 20 euro a head but we had it on Christmas day. It is a lovely breakfast with everything you could want to have including champagne, which was a nice touch for Christmas morning. You get champagne any morning there though! Rooms were overlooking the Leidseplein square area which we had asked for and were spacious and very clean. The maid service was brilliant too! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. We used the connexions service from the airport to the doorstep of the hotel and return, it costs 19 euro a head return but is well worth it instead of getting a train to central station then getting ripped off in a taxi to save carting luggage on a tram. Great little service and friendly drivers who give you a kind of commentary round the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AllyRock
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastically located, right on the leidsplein square, which is great for bars & restaurants. The hotel itself is beautiful from the outside, big and imposing. The lobby has a very modern feel to it, very clean and swish, the staff were very helpful. We got there at 2pm and our room wasn't ready for another hour, but we were able to leave our bags with the conceirge while we went for a drink. Upon checking in, we couldn't find our room but one of the bell-hops who saw us looking lost immediately offered to help, and took us in the lift all the way to our room which was very kind. Without asking we were upgraded to a suite, which I must say was very nice. The room was massive and included a large double bed, big pillows, a couch and two armchairs, plasma tv (with several english speaking channels including CNN, BBC and MTV) , tea & coffee facilites, ironing board & iron, safe, the bathroom was large too, with double sinks, a fantastic shower, robes & slippers. The room itself was right above the reception, but still very quiet. It had big floor to ceiling windows overlooking the canal which was beautiful. It could have been more noisy, but the bed was that far from the window you didn't notice! The room was spotless, and an absolute bargain which we got through the hotels website for 100 euros a night. Breakfast was not included in the rate, and is 20e per person, we didn't bother and instead headed out and bought some pastries. Upon checking out, we were able to leave our bags all day until our flight, which is a massive help. I would highly recommend this hotel, good location, great room, good rates, nice staff. Brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “love america”
Reviews.Author: ramp
Reviews.Content: Arived christmas eve for two nights booked deluxe room on hotel web site for 155 euros per night. Had great room on 5 floor.best location in amsterdam.Last stayed here 7 years ago has been recently refitted better eating and drinking places close to hotel worth spending a bit extra to get a room with a view on a high floor.Nice staff but its all about location.Highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, lousy service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Pooks2Go
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I don't know how every site could be so wrong about a hotel. I happened to find a really great deal on the hotel on some site and was excited to go to this hotel. My boyfriend and I stayed there in early November after reading so many great reviews online and we were expecting a fabulous gothic and modern hotel. We were so wrong! I admit, the location is excellent: close to the museums, chic shopping, and the city center. Not in the middle of all the chaos but close enough. That's about where my compliments end. Let's start at the beginning. We arrived late in the evening and we were expecting to order room service. No room service after 11 pm or something ridiculous like that. When we asked the girl at the front desk if she knew of any restaurants that would be open, she said she didn't know any restaurants that would be open at that hour. After going back and forth with her she finally got the bell boy to tell us that McDonalds was open down the street. We walked out and it was raining. I went to the same girl and asked if they had any umbrellas for guests. There was a big box of umbrellas behind her. She said that they were out of umbrellas. I mentioned that there is a box behind her. She replied that they were for sale and I could buy one. I said I only wanted to use it to go down the street and as a paying guest, the hotel could afford to loan me one for 10 minutes. I can skip the rest and simply say, I got very VERY wet that evening. The room was really small. The furniture was in bad shape. Not modern at all. Somewhat dirty with strands of hair in the drawers and on the carpet. OK bathroom (clean and functioning). The people across from us were constantly ordering room service and the dirty trays were left all over the hallway all day long which was kind of gross. The final incident was the morning we were checking out. Our flight was at 4 pm and we requested a late check out. The woman at the desk said that it would be 25 Euros an hour which is something I've never been told at any hotel (even $10 youth hostels I've stayed at!) I would have preferred that she said the hotel was booked and unfortunately couldn't accomodate our late check out. Pretty tacky, if you ask me. It gets worse. We asked the front desk to confirm out seats and flight. The girl said that she couldn't do it. Why, you might ask? Her response was that it was really hard to get through to the airline and she didn't want to wait on the phone for a long time. Hello?!?! What kind of front desk person says that? If you weren't into customer service why would you get a job at a front desk of a hotel??? Needless to say, we spoke with the manager who was very helpful and took care of it. Of course, when we returned from walking around the town one last time, we asked the girl if everthing is ok for our flight. Her response was, "Everything is confirmed. You know, these days you don't have to call and confirm flights." I was kind of shocked but at that point not surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Tartan_Totty
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here more times than I can remember and I just can't help going back. The rooms are lovely (especially if you can get allocated one of the newer ones on check-in), the staff are helpful, professional and knowledgeable. The food is good although we did tend to go out and try other places. This hotel has a fabulous location right beside Leidseplain where you can sit and people watch with a G&T (or ten) for hours! The last couple of times we stayed we upgraded to the Mata Hari Suite - WOW! You could hold a party in there and you even get the Music System to do it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for A European Hotel”
Reviews.Author: adrienneth
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Apparently, I got an unheard of rate of $147 euros for a one night, Saturday night, stay. The room was SMALL, but clean, comfy, and the bathroom was the nicest I've experienced in Amsterdam (spacious, separate tub and shower, nice fixtures, lighted mirrors, white robe and slippers, etc.). You'll have a flat screen TV with stations in English. Stay AWAY from the mini-bar- I got desperate and paid $7 euros for a large bag of M&M's. I was desperate. I'd also stay away from the "full American breakfast buffet". It's $20 euros, the eggs tasted awful, and the bacon was horrible. You do get champagne, though. The place is very pretty, the elevators are spacious, and the staff is quite accomodating. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the American”
Reviews.Author: vbfan
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 6 night stay at the American. The room was comfortable, immaculately clean and modern. I had a single room with a king size bed and I was pleasantly surprised by the large size of the room which included a desk and sitting area. The bathroom was modern and of average size. Everyone I interacted with on the staff from the concierge to the gentleman that cleaned my room were pleasant and friendly. The front desk staff were always helpful in answering my questions and giving suggestions for meals, etc; checking in/out was a breeze. I had breakfast and lunch several times in the restaurant and enjoyed my meals. I have no complaints and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Fryfamily2006
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel out of some desperation after we arrived at the Hotel V and couldn't stay there - simply too depressing location and cheaply done. So we called the American and obtained a delightful triple room for 185 euros per night (205 euros for the Friday night). Very good atmosphere in the bar ( most of the bars around Leidesplein are rather loud and trashy) and a very good restaurant. Very comfortable room - large bathroon and excellent beds. Decent size room. Not super-luxury but very good indeed. The restaurant's good but on the expensive side. But it does have a real buzz. It's the location that is very good - it has its own river cruise jetty and all the trams pass close by. And it's an easy walk to the museums. We did go up to the old city and felt rather uncomfortable up there. Many of the larger hotels eg the Movenpick are up near the central station or close by the red ight district. So I wouldn't recommend staying up there. Perfect for a long weekend. And do go to see Boom Chicago - it's like Whose Line is it Anyway but with surprisingly good food.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: S.E.-L.V.
Reviews.Content: This was a great Hotel. Incredible staff, beautiful Hotel, inside and out. A great city. Our room looked out over the canal, highly recommend this. Easy access to everything in the city. The art musuems are a five minute walk. The only thing I would change, would be to get a room with a large bed. The singles are fairly small. Cannot say enough about the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and old at the same time”
Reviews.Author: DX-Traveler
Reviews.Content: Lobby area is small, but great looking with modern and sleek minimalist design, but it is at times crowded with smoking meeting participants rendering the air terrible. And there is no air circulation. The staff is great, however, check/in and out seems overly complicated and slow - an antiquated computer system may be to blame. Rooms are generally on the smaller side, with small bathrooms. Both areas are nice and clean. The shower heads are the typical European models that tend to squirt more than they shower. Good towels. Internet access is 25 Euro per day! Corridors are generally neglected, and the elevators very small and slow.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Very posh!”
Reviews.Author: lkeegan
Reviews.Content: Absolutely gorgeous hotel in a brilliant location, right beside the main shopping area but far enough away that you're not bothered by noise at night. The rooms are beautiful- when we arrived we were told we'd been upgraded to a fancier one overlooking the canal- we'd requested a nice room in our email to them, and they certainly didnt let us down! The hotel itself has a great bar and dining area, though unfortunately we werent up early enough to sample the breakfast. The night life in the hotel itself and in Amsterdam in general is great craic. Would definitely recommend this hotel and a stay in Amsterdam- its a brilliant city and there's a lot more to it than the red light district. PS. rent the bikes, its a great city for getting around on bikes, even if you dont like cycling (like my boyfriend!)

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expecations”
Reviews.Author: BCKTravelers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Europe with our 4 year old son and my sister. Since there was a huge convention in town we had few choices but chose the American Hotel because it seemed like the best given the circumstances. We were so pleased with our choice. The location on the Leidseplein and just blocks from the canal tour, Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum was wonderful. The room was very modern and clean. It included great bath products. We chose a deluxe room with a balcony and canal view. The staff was very friendly. We appreciated their playfulness with our son who had just gotten off the plane after traveling from Los Angeles. The extensive buffet breakfast (includes champagne) in the American Cafe--watching the city wake up--was a terrific way to begin our vacation. We can highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Marvelous”
Reviews.Author: flysalot
Reviews.Content: Just completed a long weekend visit and stayed at the Amsterdam American Hotel and cannot recommend it enough. Staff was exceptionally helpful and friendly, rooms quite large for Europe, very clean, even extra pristine bathroom linens. Cafe American is terrific - a Sunday Jazz brunch is quite special. The location is nothing short of perfect - ease of access to trams in all directions, easy walking to everything, wonderful canal location. Unbelievably quiet, 24 hour service although entrance changes after midnight. If you have physical difficulties might not be best choice as there are some stairs in property and as a bath/shower combination you have to step into. Thought it was exceptionally good value for the room rate. A building with great history, fantastic staff and location, and a well maintained property I would most assuredly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: uka
Reviews.Content: We were a group and we stayed at the hotel for three nights. The hotel has a fantastic location! Leidseplein is right in front of the hotel with many bars, nightclubs, comedy theatre, and restaurants. The museums are within walking distance. The rooms are of average size and all the rooms have had differnt plans of solution. The bathroom was ok, with large and clean towels. The twin beds are very comfortable and the rooms are aircondioned. Ask for rooms with canal view, these are located on the quite side of the hotel. Quality of the rooms are average. The staff are friendly, eventhough there seems to be a touch of professional friendliness. We had some trouble with our bookings but it was solved without further difficulties. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel as it was expensive. We ate outside and can suggest you a beagle and bean cafe situated on the leidsestraat, and it is on the lefthand side on the 2nd canalbridge from the hotel. You can get a lovely berakfast for 7 euros! There is a exercise room at the hotel, but if you are a runner i will suggest you a fantastic running tour through the Vondelpark, just a few hundred meters away from the hotel. Beautiful park and you can run and see! A maxi taxi to the hotel costs around 50 euros or else you can take a train to the centralstation and take tram 1 or 5 which stops just outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & location”
Reviews.Author: Spencertraveller
Reviews.Content: Great Location, suprisingly great service from staff and a nice big bed in my room. The breakfast was really good even for the EUR20 and the American Bar serves one of the best martinis I have ever had. Also, a nice little gym at hotel that is rarely used with a nice dry Sauna which is surprisingly for Amsterdam. It located close to museums and everything else, much better to stay here than hotels in the DAMRAK area. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: Robothell
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend for a week in February. First visit to Amsterdam for me, my girlfriend had been once before and had all her belongings stolen from her hotel on the first evening. So we were a little apprehensive. The American is quite a grand hotel from the outside and has a beautiful grand dining room. Our room (can't remember the number) was on the 6th floor and had no balcony. It was an adequate size, had all the usual facilities, a decent size bathroom (I note other reviews had not such luck) and was quite clean. We were able to ask for a non-smoking room so we didn't have the problems other members had. There was a safe in the room (essential after my girlfriend's previous experience) free of charge. The decor in the hallways and the room were a little on the dated side. The hotel is in a very lively area of Amsterdam but this didn't carry to the rooms. There are plenty of bars, clubs, theatres and coffee shops nearby. The Picasso and Reiksmuseum are a short walk away and the Hotel overlooks one of the canals. Dam square is a 25 minute walk away or about 5 mins on the trams which stop at the rear of the hotel. All in all a decent, good value accomodation. The champagne breakfast is a must if you decide to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in room #408”
Reviews.Author: Skipper39
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in room #408 at this perfectly located hotel. My room had a nice balcony overlooking the canal and was of decent size. I found all the staff I encountered to be friendly and professional. I would definitly stay at this property again. I highly recommend the Amsterdam American Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the grand facade!!”
Reviews.Author: ETolan
Reviews.Content: A group of four of us stayed in the Amsterdam American in February 2006. After having booked two rooms in the new Rembrant Square hotel, building wasn't completed in time so we were "upgraded" to the Amsterdam American. Having seen the hotels website I was very excited and looking forward to staying there, and upon arrival was encouraged by the grand lobby and restaurant - however this was to change when we arrived at our rooms! Firstly, check in was a very long and drawn out process, and although the staff were quite pleasant, seemed to take forever. As well as this, the credit card details I gave at reception for security were later fraudulently used for purchases to the tune of Â£2500!! I have no guarantee that it was a member of hotel staff acting dishonestly, however it was the only time I had used this credit card in months. Once we left the lobby and got into the lift it was like we had stepped back in time! The marble floors had changed to 60's style carpet, and the spacious foyer was now a maze of dingy corridors! The hotel room itself served its purpose, but it was tiny. Especially the bathroom - it was virtually impossible to close the door while you were on the loo without taking your legs off! One of the evenings after a long days sightseeing (we had eaten on the way back to the hotel) we decided to have coffees and dessert in the hotel restaurant. We were served by a very eccentric man, who once he found out we only wanted desserts, looked at us as if we had horns and wasn't very friendly at all! We have stayed in Amsterdam before - and I was aware that their 5* hotels wouldn't be what I would class 5*, however I would say that this was more of a 2* hotel. Granted the location was OK, but the year before we had stayed at the Die Poort van Cleve hotel, just beside Dam Square, and were much more satisfied there. I thought the location was much better there too. All this said - if you get a really cheap deal to stay here, go for it, but don't be fooled into paying more to stay here thinking that the rooms or service will be superior to many of the other cheaper hotels to be found in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, rooms fine”
Reviews.Author: yuringa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely well located for nightime fun (Leidersplein), museums and shopping. We stayed on the top floor in a good sized room but a tiny but presentable bathroom. The cafe for breakfast is a great setting and the room service breakfasts more than enough for 2.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: des101066
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weeks stay in the American Hotel. Caught the 370 bus, outside the main entrance at the airport , to Liedseplien [ good option 3.20 euros and dropped off 25 yards from hotel ] Was impressed with the art decco facade of the hotel, entered to find a very modern reception area Staff were friendly and helpful and we were checked in immediately. Our room was okay more 3 * than 5 * [ a little disappointing after what we had already seen of the hotel ] with a balcony overlooking the canal, this side of the hotel was exceptionally quiet thru the night. [ a tip here we were in room 409 and believe the 6 rooms with balcony's on this side are rooms 412 -407 so you may want to request one of these ] the room had a king size bed, nice flat screen tv [ bbc1&2 ] , mini bar, 2 telephones, desk area and chair. Bathroom was fine if a little on the small side Housekeeping was fairly good although they did forget to supply us with towels one day, quick call to reception fixed the problem. The bar and restaurant were good, although it would have been nice if they were open later than 1 am. On the whole i would say we enjoyed our stay and if you can get the 14 day advance booking for a room it is good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...although be careful with taxis from hotel.”
Reviews.Author: richardlondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and while my room was quite small it was very nice. Breakfast was a little expensive (20 Euros) but there was an excellent range of hot and cold food. Service throughout the hotel was friendly and helpful. My only concern was when leaving I was just about to get into a taxi of my choice when the concierge rushed out of the hotel and strongly encouraged me to get into a different taxi (one he clearly knew personally). I noticed this driver covered up the meter with his mobile phone and charged me a rip off rate to the airport (I was too tired to argue!) Maybe it was a pure coincidence, but I suspect not. Take care when taking taxi's from this location - there's actually a taxi rank just across the street from the hotel if you want to be sure. It was a disappointing end to an otherwise good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the marriott instead”
Reviews.Author: copahc
Reviews.Content: I stayed her for 2 nights. The location is great but that was the only positive. This hotel was very expensive and was not 5 star. It was not worth the price at all. The staff at the front desk was very rude and charged us extra because we had 3 people in a room instead of 2. The room was very tiny, nothing like advertised, and we had a view of the alley. I stayed at the Marriott also, just across the canal and had a MUCH larger room for only myself and it was much less expensive. the staff was nicer there also.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Bunpo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in American Hotel for 2 nights in June. Great location as beside Ledeisplein Square, which has numerous bars and restaurants. Quiet, comfy and clean room with King size bed and plasma TV. Would recommend getting a Tram from Central Station to Hotel as it is a considerable distance to walk and stop is ony 2 mins walk from Hotel. The Heineken Museum, Van Gogh Museum and Red Light District are must sees - if you want to go to the Anne Frank Museum, go early as queue was approx. 200 people long when we arrived at 11am. We would recommend The Van Gogh Cafe and Wok to Walk as cheap, tasty places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “HAD A GREAT TIME”
Reviews.Author: Chris_arm13
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at the hotel for easter weekend and we had a great stay!!!! We were on the 6th floor and had a very quit room, Housekeeping always did a good job of making the room up and the front desk staff was always very nice to us. Both of us said we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: MrCisco
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the American this weekend for 3 nights. Booked online so was a little unsure what we would get until we got there. Asked for at least a double bed, and also room with view of canal, but when we got to the room, it was a twin with not a great view. One quick call to reception though, and a porter quickly met us on the floor we were on with a new key. We got moved to a 'smoking room' but you wouldn't have been able to tell, it had a king size bed, and perfect view overlooking the canal. The room was huge with lots of space too. Very pleased. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They allowed us to keep our bags at the hotel before and after checkin/out. The cafe american was very classy, and the bar american was very comtemporary with award winning cocktails too. Very impressed. The Hotel is situated in a perfect location in my mind. Right on a nice canal. Plenty of places to get breakfast on our doorstep. Either museums 5 mins one way, or shops the other. Walkable distance to most things, although trams were so easy to use the entire time (lonely planet guide book very useful). I found the whole area much more tranquil than the busy centre. All in all very highly recommended and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “1 x star”
Reviews.Author: Skyhooks
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the American Hotel at the start of April 2006, will NEVER go back! This hotel is advertised as five star!! I would give it one star. DO NOT GET A ROOM ON THE FIRST FLOOR!! Room smelt of damp, rubbish bed, crap decor, badly in need of complete overhaul from ceiling to floor. After complaining I got moved to a 'two star' room, We are going back to Amsterdam but not to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and room”
Reviews.Author: MaxMumRB
Reviews.Content: Location, staff and room - this place had the 3 things that are were most important to me on this trip. We spent one day & night in Amsterdam and the location of the American Hotel enabled us to maximize our experience. We were greeted by a very friendly and genuinly helpful clerk at check in. She helped me out as I had lost my wallet. We were a short walk to a number of museums and galleries and just a few blocks away were dozens of restaurants with almost every cuisine represented. The room we had was very modern and reminded me of some of the W hotels that I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Superb location!”
Reviews.Author: Snr
Reviews.Content: Organised a stag party to stay at The Amsterdam American and they really looked after us. A group of 22 Irish lads on a wild stag party can often put the fear of God into hotel staff but we were welcomed by very friendly staff and treated without exception. The rooms were clean if a little small but were more than enough for us. The smaller bar to the left of reception was excellent with both patrons and visitors. The barman was great craic!! This is a hotel that caters for all types of visitor and is fair and unbiased with all. I would definately recommend staying at this hotel whether in a large group or as couples. Might even take the missus back if she stays with me!!!

Reviews.Title: “Spot Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gazmo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the American hotel for 3 nights on the 6th march. I have no complaints at all for the price we paid (100 euros per night). I have stayed in many hotels and B&B's in amsterdam over the years which have cost more or less this amount per night. This was by far the best. Our room was large (for amsterdam) kingsize bed, air con, nice clean bathroom. Towels and sheets changed everyday by a nice polite woman. In fact every member of staff we came across was very nice and helpfull. The only slightly bad point was the price of breakfast. 20 euros, ouch. So we just went in the square and got some at half the price there. The big cafe/resturant attached to the hotel is very good for lunch or an evening meal and not too expensive. i recomend the hot chocolate its brilliant on a cold day which it was for all 3 days. I would have no problems about staying there again, great location, great staff, love the dutch.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: MOH1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in December. The room was a good size and clean, with a small balcony, but the bed was too soft, a bit like sleeping on a water bed. The other problem was that the hotel's computer system had apparently broken down and the receptionist wasn't able to give us a final bill when we checked out. When the bill arrived in the post almost 2 months later, it included a 22 Euro charge for using the internet. Neither of us had used the internet and we didn't even have a laptop with us so watch out for bogus charges!

Reviews.Title: “good looks and in the centre of the action”
Reviews.Author: Cheslll
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the American hotel, got a great deal with Expedia. Beautiful art deco hotel. 2 great bars/restaurant. Lovely rooms, we got an upgrade to have a balcony with canal view. Right in the centre of the Leidesplein, everything you want close by, lots of great bars, coffeeshops & restos. Will deffo be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...but...”
Reviews.Author: Koei-Seun
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location!!! Had a very large room with a 8'x20' balcony for 80 euros per night...What a deal!!! All staff we came in contact with were very friendly and helpful!!! We would definately stay there again!! Now the "but".....It should be noted that I withnessed an argument between an American woman and the hotel manager on Sunday February 19th....The woman was disputing the telephone charges on her bill....Seems she made a 10 minute call from her room at a rate of 36 euros per minute!!! Thats right folks....36 euros per MINUTE!!!! The hotel manager ..although polite simply told her that was the rate...I went back to my room and looked....NOWHERE is there ANY information on what the rates are should you use the phone. Now, my partner and I are well traveled and know that one should NEVER use a hotel room phone for outgoing calls ...especially in a foreign country...But come on...36 euros a minute???? I wouldn't have beleived it had I not heard it myself!!...Bottom line...great place...just stay away from the phone! :)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: nedben
Reviews.Content: Four globe trotters travelled to Amsterdam in February 2006 and found there a superbly warm, welcoming and very friendly hotel. Both couples had wonderful rooms on different floors. All of the staff were very attentive, nothing was too much trouble. On the Saturday evening of our stay we had lovely meal in the Hotels restaurant, the choice and the quality of food was absolutely fabulous. In conclusion a "Great Hotel" comes heartily recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: CMRMidlandsUK
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Amsterdam with our 2 friends, from Friday 17 Feb till Sunday 19th. We found the hotel to be just what we wanted. Friendly Staff, good rooms with soft beds, hot water, to fill the large bath tub. Location is good (use tram 1, 2 5 or 11 from Central Station) Sauna, good. Breakfast on the high side at â‚¬20 but plenty of eating-places to hand. Dinner in the American Restaurant spot on. (Nicely presented food, in the 1920 surroundings) To sum up, great for the cost, staff wanted to help.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room for money”
Reviews.Author: jen_ros19
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights. I did not spend much time here as it wasnt as central as thought. I was a very very small room and our friends had this problem too. Quite out dates and looking out onto a building site accross the road. The window didnt open or close with ease. We had to ring down to get a kettle. The bathroom was dusty. If staying here do not stay on the 1st floor. Other rooms where better. It was expensive for the type of room we got. Def not 5 stars or even 4.

Reviews.Title: “Kooky Design - Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although I do not agree with their design aesthetic and that is important to me, I was extremely pleased with this hotel. It's location was perfect for daytime shopping and nighttime clubbing. About a 20-30 minute walk max to anything and much closer for most. Good sheets, comfy pillows, big flat screen TVs with a closed circuit camera fixed on the Leidseplein which is absolutely hypnotic - even more so after stopping by a coffeshop. Highly recommended - especially if you can get for a discount rate (I got in at 110 Euro/night).

Reviews.Title: “Good rate for the room”
Reviews.Author: R.Denton
Reviews.Content: Was greeted by friendly concierge, and the bags were taken to the room while we checked in, the room was clean and spacious, and the bed large and comfortable. Th only problem with the bed was instead of one large sheet, there were two smaller ones, meaning snuggling up to your partner was awkward. There was however, slight noise from the room above, and the outside even when the windows were closed, but nothing to prevent us from sleeping. I ordered room service at some point in the wee hours after returning from a night out with chronic munchies, and the gebak (cake) and the pizza we ordered from the night menu were actually quite reasonable in terms of room service cost, and fair size portions, not to mention good food. All in all, I would be more than happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not the best ....”
Reviews.Author: magvictoria
Reviews.Content: After staying in Swissotel on Dam Sq. we spent 2 nights in American Hotel. We got a spacious twin-room with a canal view. I really liked the room. The bathroom was rahter small but modern and clean. We had breakfast - it's really excellent for the price. At the check-out I noticed that we were charged about 60 Eu for telephone calls. We used IP card wich is supposed to have free outline connection. But the receptionist said with a smile that they charge every!! outline connection 2 Eu. So you have to pay for every attempt to dial the number. It was rather disappointing thing because that trip we stayed in 2 more hotels and never heard about such a connection charge. On the last evening I asked the consierge to book airport shuttle seats for us. And in the morning while we were having breakfast the bus left (10 minutes earlier ) without us. We had to wait for about 20 minutes more...Is it 5 stars hotel?? But I would recommend this hotel to those who like the location and nice canal views.

Reviews.Title: “Funny Smells and unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Sweep
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on business for two nights and I really didn't warm to it. The main problem for me, and when checked for some of my colleagues, was that our rooms smelt really musty - kind of damp and old. I also found the staff to be quite off-hand and not particularly accommodating which was odd considering we were having a conference there and spending quite a bit of money.
