On checking out they messed my bill up and made me so late i had to run for my plane. We will not be using them again. I'm sure this hotel is fine for a budget, city break but don't stay if you expect business class facilities (they don't have this level of service or support) and don't stay if you like luxury or glamour - it's really quite basic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: tiaUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights over Christmas. Must admit...we were a bit anxious after all the recent reviews on this hotel. However, when we got there at 9.00am the staff were extremely helpful and we had no problems checking in early. There was a slight musty smell as you step out of the lift. Our room was modern with a great view and was spotless with a plasma TV. The hotel is within easy reach of all the major bars, restaurants and tram routes. The Sports bar across the road is brilliant for breakfast. If you do not enjoy museums, do not take the boat trip located outside the hotel. Its a waste of 2 hours. We were very pleased with the service we got and would definitely stay at this hotel again. P.S. Do not believe a word the concierge tells you as it seems like he is on commission for everything. Get our own facts for the tourist information down the road.

Reviews.Title: “One of Europes Best, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: mfreund72
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have had the privilege to travel to Europe several times and this hotel ranks near the top. Big rooms, great beds, awesome location, and we had a room facing the canal so little noise and a great view. Very close to museums, restaurants, and bars. The Leidse-Plein Square is great for entertainment. The trolley is right out front for travel to Dam Square or Central Station. The staff was friendly and suggested a great excursion for us to take via rail to see Wind Mills, cheese farms, and Clog Making. Average price for what we usually spend in Europe and I have no feedback on breakfast or hotel restaurants as we always ate out. End result, we will stay there again if by chance we make it back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the American”
Reviews.Author: lisha22
Reviews.Content: I was a bit iffy about this hotel because of all the recent reviews, but I loved it. I was there for a total of 4 nights. I stayed for two, went to London for two nights, then I returned for two more nights. They were very kind and even put us in the same room without our asking. I thought that was great.Anyway, the room was very big and very comfortable. Decor was very nice and not outdated!The bathroom was huge with a big soaking tub!The bed was also very big, and it was not two smaller beds put together. I really liked the location of this hotel. Tons of restaurants and pubs to choose from. If your looking to stay near the Red Light District, this is a bit far. Probably a 20-30 minute walk, but it was fine. We actually enjoyed walking to the City Center. The Van Gogh Museum is about a 5 minute walk from here. We didn't get a chance to eat at the American Cafe, but it's beautiful. We ate at the Pancake Bakery one day after visiting the Anne Frank Museum and it was delicious! Don't order the plain pancake, there are so many better choices. Don't be shocked, there not the typical pancakes we Americans are used to! If you're looking to do the canal tour, don't do the night one! Almost half the people on the boat passed out because it was so boring! It's not as romantic, but there's lots more to see during the day. Plus it's half the price. If you have time, I would suggest taking a day trip to one of the beach cities to have some sea food or going out to see the windmills.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend break in Amsterdam and found the American Hotel to be a perfect base. Situated in a quite corner of the Leidseplein the hotel has easy access to number of tram routes and also canal boats. The staff at the hotel were very pleasant and the deluxe room we had on the 5th floor looked very recently redecorated with LCD TV, etc. I would happily stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Sort out the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in this hotel last weekend. the room was OK, comfortable beds but a bit noisy with building works across the road. There was limited tea and coffee provided in the room, but a biscuit or two would be nice. Had to call room service for bath towels and face flannels. We tried the "champagne" breakfast the second day as an alternative to the good value pancake house across the road (spliffs optional but not provided!). Considering that this costs Euro 17.50 each, on top of the fairly high room charge, it does not represent value for money. When we came down at 9.30a.m., most of the "hot" items had gone cold. Not very appetising. We have stayed in Day's Inns in the USA for a third of the price including basic breakfast and better standard rooms. It is time that European hotels stopped ripping customers off.

Reviews.Title: “Eventually excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent, one can walk to all the major attractions. Trams 1,2 or 5 take you directly from Central Station to the hotel. I booked through the Summit hotel website and requested a non-smoking room in a quiet location. On check-in, I was told that my room on the second floor met these requirements. As the room was not ready (it was morning time), I was told to come back later. When I did, I was given another room on the first floor. It was a smoking room and very dark and dreary. So I returned to reception and complained. I was then given another room, a supposedly great room with a balcony. It too was smoking and was dark and dreary. So I returned to reception again and eventually got a super room on third floor. It was really super, modern, quiet, clean, lots of nice to have things etc. One small negative - walls were a bit thin which made me more conscious of love making (I got lucky!) than normal particularly as my neighbour seemed to be in her room all day with the do not disturb sign on. The Cafe at the hotel is a very popular venue, very nice indeed. I didn't take breakfast at the hotel as firstly it was too expensive at 17.50 and secondly, I probably wouldn't be up in time for it. So, in summary, a great hotel once you persevere with getting what you asked for.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly Over-Rated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on a repeat trip to the city. It would be tough to find a better location if you like the buzz of the nightlife. Or art museums. But I was thoroughly disappointed in my room - - it was the size of a small college dorm room. Service was completely average, no one went out of their way. And it was the positive reviews on this site that made me book it in the first place. It's above average (mostly for location), but it's not the "Wow" I expected after reading this site's reviews. And paying that amount! I felt fleeced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Rooms Just OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in October. Based on the reviews I was expecting something a lot nicer when it came to the rooms. The hotel is basically the equivalent of an older Sheraton/Crowne Plaza that is slightly past its prime. We had an upgraded room but I'm not sure what it was upgraded from. The room was large but worn; it definitely needed some updating. The beds were very soft and for me, this was a problem. There were several good things about the hotel. The staff was extremely helpful, providing dining suggestions and making reservations. The concierge even went so far as to serf the web to provide various train schedules. The biggest plus for the hotel (besides the cool bar), is it's location. It is right near the museums and tram lines that will take you all over the city. Plus, given that Amsterdam is a very walkable city, it is an ideal location to walk to all the various attractions the city has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “good location - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: anushka
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. Room was spacious and clean, staff were very helpful and friendly. The Cafe and Bar give the hotel a great atmosphere. The location is very good, plenty of good restaurants, tram stop and canal cruise close by.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the hotel and I would recommend it. When we arrived our room was on the first floor, above the restaurant which was being renovated. We asked to be moved, due to noise and received an upgraded room for no extra charge. Staff were all very friendly and when we asked at reception for a missing remote control it was in the room by the time we travelled up in the lift! The breakfasts were amazing, including free champagne and there were daily newsheets for various nationalities. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel the last week of August. Booked the hotel on the net so was a bit wary, however, I could not have been happier. The location of this hotel is excellent, near bars, restaurants, shops and Vondel Park. The hotel itself was fantastic. The rooms were great- comfy beds, ideal bathroom & of course not forgetting the mini-bar! The restaurant and bar food were both great, the bar also had an extensive cocktail list. Breakfast is an occasion not to be missed- everything you could possibly want, nothing like champagne to start the day! Have stayed in Amsterdam five times before but this was my first time in this hotel. One thing for sure is it won't be my last- I can't wait to return! Many thanks to the cheerful & friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel right on a canal”
Reviews.Author: Jon Potter
Reviews.Content: Our room (112) was surprisingly large and nicely decorated, with a reasonably comfortable bed and a lovely view of the canal. Bathroom was large and modern. Minibar is fully automatic which means you can't take anything out without paying for it - and therefore can't put your own things in. Wireless internet available at a price. Nice buffet breakfast available in art-deco restaurant, EUR 17.50. Our room was reasonably quiet - a bit of noise from the street but the double-glazing was quite effective. The hotel staff were very friendly and completely fluent in English, as all Dutch seem to be. The hotel's location was very well located for trams, bars, cafes and restaurants, being so very close to leidseplein. It was also an easy & pleasant walk to the Rijksmuseum. Very good value overall!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, better location!”
Reviews.Author: ToddWebb
Reviews.Content: Of the 4 hotels we stayed in, this was our favorite. But all hotels were about equal quality and each had it's own unique quirks. Some quirks were more annoying than others, but none ruined our trip or our hotel experience. The best thing about this hotel, above the others, is location. Leidesplein was the greatest location possible! Like every other hotel, the staff were super-friendly and helpful. But the Hotel American definately had a more "moderm," more "Americanized" feel to it. If I return to Amsterdam, this hotel is the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed...”
Reviews.Author: NeilSherwood
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have stayed in numerous hotels in Amsterdam, and this was the most modern hotel so far. We stayed in a lovely big room on the fifth floor which looked like it had been recently refurbished to a very high standard. The bathroom was very modern and clean, and the room itself was fitted with attractive and contemporary fittings, especially the bed which was extremely comfy and helped ease the body after a long day of wandering the canals! Considering I am usually very unimpressed with the standard of hotel rooms in Europe, the fact I was taken by this one is very high praise indeed! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner Stuart and I recently visited this wonderful hotel for a four night break in Amsterdam. Being an art lover I loved the art nouveau details present as soon as we walked in. We had a deluxe room which was lovely, very spacious with art nouveau detailing. All mod cons present, great coffee machine, fully stocked mini bar, and a great jet shower which puts ours at home to shame! The canal views were lovely and the location of the hotel was perfect, a stones throw from great bars and restaurants and the towns shops. The first night we ate in the hotel restaurant, it was gorgeous; beautiful food and surroundings again lovingly detailed with soft live music playing in the background. But the best was yet to come... ...We often went for drinks in the hotels cafe american; a great art deco bar with a reputation for attracting a rock star cliental, indeed the walls are lined with the famous stars the bar has attracted. In fact we saw Paul Weller the very first night! (I dismissed this at first but it was confirmed the next night by one of the bar staff!) A really friendly bar staff made us feel very welcome and even remembered our favourite drinks when we came back. A very relaxed vibe and a great place to eat too; whether you are after a big meal or snacks. All the staff were very welcoming and helpful, and it is definitely somewhere which we will pay another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It...”
Reviews.Author: Middle-aged-man45
Reviews.Content: We got an excellent rate online which included breakfast (a must!) We could not have been more pleased with the hotel and staff. The rooms and hallways are a bit dated, but they are spotless and have many amenities. Special compliments to both the reception and housekeeping staff which made the difference in our rating the hotel a 5 rather than 4.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with the Amsterdam American.”
Reviews.Author: MollyB
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed here on June 17, 2005. We were very glad we chose this hotel. We arrived early in the morning and our room was not available yet. Our luggage was stored for us and we were shown to the Cafe where we had refreshments while the room was being readied. I had requested a non-smoking room with a balcony and was given just that. It also overlooked a lovely canal. The bed was large and so comfortable the three of us were able to share the bed and have a wonderful night's sleep. The bathroom was a nice size, very clean and had a good shower. The room itself was large and also very clean. I liked the way the room was furnished. Our favorite part of the hotel was the Cafe Americain. Our room rate included breakfast and it was served there. A beautiful place to eat and enjoy a wonderful array of food and drink, including champagne. The coffee was honestly the best I have ever tasted. We enjoyed the atmosphere so much we decided to have dinner there as well. We tried two vegetarian dishes and both were delightful. Service there was very efficient and helpful. When I asked our waiter a question about the architecture of the hotel, he gave me a large packet of information on the hotel and its history. When I asked if there was a postcard available of the hotel, the front desk found a beautiful one done in pen and ink for me. The concierge was always available and at the ready with our luggage and a cab when it was time to check out. The location of the hotel could not be better. Situated in a fun and vibrant area of the city, it was also very quiet at night and within walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights celebrating my 50th birthday. We were on the top floor down a poky corridor. On our arrival, we had to pass trolleys of dirty linen & used trays in the corridor, not very 5*. Although our rooms were spotless, you could not swing a cat in the bathroom & you had the feeling of being in an attic room. We were looking forward to our breakfast & needed a table for 4. We were not shown to a table & every time we tried to sit at 1, we were ushered away by rude staff. Eventually we found a table. The service was appalling, we had to keep clearing our own table & asking for things. The few staff were rushed off their feet & no Manager in sight. We were told they were short staffed. Compliments to the young lad doing the omelettes. When we complained to the Reception, we just got a gushing apology. Won't be staying again which is a shame as the location was good & most of the staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “loved the american”
Reviews.Author: ansell
Reviews.Content: We checked into the american, after a terrible experience at the hotel vondel. We expllained to the barman, in the bar americain, how terrible our hotel was, and he showed us through to the reception, and explained in dutch what had happened. THe receptionist then offered us a discounted room rate(160euros per night). Which although expensive was well worth every penny. Our room was fantastic, with a bed the size of a football pitch. The staff were friendly, and welcoming, and the reception and concierge were delightful. The facilities-gym, sauna, were excellent, and there was excellent room service, and batrobes in every room. They had everything you could need(I had forgotten my adapter, and one was sent up in minutes). The restaurant was very elegant, and although a little pricey, it is worth having breakfast at least once, if only for the choice of food. The bar is friendly, and serves an excellent strawberry daquiri, or a long island iced tea. I would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel close to many bars and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Friday to Saturday at the Amsterdam American Hotel. The hotel is a stones throw from Leidseplein (which has many bars and restaurants and also close to the Holland Casino and Hard Rock Cafe). We really enjoyed our stay there. The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel has a beautiful restaurant-but we did not eat there. Our room was very nice (Americans: it is not the 5 star we are used too,but it was nice just the same). We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: superstupot
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels ive stayed in. From the moment we arrived the staff were friendly speaking very good english. They let us check in early at 10-30 am which was very useful. The rooms were larger than expected, and very clean and well presented. At no point during our two night stay did we eat in the hotel but we did have a few drinks in the bar, it was amazing to sit in the bar and look at all the celebrities who have visited the hotel. Finally the location is outstanding, it is in one of the main squares about 10 mins walk from central station. Would recommend to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Deco Delight...have the full breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: DumDumBoy
Reviews.Content: Just come back from three nights at the Americain (well, that's how they spell it outside the restaurant!) as a Valentine break. What a perfect hotel. The location is a little away from the central drag but that is only a plus. Positioned to one side of the Leidseplein (busy tram junction, restaurants and cinemas) this is a lovely, quiet retreat. We had a room on the 2nd floor overlooking the canal. The rooms aren't huge (but then you don't check into a hotel to spend all day in the room!) but they aren't cramped. Very clean, the bathrooms are also compact, neat and clean (once again unless you're planning on soaking for three days...) But let's cut to the chase...what sets this hotel apart are the bar and the cafe (seems to small a word for the size of the room!) The Bar is discreet and charming, the cocktails award-winning (ask for the margarita - it isn't on the menu list but it was no hassle for our barman!) but the crowning glory is the Cafe Americain. A huge vaulted-ceiling greets you as you step throught the doors...stain-glass and original art deco lamps...and a giant breakfast counter. From Chilled Champagne to fresh fish, Full english breakfast to European breads...it's all here! There is simply no finer way to start the day... Having checked out a few of the other recommended hotels, there's no question THIS is where we'll be coming back to in June for an exhibition at the Van Gogh Museum...oh, did I not mention how close the hotel is to all the Major mnuseums?.....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the weekend before xmas for 3 nights, arrived at about 9.00am, as we booked an early cheap flight with easyjet, weren't meant to be checking in until 2.00pm, but reception made us very welcome, showed us a room to chill out in until our room was ready, dropped the luggage off & then had a walk around Amsterdam. Wow, what a beautiful city! - Anyway when I returned back to the hotel, I was shown to my room, firstly, it smelt of smoke, secondly, view was awful. I asked reception if there was anything he could do. It was my girlfriends 30th b'day (hence the w/end trip) & I made sure reception knew this! He then gave me one of the nicest rooms in the hotel for no extra charge, with a beautiful view overlooking the canal! Staff extremely helpful, didn't eat at the restaurant as looked expensive & I like to eat out in town, though coffee was nice there in the morning & also the cocktail bar was a nice place to start your evening out. Basically this hotel is very art deco, & some of the rooms are a bit groggy, but there are obviously some beautiful rooms too. I would recommend anyone to stay here, but as I always do - make sure you ask to change rooms! You never know whats available so long as your polite. I'm amazed how many people on this website write a review slagging a hotel room off who never actually asked to move rooms - if you dont ask you dont get - hotel receptions assume everyone is happy unless they are told otherwise!!! I hope you find this review helpful!!! Dennis.

Reviews.Title: “Misery”
Reviews.Author: pussycat022
Reviews.Content: Misery is the only word to describe this hotel. When my wife and I arrived we knew we were in for problems as the outside carpeting was shabby and littered. The room was narrow and the bathroom lacked all the amenities you would expect in a hotel that charges what they do. The towels were worn. When we complained we were given another room that was equally appalling. The pillows, if they could be called pillows were flat, flatter than a pancake. Since it was hot and humid we lowered the thermostat. This did absolutely nothing. We feel that the temperature is probably controlled by the hotel. After a night of sweating on rough and worn out sheets we were more than glad to pay the hotel the 100 euro penalty that we had unforntunately agreed to when taking the room. The penalty was for early check out as we had planned to stay three nights. I wonder how many other people have taken the loss for early checkout. AVOID THIS HOTEL. THIS HOTEL DOES NOT EVEN RATE ONE STAR

Reviews.Title: “Living on past reputation”
Reviews.Author: RJM62
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel over New Year. Although the rooms and decor are appropriate for a 5 Star Hotel, the service is very poor generally. They also turn the air conditioning in the rooms off in the winter, if the room gets warm as it did during our stay-tough luck-open the window! Service in the restuarant and bar was very patchy, so we took our business elsewhere. As a frequent visitor to Amsterdam, this is one of the most disappointing hotels I have stayed in. Would not return UK resident

Reviews.Title: “Can beat place this for the money!!”
Reviews.Author: CEDFR
Reviews.Content: As a somewhat frequent visitor to Amsterdam, I have finally found a hotel that is relatively inexpensive and terrific. The hotel is centrally located in Amsterdam and is very clean and renovated within the past few years. The room we stayed in was large, clean and very comfortable. It is a close to a luxury hotel as you can get without the off-the-charts prices of some of them that we have stayed at. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Amsterdam. There is no complementary breakfast but you wont be hungry with all the pastry shops and restaurants nearby. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights in the Crowne Plaza American and would recommend it. The best thing about this hotel is the location, just off the Leidseplein and 10 minutes walk from the Museumplein! Reading the other reviews here is seems the room types vary greatly; our standard room was spacious by Amsterdam standards (I've stayed in a number of hotels in the city), it was well equiped and overlooked the canal. Breakfast is excellent, it's cheaper to book B&B rather than pay the â‚¬17.50 each day. Staff in general were pleasant and helpful, we didn't have any specific requests but I imagine they would have been dealt with promptly. The bar is okay, there's much nicer bars to sit and watch the world go by but it's fine for a drink before heading out. One word of warning, the bar has a resident mouse! He appears each evening once the bar is quiet, staff are aware of his existence but make no move to remove him. It didn't bother me but it might bother some people.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place!”
Reviews.Author: gordie 123
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after a wonderful 4 day break in Amsterdam and can only rave about "The Americain". Staff were helpful and friendly, particulary in the bar, where you can while the time away people watching. We asked for highroom with canal view which is what we got. Room spotless, well equiped and quiet. Location is great, handy for trams, museums, good bars and eating places all on the doorstep but just far away from the real biz at Centraal Station area. Have no hesitation in recommending. We booked via their own website and got a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but room could have been better.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the American for 3 nights over August bank holiday this year. We booked direct with the hotel as they had the best rate and we chose a superior room. Check-in was fine and we got a drink voucher and some chocolates for being Priority club members! The room, however, was disappointing. We requested a canal view because we had read in other reviews that the square can be noisy. We didn't get either. What we got was a room with only two small windows which both opened onto a small gap between our bit of the hotel and the other bit. So we could look directly into other people's rooms and they could see us! Because the windows were quite small and the buidling next door being so close we didn't get much natural light so the room felt a bit dingy. For a superior room I thought it was a bit small and odd-shaped (we were right at the end of the corridor). The furnishings were nice and the bed was comfy, and everything was nice and clean though. The bathroom didn't have a window which I hoped it would as it was on an exterior wall. It was ok sized but definitely not superior. To be fair, we didn't complain and didn't asked to be moved as I knew we wouldn't be spending much time in the room so maybe we could have moved rooms. All this aside, the hotel is nice and very well-located. You can walk to all the attractions (some are 20 mins or so away but the walk is very pleasant as there's so much to see). The trams stop outside too so its very easy to get around. The breakfast was graet! I think it was about Â£8 but its a massive buffet and there's even Champagne included! I would reccommend the hotel and I would stay there again but I would ask to be moved if I got that sort of room again as it wasn't worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great architecture, great location,”
Reviews.Author: indigor
Reviews.Content: Generally very good,got off the museum boat from the central station and into hotel. Only downside was that we'd asked for a non smoking room and got a rather small room that stunk of tobacco. Otherwise the room was fine wonderful stained glass. The Cafe American is spectacular! Amazing art nuveau /secessionist with stained glass birds, mediaval knights, parasol light fittings. We ate there the first night and for 30 Euros had a very good 3 course meal with a canal trip included. I thought it was excellent value. Afternoon tea good too. Staff very pleasant. You could walk to the museums or up into all the central shops and to the 9 streets shopping, the bloomenmarkt, buy flowers there not at the airport. 50 tulips for 5 euros even in November.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay and great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Crown Plaza American and loved. Location is the best in AMS. Staff was courteous/delightful and room was surpsingly large for a European hotel. I was upgraded to a room with my own private balcony overlooking the city. Everything in AMS is a 10 minute walk from the hotel. Breakfast buffet was steep at 18euro but had tons of options. Visited the Swisshotel while there and more pleased with Crown Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “More attention neeeded”
Reviews.Author: AngelosLondon
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Crowne Plaza city centre, I thought I'd try the American. As an Ambassador card holder, I was upgraded to a room with two queen beds in it and I had a few freebies, like fruit, water and those famous Dutch biscuits! The problem were that the furniture and bedding seemed a bit too worn out and I won't even describe how stained the bed cover was! In future I will probably stay elsewhere..

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam Awsome City, Hotel not quite”
Reviews.Author: mozzyd
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed over the august bank holiday weekend for 4 nights. The city is great, definately buy the amsterdam pass, great value. The hotel on the other hand did not quite measure up to expectations. We had a double superior room facing the theatre. I had read previous reviews which did say it could be noisy but did not find it disturbing. The room was small but very clean (unfortunately the hotel was full so no room change). There was no double duvet (2 singles) one pillow each (had to request 2 more). The lifts are slow but remember it is a listed building. We did enjoy the breakfast, slightly expensive but great surroundings and no need to eat until dinner! The food is excellent both breakfast and dinner! The customer service side was better on the day shift whereas the night shift were slightly off. I think some of the mainly American and Japanese guests did not get the relaxed atmosphere and approach of the restaurant staff to service. Don't eat there if you want a quick bite. The restaurant staff were always attentive and couldn't do enough for you, a definate asset. Try the bar cocktails were average prices (you never know some rich American may buy you a drink! yes someone bought a round for the whole bar, most generous of him!). To sum up Amsterdam is a great city but i think better "value" can be obtained elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Blows!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved celebrating Queen's Day in Amsterdam this year. The locals are beautiful! The Crowne Plaza American Hotel is in a terrific location- central to all shuttles but the hotel staff was not helpful. We had huge problems checking in. Due to travel delays we were charded full price for two hotel rooms (440 euros!) even though they rented both rooms out. Our rooms weren't available even though we were charged full price. We were never able to talk to a manager even though we stayed 4 nights. Six hours later we were shown 3 small, dark rooms before given a suitable room. We we not given our free drink coupons as members of the Priority Club. No concierge was ever available and the staff couldn't assist when you really needed help with reservations. Local calls were $5. We took a side trip to Brussells and returned to Amsterdam but chose a smaller local hotel over Rookies Coffee Shop ( 1 block away). They included breakfast for half the price and loved the personal service. Lesson learned: take the stairs and save tons of cash!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: RainsLondon
Reviews.Content: Having taken advice from a good friend I checked tripadvisor for the hotel I booked, having read the reviews I promptly cancelled my booking and re-booked using tripadvisor has my guide. (THANK YOU). I took my partner to Amsterdam for his 40th Birthday, the Crowne Plaza was in a excellent location, the room was very clean and modern as per the hotel website, staff were very helpful especially when I requested a room change to one with a cancel view, however the view was lovely and the room very spacious but the furniture wasn't modern so we changed back to our original room which was very quiet but lovely with no fuss from the lovely girl on reception. The breakfast was lovely with lots to eat which amazed me since in Europe you just get a continental breakfast. My partner really enjoyed his stay I can't comment on the dinner but on reading the menu the price did seem expensive. I would recommend this hotel but would state that you read everything in your rooms before removing items from the mini bar since this is charged directly to your account.(I made this mistake, but it was quickly rectified at reception with no fuss.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: maryobfl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Crowne 10 nights in August 2004. The location was perfect. The rooms were very clean. The staff very friendly. They had one of our rooms ready 2 hours early. We have stayed in Amsterdam before and knew we wanted to stay near Leidseplein this time. The only complaint we had was that we would have liked to have a refrigerator instead of the mini bar. The food at the hotel was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good for a European Hotel; Some Problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel two nights in August 2004. We enjoyed our stay. Location is excellent. The room was very good, and had a balcony facing the canal. The breakfast buffet was superb. I would recommend this hotel to friends. Having said that, some minor problems that are worth mentioning: (1) We arrived on Wednesday at 14:30, and our room was not ready yet for check-in. (2) The next day, we went out of the hotel at 08:30, and came back at 14:30 to rest -- and this six-hour period was not sufficient for the hotel to clean our room. (3) Elevators are slow, and we got stuck inside them twice within two days (only for a short period -- but a scary feeling).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our Anniversary last year and it's a nice modern hotel. We were upgraded to a corner suite with a golf putter (!) and the room was very nice too. The breakfast choice is also very good and worth the visit - it's own bar is also very nice. It's very conveniently located near bars, restaurants, museums, parks, etc. There is a bus service that takes you to/from Schipol airport (Just over the road) which is excellent value. [We also had a goldfish in the room when we got there, but it died 2 hours after we got there - Definitely not sleeping then!) Recommended if you can get there.

HotelInfo.Name: Amsterdam American Hotel - Hampshire Eden
HotelInfo.Address: Leidsekade 97, Amsterdam 1017 PN, The Netherlands
